report.summary: Select first row of notifications after refresh on tablet
report.label: bug
report.description: After notifications loads for the first time, and user is on a tablet, the first row should be selected so that the detail view is loaded with content.

report.summary: Funky chars around comment reply
report.label: bug
report.description: This is on a Nexus 7 on 4.1: http://cl.ly/image/3K0X051Y2L18

report.summary: Images that aren't able to load show the WordPress logo placeholder
report.label: bug
report.description: The placeholder used for the note comment view is the WP logo. If the image is private or fails to load for any reason, the WP logo will just hang around. We should have a better placeholder image as well as handle the image load fail better.

report.summary: Reader crashes on xlarge device in landscape
report.label: bug
report.description: If you tap on a post, only on xlarge device in landscape, the app force closes. Has to do with the menu drawer icon not existing.

report.summary: NotificationsActivity Crash
report.label: bug

report.label: bug
report.description: java.lang.IllegalStateException: sender id not set on constructor at com.google.android.gcm.GCMBaseIntentService.getSenderIds(GCMBaseIntentService.java:125) at com.google.android.gcm.GCMBaseIntentService.onHandleIntent(GCMBaseIntentService.java:237) at android.app.IntentService$ServiceHandler.handleMessage(IntentService.java:59) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:123) at android.os.HandlerThread.run(HandlerThread.java:60)

report.label: bug

report.label: bug
report.description: java.lang.RuntimeException: An error occured while executing doInBackground() at android.os.AsyncTask$3.done(AsyncTask.java:278) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerSetException(FutureTask.java:273) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.setException(FutureTask.java:124) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:307) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:137) at android.os.AsyncTask$SerialExecutor$1.run(AsyncTask.java:208) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1076) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:569) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:856) Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException at org.wordpress.android.ui.reader.ReaderImplFragment$loadReaderTask.doInBackground(ReaderImplFragment.java:221) at org.wordpress.android.ui.reader.ReaderImplFragment$loadReaderTask.doInBackground(ReaderImplFragment.java:181) at android.os.AsyncTask$2.call(AsyncTask.java:264) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:305) ... 5 more

report.summary: FollowRow NPE
report.label: bug
report.description: java.lang.NullPointerException at org.wordpress.android.ui.notifications.FollowRow.isSiteId(FollowRow.java:136) at org.wordpress.android.ui.notifications.FollowListener$FollowResponseHandler.onResponse(FollowListener.java:39) at org.wordpress.android.ui.notifications.FollowListener$FollowResponseHandler.onResponse(FollowListener.java:27) at com.wordpress.rest.RestRequest.deliverResponse(RestRequest.java:60) at com.wordpress.rest.RestRequest.deliverResponse(RestRequest.java:17) at com.android.volley.ExecutorDelivery$ResponseDeliveryRunnable.run(ExecutorDelivery.java:99) at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:587) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:92) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:138) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:3701) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:507) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:878) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:636) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)

report.summary: JSONUtil NPE
report.label: bug
report.description: java.lang.NullPointerException at org.wordpress.android.util.JSONUtil.queryJSON(JSONUtil.java:51) at org.wordpress.android.models.Note.buildReply(Note.java:132) at org.wordpress.android.ui.notifications.NoteCommentFragment$3.onReply(NoteCommentFragment.java:249) at org.wordpress.android.ui.notifications.ReplyField$1.onClick(ReplyField.java:62) at android.view.View.performClick(View.java:3652) at android.view.View$PerformClick.run(View.java:14354) at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:605) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:92) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:137) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:4512) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:511) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:794) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:561) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)

report.summary: Refreshing posts after discarding changes still prompts you about unsaved changes.
report.label: bug
report.description: On the Nexus 7. Steps to reproduce: In the post detail panel, tap to edit a post. Make a change (or not) and hit the back button to return to the post list. Choose "Discard" when prompted to save your changes. Back on the post list, tap to refresh the list. You're prompted that you have local changes, even though you just discarded them.

report.summary: Refreshing the categories list forgets categories that were just checked.
report.label: bug
report.description: If I check a few new categories in the list, then refresh the list, the categories I just checked are forgotten.

report.summary: The parent category list under Add New Category is missing the step graphic
report.label: bug
report.description: Go to the categories list and tap to add a new category. Tap to open the parent category list. Child categories are indented but do not show the "step" graphic that is shown on the main categories list.

report.summary: A category containing a comma shows up as two categories on the edit screen.
report.label: bug
report.description: If I have the category "marco,polo", it shows up as a single category on the category list, but as two categories: "marco" and "polo" on the post editor. Fun fact: You can create categories that include a comma :)

report.summary: Blank categories are displayed in the category list but not on the edit screen.
report.label: bug
report.description: Edge case. It is possible to have a category that is whitespace, and that category can have child categories. The categories list displays these correctly, however the whitespace category is not displayed on the edit screen when checked.

report.summary: Edit screen forgets scroll position when returning from categories list
report.label: bug
report.description: When returning from the categories list I'm always taken back to the top of the post editor. It would be better if it kept the scroll offset so I can see the categories I just added. Nexus 7.

report.summary: Formatting bar lingers after dismissing keyboard
report.label: bug
report.description: On the post editor, tap to edit content. Dismiss the keyboard. Notice that the formatting bar is not visible. Scroll down a little bit. Now the formatting bar is back. Tapping the buttons inserts markup where the cursor last appeared in the content view.

report.summary: Post can loose a category if its not in the category list when categories are added.
report.label: bug
report.description: Another edge case most likely. Add a new category to a post via the web admin. In the app, refresh the post list. Edit the post. Notice the category you added via the admin is included in the posts categories. Tap the + button to add a new category. Without refreshing the category list, tap the back button. Since the new category did not exist in the apps copy of the category list it was removed from the post. If you let the category list refresh before returning to the post editor the category will be retained.

report.summary: Creating a new category does not automatically add it
report.label: bug
report.description: If I create a new category from within the app it seems like it should be checked in the categories list by default. It shows up unchecked.

report.summary: NPE in CategoryNode
report.label: bug
report.description: @maxme any thoughts on this one? java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to start activity ComponentInfo{org.wordpress.android/org.wordpress.android.ui.posts.SelectCategoriesActivity}: java.lang.NullPointerException at android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2211) at android.app.ActivityThread.handleLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2261) at android.app.ActivityThread.access$600(ActivityThread.java:141) at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage(ActivityThread.java:1256) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:137) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5103) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:525) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:737) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:553) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method) Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException at org.wordpress.android.models.CategoryNode.createCategoryTreeFromDB(CategoryNode.java:84) at org.wordpress.android.ui.posts.SelectCategoriesActivity.populateOrFetchCategories(SelectCategoriesActivity.java:99) at org.wordpress.android.ui.posts.SelectCategoriesActivity.onCreate(SelectCategoriesActivity.java:75) at android.app.Activity.performCreate(Activity.java:5133) at android.app.Instrumentation.callActivityOnCreate(Instrumentation.java:1087) at android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2175) ... 11 more

report.summary: Categories in quotes causes a f/c
report.label: bug
report.description: If you have a category with quotes like "Cars" it will force close when refreshing the categories.

report.summary: Featured image assigned to multiple posts?
report.label: bug
report.description: Unconfirmed user report: I noticed that setting the featured image in the app will sometimes set it for multiple posts... I notice it more when I have multiple posts pending or if I update a post to add an image.

report.summary: Text Overlap in Post Editor
report.label: bug
report.description: Our app is plagued with this issue on JellyBean: https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=38770 We need to set the EditPostActivity to not be hardware accelerated to fix it I think.

report.summary: Reader: detail view stays at current scroll position
report.label: bug
report.description: User report: If I read a long post and scroll down a bunch, when I go to the next post, it drops me off near the bottom of that post – as if it’s matching up the position of the previous post.

report.summary: EXIF Data for Resized Images
report.label: bug
report.description: EXIF data isn't being preserved for image thumbnails: ​http://android.forums.wordpress.org/topic/rfe-preserve-exif-information-in-attached-images

report.summary: Unusable slider for image size in the editor
report.label: bug
report.description: as mentionned here ​http://androiddevel.wordpress.com/2012/01/23/heres-whats-on-the-list-for-2-0-5/#comment-7908 As the default image size currently doesn't work (it always uploads pictures à 500px), we have to change the size of the uploaded media in the text editor, by taping on the picture. There's a slider for that purpose. The slider is not really precise if you're not a kid with tiny fingers. A spinner or even a text field would be really better. Even if i have a big screen (4.3"), it takes at least 30 seconds before i can make my picture 960px wide (it always fall on 940px, or 970px when i remove my finger), whereas it would take like 2 seconds with a spinner or a text field.

report.summary: Loading the Dashboard should support HTTP auth
report.label: bug
report.description: If a user taps the Dashboard button and their site uses http auth, the load will fail.

report.summary: Posts containing umlats are incorrectly parsed.
report.label: bug
report.description: As reported by a memember: "because it cuts posts with "Umlaut" like äüö and so on at their first appearance and drops the rest even in the editor..." Confirmed using the same characters on a test blog. Only the content in the post preceding the ä umlat character was displayed both in the preview and in the editor.

report.summary: Trapped on the configure blog screen.
report.label: bug
report.description: When adding a self hosted blog on a spotty wifi connection you can get trapped on the "Attempting to configure blog" screen for a long period of time. It might make sense to make this dismissable and let the user reattempt to add the blog with a better connection, or another time, than be stuck waiting for the call to timeout/finish.

report.summary: Web view in the reader gets stuck in a loading loop
report.label: bug
report.description: From a fresh install of the app go to the reader. Be sure to have subscribed to several blogs. Tap a story from a blog in the list. On the story detail, tap the blog's title link to open the blog in an in-app browser. If this is the first time you have looked at this blog you will see a tiny blue loading bar at the top of the page repeatedly filling over and over like the page is in a loading loop. Tap the back button. Tap on the blog's title again. This time the blog loads. This seems to happen the first time you view a blog in the reader. Nexus One / 2.3.6 Video of the loading bar. The video quality isn't that great but maybe you can make out the loading bar at the top of the view. ​http://videos.videopress.com/v5N5ALGx/20120814-103511_dvd.mp4

report.summary: Quick Video progress is unclear
report.label: bug
report.description: Testing quick video with a short 2 second video. From the posts lists, tap to show the dashboard and choose quick video When I hit publish I'm taken back to the posts list. I see my quick video post under local drafts and sometimes I see the activity spinner spinning. If I'm patient, I'll see the spinner start (possibly a second time) and the quick photo post will finally move out of the local drafts and into the posts list. If I choose quick video from the dashboard (and without posts in the background) I don't see any indication of progress. If I return to the posts list at this point I don't see a local draft, but if I refresh the successfully uploaded quick video appears after the sync. This is mostly a UX issue where there is a couple of points where it is unclear what is happening with the quick video I took. Nexus One / 2.3.6

report.summary: Quick Video posts are empty
report.label: bug
report.description: Went back to look at my quick video posts in a browser and noticed that they were all empty. Tried another post via the app and it was empty too. The blog I was testing with does not use video press if that makes a difference. Nexus One / 2.3.6

report.summary: Sharing a link sometimes strips the anchor tag
report.label: bug
report.description: A user has reported that sharing a link from the browser to the app will sometimes strip the anchor tag, so the link isn't clickable.

report.summary: Blog URLs with umlauts may break the app
report.label: bug
report.description: Originally reported by a user, the use of umlauts such as ü, ä, ö may render the app unusable - you can't add the blog to the app. Using the full untranslated URL doesn't seem to help (e.g. "​http://xn--bcher-kva.de/" for "​http://bücher.de"). More investigation required.

report.summary: Comment Count Incorrect in the Reader
report.label: bug
report.description: When viewing a list of posts in the reader, the comment count of any individual post seems to be 1 less than the actual comment count.

report.summary: Editing a Post with 'More' tag causes extra whitespace
report.label: bug
report.description: Unconfirmed, from user email: When editing a post with the --more-- tag in it, each time it's opened extra white space is added before and after. As this affects how the post is formatted when viewed in a browser, it has to be fixed every time a minor edit is done. Tested this a bit. I'm not 100% sure this is what the user meant but I noticed that if I have a post content that looks like this in the web editor: This is some text before the more tag Test test This is some text after. it shows up like this in the Android editor: This is some text before the more tag Test test This is some text after. Publishing without removing the carriage returns changes the post layout.

report.summary: Featured images on pages are broken.
report.label: bug
report.description: Edit a page Add an image. Tap the image and check the option to use it as a featured image. Do not check the option to include the image in the content. Publish the page. An image tag for the featured image is included in the post body even though you did not check the option to do this. The image tag is missing a src attribute, and has android-uri="content:// ... " instead.

report.summary: Scroll position appears to be lost when rotating.
report.label: bug
report.description: On the nexus 7 in portrait orientation Go to the post list. Scroll all the way down and load more posts. Rotate to landscape orientation. The posts list is scrolled up a bit making it look like you lost your place. Maybe there is a way to keep the list fully scrolled when rotating?

report.summary: Weird redrawing behavior on the Comment list.
report.label: bug
report.description: On the nexus 7. You'll need multiple browsers installed to see this probably. Go to the comment list On the comment detail, tap the hyperlink for the commenter's website. Dismiss the action modal Watch closely as all the gravatars reload.

report.summary: Post content is truncated on special characters
report.label: bug
report.description: From user support request: When i use the french caracter "é" the publication seems to be done but the article published is truncated.

report.summary: Refreshing comments list forgets the selected comment.
report.label: bug
report.description: Nexus 7, 4.2.2 Go to comments. Tap a comment midway down the list to select it and view it in the detail screen. Refresh the comments list. When the refresh finishes the first comment in the list is selected.

report.summary: Comments list forgets checked items when resuming from background.
report.label: bug
report.description: Nexus 7, 4.2.2 Go to the comments list. Check one or more comments. Notice the moderation options appear. Send the app to the background. Resume the app. Nothing is checked but the moderation options are still visible.

report.summary: Settings screen scroll bar seems out of place.
report.label: bug
report.description: Nexus 7, 4.2.2 On the settings screen, the scroll bar is left of the right side. This creates a visual gap and it looks like the bar is out of place. Also, if its still visible when I tap a cell the cell background color intersects the scroll bar. Can the views be adjusted so the scroll bar is fully right aligned? I can't figure this one out. We're using the SherlockPreferenceActivity, so I'm wondering if it's a bug with ABS. Further research required.

report.summary: Default Image Width select list should resize in response to an orientation change.
report.label: bug
report.description: Nexus 7, 4.2.2 Go to settings. Tap a blog. Expand the dropdown for Default Image Width. Rotate to a different orientation. The select list should resize to match the new orientation.

report.summary: Reader topics list can be empty
report.label: bug
report.description: Nexus 7, 4.2.2. Go to the reader. While its syncing and there is no content visible, tap the ActionBar to invoke the topic list. The list appears centered and empty except for "Topics" as the title. Maybe we should ignore these clicks until the topics list has loaded for the first time.

report.summary: Crash when loading a post with oodles and oodles of text.
report.label: bug
report.description: Nexus 7, 4.2.2 This is probably too impractical to affect many, but documenting here. From a desktop browser, create a new post on your blog with lots and lots of text. I used the full text of Shakespeare's Hamlet from Project Gutenberg. Try to view the post in the app. Crash. So there is probably an upper limit of how much text can be displayed in the post view.

report.summary: Deleting post : confirmation appeared but post was still visible.
report.label: bug
report.description: Nexus 7, 4.2.2 This was a little weird. I tried deleting a post by clicking the trashcan icon. I confirmed I wanted to delete the post. I saw the toast that the post was deleted. However the post was still visible on the screen until the post list refreshed. I think the right UX would be to show the toast after the post was removed.

report.summary: Reader Detail Page can be Blank
report.label: bug
report.description: If you are on a reader detail page, then press home and leave the app for a while, when you return to the app it will load a blank detail view.

report.summary: Reader requires scrolling sometimes to refresh content
report.label: bug
report.description: This is hard to reproduce, but it occasionally happens for me: Load the Reader Change topics See if the list refreshes correctly Sometimes the list won't refresh until I 'dirty' the view by scrolling it.

report.summary: Post Editor: Tapping the back button do dismiss the keyboard changes text fields.
report.label: bug
report.description: Nexus One, 2.3.6 Go to the post editor. Tap in the content field to invoke the keyboard. Tap the back button to dismiss the keyboard. The cursor is now in the title field. Try this with the title and tags fields. Notice the cursor remains in the correct text field after dismissing the keyboard.

report.summary: Menu changes scroll position when switching tabs.
report.label: bug
report.description: Nexus One, 2.3.6 Open the sliding menu. Scroll down to the bottom and tap Dashboard. Reopen the menu, you've been scrolled back to the top. Scroll back down to the bottom of the list. Close the menu. Open the menu again. This time the menu kept its scroll offset.

report.summary: Cancelling post signature does not dismiss the keyboard.
report.label: bug
report.description: Nexus One, 2.3.6 Go to settings. Tap the Post Signature option to edit the text. Tap the cancel button. The modal dismisses but the keyboard remains.

report.summary: Post/Page list loses its place after refreshing.
report.label: bug
report.description: Nexus 7, 4.2.2 Go to the post list Pick an item midway down the list. Refresh the post list and wait for it to finish. The first item is now selected. Page list has the same behavior

report.summary: Image caption appears in the editor after rotating.
report.label: bug
report.description: These are the steps I took, some may not be necessary: Create a new post In the editor add an image, then add another image. Tap the first image and make it featured and include in content, and give it a caption. Tap the second image and give it a caption. Rotate the device. The caption of the second image is now included in the post content.

report.summary: Local drafts linker after publishing and the post list does not refresh.
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce: Create a new post. Make some edits and tap the back button. Choose Save when prompted to save the post as a local draft. Edit the post. Tap the publish button. The post will publish but will remain as a local draft, and the post list does not automatically refresh. Tap refresh. You are prompted that you are about to overwrite local changes. Choose OK. After refreshing the local draft is gone.

report.summary: Login limit reached
report.label: bug
report.description: The app can quickly reach the login limit on WP.com. Investigate where app might be making multiple requests that would cause the limit to be reached. Bail out if first request 403's.

report.summary: Gallery picker is blank if never visited media
report.label: bug
report.description: If you pick from the media gallery before visiting the gallery, it will be blank.

report.summary: Images are crazy tiny after adding from media library
report.label: bug
report.description: Add an image from the media library Observe that it is much smaller than if you would have added from the regular android gallery.

report.summary: Native Reader: Small overlap of action bar and content
report.label: bug
report.description: I'm seeing the transparent action bar overlay the content a bit when the scroll view is scrolled all the way to the top:

report.summary: NUX - back button closes app from sign-in
report.label: bug
report.description: If you tap sign-in when app starts and then tap the back button, the app closes. I expected it to return to the "Welcome to WordPress" screen.

report.summary: Native Reader: 'No articles in this topic' placeholder isn't centered
report.label: bug
report.description: The placeholder text 'No articles in this topic' isn't centered vertically in the Reader.

report.summary: Native Reader: VideoPress support needs work
report.label: bug
report.description: Right now a post with a VideoPress video shows an image of the video without a clickable player overlay.

report.summary: Geotagging Inconsistencies
report.label: bug
report.description: Inconsistency in geotagging in Android: New Post > Geotagging option shows up Send to WordPress from Gallery > Geotagging option does not show up I do the second one most often and have to save the post as draft and re-edit before publishing to get the location added. Two other issues: Draft a post and set my current location, then leave. Return to post from another location and my original location automatically gets overridden. There’s no way to set a location other than the current one (but I think that may go against most use cases of the app so probably okay to not have)

report.summary: Post Editor: Formatting blocks can be applied around images
report.label: bug
report.description: Create a new post Add some text in bold, leave the cursor at the end of the text. Add an image, then save the post as a local draft. Edit the post again, the image will be lost because the bold span wrapped around the entire image.

report.summary: Post editor shows html entities in localized post formats
report.label: bug

report.summary: There is no way to change the post format after publishing
report.label: bug
report.description: Create a new post Set post format to "Audio" Publish Edit this post and change post format to "Standard" Re-Publish Post format is still "Audio" (local and server side)

report.summary: Add duplicate of 'values-he' folder named 'values-iw'
report.label: bug
report.description: Apparently we need to have two folders with the same strings in them in order to support Hebrew properly: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5074769/cyanogenmod-translate-a-project/

report.summary: Remove formatting buttons and app name from strings file
report.label: bug
report.description: We should remove the following values from the strings.xml file, since they aren't needed for translation: app_name underline link strike For the formatting bar text, we can just set the HTML for those in code. Unless the formatting bar buttons can change by locale, not sure about that.

report.summary: Post List: Refresh always prompts about local changes
report.label: bug
report.description: If there is a local draft in the post list, refreshing the post list prompts the user that refreshing will overwrite local changes. This always happens, even when there are no changes since the last refresh. Edit: Edited vs creating a new issue. This is always happening when refreshing the post list on any of my test blogs regardless of if there are local drafts in the list or not. Nexus 7, 2.5 beta 3.

report.summary: Post List: Refreshing post list always selects the first post
report.label: bug
report.description: To reproduce: Tap to select a post other than the first in the list Tap the refresh button The selected post is now the first in the list. Expecting the post I was viewing to still be the selected one (unless of course it was deleted on the server) Nexus 7 / 2.5 b3

report.summary: Post List: Longpress + action does not update selected post in list.
report.label: bug
report.description: To reproduce: Long tap on a post in the list other than the one currently selected. Choose the edit action from the menu that appears. Tap back and dismiss the editor. Notice that the post detail shows the post that was the subject of the longpress but it is not selected in the list. Nexus 7 / 2.5 beta 3

report.summary: Comment Detail: Deleting last comment does not clear moderation buttons
report.label: bug
report.description: Fringe case probably To reproduce: Have a blog with one comment. On the comments detail, delete the comment. Notice that the moderation buttons remain but the comment text is gone and the comment list is empty. Nexus 7 / 2.5 beta 3

report.summary: Media: Detail can still show deleted media
report.label: bug
report.description: To reproduce Be viewing media in the app. From the web admin, delete all media In the app, refresh the media list After refreshing the list will be empty but the detail still shows the last selected item. Nexus 7 / 2.5 b 3

report.summary: Media: Tapping Next when editing title does not advance to caption.
report.label: bug
report.description: To reproduce: Tap on a media item in the list In the detail tap into the title field. Edit the title text Tap the Next button on the keyboard. The title field looses focus and the keyboard remains visible but the caption field is not being edited. Nexus 7 / 2.5 beta 3

report.summary: Media: Date partially obscured by "uploaded" badge in landscape orientation
report.label: bug
report.description: In landscape orientation the "uploaded" badge partially covers the last character of the "Uploaded on: " date. Nexus 7 / 2.5 beta 3

report.summary: Media: Creating a post from media page creates a "ghost" media item and breaks UI
report.label: bug
report.description: To reproduce: On the media list, long press to enter selection mode. Select a single item and tap the post button. Edit the post and publish. You're back on the media list, notice that there is an extra copy of the item at the bottom of the list. Rotate to change orientation. Notice that the thumbnails for both the original and the extra copy are missing, as well as the dimensions. Nexus 7 / 2.5 beta 3

report.summary: Media: Keyboard appears when changing orientation
report.label: bug
report.description: The cursor is always active in one of the text fields. Rotating invokes the keyboard, even if it has been previously dismissed. Nexus 7 / 2.5 beta 3

report.summary: Edit Gallery: Tapping + icon shows a blank screen.
report.label: bug
report.description: To reproduce: Long press on the media list to invoke selection mode. Select multiple images and tap the Gallery button. On the edit gallery screen, tap the + icon. The screen that appear has a title bar with a done button and "0 selected" label, but there is no other content. Nexus 7 / 2.5 beta 3

report.summary: Themes: Loading spinners turn in opposite directions
report.label: bug
report.description: Maybe I'm being nit picky but it seems a little weird that the refresh spinner in the action bar and the large spinner in the themes feature would not spin in the same direction.

report.summary: Themes: View site probably shouldn't start a new task
report.label: bug
report.description: If you view site from the Themes detail, it looks like a new task is started to show the view site tab. From this point a user can open the sidebar and choose a different option, posts for example. At this point the user has moved out of the themes feature but tapping the back softkey will dump them back into Themes instead of dismissing the app.

report.summary: Themes: Rotating while activating breaks the ui
report.label: bug
report.description: To reproduce: Choose a theme from the themes list. On the detail screen, tap the activate button. Quickly change orientation. The activate button resets (the spinner is gone) The call to activate the theme will complete but the activate and preview buttons remain instead of showing the view site button.

report.summary: Themes: Large spinner appears when refreshing and overlaps list items
report.label: bug
report.description: To reproduce: Go to the themes feature and let it load. Tap the refresh button in the action bar The large spinner reappears over the loaded themes in the list. This seems especially weird as I can still scroll the list while its refreshing. I'd expect either that the large spinner would not appear, or that I would not be able to scroll while it was visible.

report.summary: Setting Featured Image for existing post not working
report.label: bug
report.description: Edit an existing post Add an image to the post Tap the image, and tick the box to set it as featured Observe that the image does not get set as the feature image.

report.summary: Rotating comment view on tablet switches blogs
report.label: bug
report.description: Get out a large tablet like the nexus 10 that has multiple blogs Select 'Comments' form the navigation drawer Rotate the device Observe that the blog switches and the comments list is refreshed.

report.summary: Pluralization issue when bulk moderating comments
report.label: bug
report.description: If you bulk moderate comments, a spinner shows up with the label 'Moderating comment', it should say 'Moderating comments'

report.summary: Themes: Gingerbread device loads m.wordpress.com for theme preview
report.label: bug
report.description: On my gingerbread device, tapping 'Live Preview' loads m.wordpress.com. Doesn't happen on a 4.3 device.

report.summary: Add a picture to an already published page is broken
report.label: bug
report.description: Open and edit an already published page. Tap on the content, and then tap on the media icon. Select library, and pick a picture from there. Upload the changes. The page is uploaded, with changes you may eventually done in post editor, but the new picture is missing, and just an empty IMG tag is in place.

report.summary: Stats API Key Issues
report.label: bug
report.description: If you sign in to a different WP.com account when accessing stats for a Jetpack site, it will override the global WP.com account. We need to use a separate instance of WPRestClient in stats for self-hosted sites.

report.summary: Stats: Chart is empty when there is a low amount of traffic
report.label: bug
report.description: If you view the stats for a site with brand new or really low traffic, the chart data does not get rendered.

report.summary: Stats: Data cleared after viewing 3rd pane of data
report.label: bug
report.description: In the first stats view, swipe to the 3rd pane and then back to the first. Notice that all of the stats data is gone from the first pane.

report.summary: The posts/pages list is not updated when you delete the last page/post of your blog
report.label: bug
report.description: Tried to deleted all the pages from my blog but the list is not correctly refreshed when the last page is removed from the blog. Pages list still has an entry for that page (that was correctly removed from the blog). Restarting the app fixes the issue. Tried to quickly fix it but found 2 strange behaviors in PostsListFragment: getRecentPostsTask returns success = false when the posts/pages list returned from the server is empty. It should return true, since the network connection is correctly completed. When false is returned the UI is not updated. If you delete all the pages from the app db, and return true (as it should be) in getRecentPostsTask, the method loadPosts is called. The latter calls refreshPosts, and goes in a loop...

report.summary: Webview crashes on page with tons of unicode characters
report.label: bug
report.description: The article here http://wp.me/p18Fb6-15t crashes the webview. I tried to preview a new theme on the site, but the theme preview screen uses a webview internally, and the app crashed. Same crash when I used the "View Site" option, or the reader details screen.

report.summary: Can't add a gallery to existing post
report.label: bug

report.summary: Add Self-Hosted Blog: Weird button alignment
report.label: bug

report.summary: Crash in PostsListFragment loadPosts()
report.label: bug
report.description: I can't reproduce this, but I got this crash after scrolling down the post list and loading more posts: java.lang.ClassCastException: org.wordpress.android.ui.posts.PostsListFragment$PostListAdapter cannot be cast to android.widget.HeaderViewListAdapter at android.widget.ListView.removeFooterView(ListView.java:390) at org.wordpress.android.ui.posts.PostsListFragment.loadPosts(PostsListFragment.java:259) at org.wordpress.android.ui.posts.PostsListFragment$getRecentPostsTask$1.run(PostsListFragment.java:644) at android.app.Activity.runOnUiThread(Activity.java:4673) at org.wordpress.android.ui.posts.PostsListFragment$getRecentPostsTask.onPostExecute(PostsListFragment.java:640) at org.wordpress.android.ui.posts.PostsListFragment$getRecentPostsTask.onPostExecute(PostsListFragment.java:609) at android.os.AsyncTask.finish(AsyncTask.java:631) at android.os.AsyncTask.access$600(AsyncTask.java:177) at android.os.AsyncTask$InternalHandler.handleMessage(AsyncTask.java:644) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:137) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5103) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:525) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:737) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:553) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)

report.summary: Ugly dialog text when deleting an untitled draft
report.label: bug
report.description: When you delete a draft that doesn't have a title, you get this dialog:

report.summary: WordPressDB.loadUploadedPosts() is querying the wrong blog ID.
report.label: bug
report.description: While researching #181, I discovered that WordPressDB.loadUploadedPosts() is querying by 'blogID' which is incorrect, it should be querying by the internal 'id'. If you add two self-hosted blogs with the same 'blogID' (it is usually '1') it will pull in posts for the wrong blog and cause problems very quickly.

report.summary: Media edits are lost after hitting back button
report.label: bug
report.description: If you open a media item for editing then make any changes, those changes are lost without warning when you hit the back button.

report.summary: Pictures are uploaded in a service that internally uses AsyncTask
report.label: bug
report.description: Was trying to upload a picture to the blog from the media library. Found out that if you tap on the picture to show the details when it is in "uploading" state, the MediaItemFragment doesn't show a preview of the picture (even if it's a local picture stored on the phone). This is because the ImageView that holds the pictures in MediaItemFragment is populated by an AsyncTask in background (correct, since bitmap decoding could take time), but at the same time another AsyncTask is uploading the picture in MediaUploadService, and there are no available threads to complete the rendering operation. When the uploading is completed the Rendering is finally done, since a thread is now available to run the task. AsyncThreads should be used for short operations only. Don't know if there is a simple way to increase the number of concurrent threads in AsyncTask. Same issue if you tap on another picture while the current picture is in "uploading". The preview of the 2nd picture is not shown on the screen even if it already uploaded on the blog, or available locally on the phone.

report.summary: Refactor PostsListFragment
report.label: bug
report.description: PostsListFragment is doing a bunch of things incorrectly (I think it has remained largely unchanged since wpToGo in 2008...) Some ToDos: Remove the separate calls to load the local drafts and uploaded posts. A while back the local drafts were changed to be stored in the same table as uploaded posts, so we only need one query. Use a proper BaseAdapter/CursorAdapter for retrieving and displaying the posts data from the db. Proper m/v/c. Maybe use DateUtils.getRelativeTimeSpanString() for displaying the relative date to now? Add infinite scroll (see Notifications for an implementation of this) Make sure that these changes also fix #181.

report.summary: No action when tapping comment like notification
report.label: bug

report.summary: Post: On a slow connection, app doesn't seem to do anything while uploading image.

On a slow connection, once the toast is gone there is a fair amount of time before the refresh spinner starts animating (because the list is being refreshed maybe?). Image meta appears as expected. If I try to add this image to a gallery the app crashes. "Unfortunately WordPress has stopped." The image in question: http://aerychtest.files.wordpress.com/2013/10/image_1382545119328.png

report.summary: Can't sign in if password ends with a space
report.label: bug
report.description: A user helped me discover why they couldn't sign in: their password ends with a space. Looks we are trim()ming the password..

report.summary: Posts shown for wrong blog
report.label: bug
report.description: After adding Danilo's 3.6 self-hosted test site to the app, I waited a few seconds for the app to retrieve that blog's posts but it was taking too long so I switched to one of my blogs from the drawer. The posts from the 3.6 site suddenly appeared - but they were showing under the wrong blog (since I switched blogs). I switched back to the 3.6 site and after waiting a while a dialog appeared stating "Sorry, posts could not be refreshed at this time." I switched back to my blog again, and it was still showing the posts from the 3.6 site. Restarting the app didn't resolve the problem - my blog continued to show the wrong posts until I deleted it from the app. I believe the problem lies in PostListFragment's getRecentPostsTask. It uses WordPress.currentBlog.getId() when saving retrieved posts, but the current blog id may have changed since the task was started so the posts get saved under the wrong blog.

report.summary: Edit Media never asks to Cancel/Discard/Save changes when the back button is pressed and modifications have been made
report.label: bug
report.description: I do not know if this is intended behavior when editing a media item or should be a feature enhancement?

report.summary: Can't connect to site that uses HTTPS redirect
report.label: bug
report.description: A user reported an issue with logging in to a site (http://www.androidpolice.com). The RSD response returned an HTTPS URL but the site would redirect all HTTPS request to HTTP. This confused the app and returned and ugly XML parser error in the app: This was fixable by instructing the user to enter the full path to xmlrpc.php, but the app can probably be smarter about catching this issue and then trying the URL again without using HTTPS.

report.summary: Don't show Java exception in NUX error dialog
report.label: bug

report.summary: WordPress.com login prompt shows after returning to StatsActivity with no Jetpack connection
report.label: bug
report.description: Add a self-hosted site that doesn't have Jetpack. Visit stats, then quickly leave the app. When you return to the stats view, you get the WordPress.com login prompt, as well as the Jetpack installation message.

report.summary: Reader action buttons aren't translation friendly
report.label: bug
report.description: See the "comment" button translated here in french "commenter"

report.summary: Stats should clear out when switching blogs
report.label: bug
report.description: If you're viewing a blog's stats, then switch to another blog in the navigation drawer, the current stats stick around.

report.summary: Remove html in stats resource strings
report.label: bug
report.description: The "stats: empty list strings" items in strings.xml contain html, which cause problems during translation.

report.summary: Checked comments are kept after selecting and deleting comments
report.label: bug
report.description: Go to the Comments view Select 1 or more comments (via checkboxes) Delete them Comments are deleted but checkboxes are still checked develop branch

report.summary: Jetpack stats aren't retrieved from db due to blogId mismatch
report.label: bug
report.description: If you view stats for a Jetpack blog, some of the queries to the stats db don't work because it queries on the blogid vs. the api_blogid.

report.summary: QuickPress widget stopped working.
report.label: bug
report.description: If you create a quickpress shortcut, then tap on it you get an 'app not installed' toast message.

report.summary: Verify that the user is still logged into WordPress.com on PN received
report.label: bug
report.description: Please verify that the user is still logged into WordPress.com when opening the app from a PN. Steps to repro: Log to WordPress.com Go offline, or in an area with no coverage Remove the WordPress.com account within the app Comment on a post of your blog Go online You will receive a PNs If you tap on the app the Notifications screen will open with no details, and an error message.

report.summary: Login activity gone after returning to app
report.label: bug
report.description: User report (unconfirmed): When setting up a self-hosted blog on the WordPress Android app for the first time, I filled out the URL and username and switched to 1Password to get the password, but when I switched back to WordPress, the “Add a blog” screen was gone along with the text I had already typed in.

report.summary: Tough to select text
report.label: bug
report.description: On my galaxy s4, if I long press to select a word it selects the word, but when I lift off my finger the selection clears.

report.summary: Can't view formatting toolbar with a hardware keyboard
report.label: bug
report.description: If you configure an emulator to use the hardware keyboard only, you'll never see the formatting toolbar because of the softKeyboardHook() method.

report.summary: Native Reader: unliked posts stay in "Post I like"
report.label: bug
report.description: Like some post Go to the Reader (native), select "Post I like" category Unlike some posts Refresh -> unliked posts stay here (should not be there) We can also add this enhancement: When you unlike a post, it hides, and a pseudo-Toast appears saying "post unliked, undo ?". Clicking the undo button on Toast, makes the post appears and liked. See https://code.google.com/p/romannurik-code/source/browse/misc/undobar/src/com/example/android/undobar/UndoBarController.java for the pseudo-Toast

report.summary: Crash when sharing image from dropbox to media library.
report.label: bug
report.description: Open Dropbox, find an image. Choose the 'export' option and choose WordPress. Choose Media library. Boom1

report.summary: "New Articles Available" button in Native Reader must not be focusable when hidden
report.label: bug
report.description: The orange rectangle in the screenshot below is the focused button:

report.summary: Images are rotated in composition window
report.label: bug
report.description: Repro: Snap a vertically oriented photo. Write a new post. Insert the photo. Observe that it is oriented horizontally in the editor. Publish. Result: The photo is oriented correctly in spite of the sideways preview. Expected: The preview will display correctly as well. The first time I noticed this, I wasted some time going back in and rotating the image.

report.summary: 'Approve' view overlaying comment reply view
report.label: bug
report.description: I tried to approve a comment, and it failed. I then had an approve button overlaying the reply view:

report.summary: User can't reply to comment notifications via Jetpack and HTTPS
report.label: bug
report.description: See: http://android.forums.wordpress.org/topic/comment-replies-fail-on-https-sites?replies=5

report.summary: Re login with different user - shows posts from last user
report.label: bug
report.description: Hello, I have 2 users, each one with his posts (private posts), when i switch-login from one to the other, I see the posts from the last user. This is solved if I refresh, but where can I set an automatic refresh for the current user at login (both in 'view admin' and 'my posts')? I browsed the issues list, but found nothing of the sort. Many thanks :)

report.summary: Method checkForExistingBlog always return false when a blogName contains a double quote (")
report.label: bug
report.description: https://github.com/wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Android/blob/develop/src/org/wordpress/android/WordPressDB.java?source=c#L389

report.summary: Layout cleanup
report.label: bug
report.description: Lessen padding in menu drawer rows so more fit into the view w/o scrolling. Fix padding in notifications follow/likes views to match up with new indented row divider.

report.summary: Stats: '1 views' displayed in Visitors and Views section
report.label: bug
report.description: On a blog where the views should be > 1,000, the app displays '1 views' in the Visitors and Views' section.

report.summary: Show/Hide blogs list will restore selection after refresh completes
report.label: bug
report.description: Visit Show/hide blogs area. While list is refreshing, untick any of the checkboxes. After the refresh completes, your tick will reset to being checked.

report.summary: Crash when returning to post editor activity after it was killed
report.label: bug
report.description: Edit a post Leave the app Kill the app process in adb Return to the app. Crash. Related to this, we need to find a way to save the post when the activity is killed so we can restore it when the activity comes back.

report.summary: NUX: Funky activity indicator on gingerbread only
report.label: bug
report.description: Check it out: https://cloudup.com/cZd1q2pAOsB

report.summary: Reader: post list does not refresh content when rotated
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce: Tap the refresh button on the reader post list in portrait orientation. Rotate the device to landscape orientation while data is still loading. Wait until the refresh icon stops spinning. - the list will not refresh here Rotate device back to portrait orientation. - the list will now reload with the new posts

report.summary: Native Reader: Hyperlinks don't launch browser in reader comments
report.label: bug
report.description: http links work fine in Reader comments, but named hyperlinks don't seem to be tappable.

report.summary: HTTP Auth Crash
report.label: bug
report.description: Beta user report: "When i try to use a self hosted site (password protected) with the new wordpress app, it crashed. I cant insert the http Username or password."

report.summary: Post Editor: Hard to tap on image and image settings don't update when editing a draft
report.label: bug
report.description: Some of the recent post editor changes have made it tough to tap on an image to view its settings. Also, it appears that editing a post, then editing an image's settings will not persist when saving the post again.

report.summary: Reader post detail: Fast scrolling to top => the action bar stays hidden
report.label: bug
report.description: See this: https://cloudup.com/c7H5P784qA0

report.summary: Initial Log In on Nexus 10 with Android API 16: Layout Issues
report.label: bug
report.description: The screen size or is it that we are landscape? https://cloudup.com/cGam9CimW86

report.summary: XXHDPI CAB drawable has a line through it
report.label: bug
report.description: I think i had this issue with Simplenote, had to adjust the colors in photoshop: https://cloudup.com/cPPkzYv4XA9

report.summary: Hidden blog sometimes becomes visible again.
report.label: bug
report.description: Doesn't happen every time. Race condition maybe? From a fresh install, sign in with a WP.com account with multiple blogs. Go to Settings Tap Show / Hide blogs Hide the first blog (which was my default blog) Refresh. Tap back. Notice that the blog you just hid is not in the list. Tap back to dismiss settings. Notice a different blog is now showing its post list. Confirm in the side bar that the blog is not visible. Go back to settings. The blog you removed is back in the list. Tap show / hide blogs. The previously removed blog is checked. Nexus 4. KitKat.

report.summary: Hidden blog flashes its content when returning from Settings.
report.label: bug
report.description: Related to #472 probably. From a fresh install, sign in with a WP.com account with multiple blogs. Go to Settings Tap Show / Hide blogs Hide the first blog (which was my default blog) Refresh. Tap back. Notice that the blog you just hid is not in the list. Tap back to dismiss Settings. A different blog is showing in the post list. View settings again. Dismiss settings. The content of the blog you dismissed is visible in the post list for a split second. Nexus 4 / KitKat

report.summary: Notifications: Comment reply notification shows CDATA from XML
report.label: bug
report.description: Comment reply about a reblog shows some CDATA from the XML. Maybe specific to reblogs?

report.summary: Notifications: Reply to comment shows up in Notifications list, disappears when refreshing list.
report.label: bug
report.description: I replied to a comment notification. When the reply was sent, I tapped back to the notifications list. I saw my comment reply as the first item in the list. I tapped the refresh button. When the list refreshed, my reply was gone. Maybe since this was me replying it shouldn't have been there at all? Nexus 4 / KitKat

report.summary: Notifications: Moderated comments do not refresh 'badge' in list.
report.label: bug
report.description: I tapped on a notification comment in the list. I had previously moderated this comment and trashed it. On the detail page I tapped approve. When I tapped back to the notifications list the comment notification was still prefaced with the [Trash] badge.

report.summary: Notifications: Text selection disabled for comment notifications, enabled for others.
report.label: bug
report.description: On the notification detail screen, if I'm viewing a comment notification a long press does not invoke text selection mode. However, if I'm viewing an achievement notification, it does. Seems like we should be consistent.

report.summary: Reader: Comments / Likes avatars should left align
report.label: bug
report.description: The left side of the like icons and the avatars on the comments list are off by a pixel or two. It would look a little cleaner to have them aligned.

report.summary: Reader Detail: Rotating orientation scrolls detail to the top
report.label: bug
report.description: Title has it.

report.summary: Reader Detail: Toolbars can vanish when scrolled to top.
report.label: bug
report.description: This is a little tricky to reproduce but I got the knack of it after a little practice. Go to the reader detail. Scroll down a bit. Notice the toolbars vanish as expected while scrolling down. Now swipe down to scroll back toward the top, but as you swipe down, make sure you swipe across the bottom toolbar as well. If you get the timing right, the toolbars disappear.

report.summary: Reader List: Content scrolls jumps after changing orientation.
report.label: bug
report.description: Scroll down the Reader list a bit. Take note of the visible story, then rotate the device to change orientation. The app tries to set the scroll offset so the user is looking at the same story, but the animation is distracting. Maybe make it instantaneous instead?

report.summary: Reader: Wrong topic title shown after editing topics
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce: Switch to a topic. I choose "Coffee" Tap to edit topics. Switch from followed tags to popular tags Add "humor" Switch back to followed tags. Remove humor. Remove another topic (not the one you're viewing. I chose Movies) Add the topic back. Dismiss the topics form. Notice that the list refreshes. You see new stories for the topic (movies in my case) but the title will be the topic you were previously viewing. All steps might not be necessary to reproduce.

report.summary: Reader Detail: Swiping on non-scrolling story still dismisses toolbars.
report.label: bug
report.description: Find an article that is too brief to scroll. Swipe up / down on the story. Notice the toolbars still show and hide but since we're not scrolling I'd expect them to stick around. nexus 4 / kitkat

report.summary: Reader: Video plays after dismissing video.
report.label: bug
report.description: Find a story with video content. From the detail screen, tap on the video. Tap the video to start playing. Tap the back key to return the reader detail screen. You can still hear the video playing and there's no apparent way to stop it.

report.summary: Sharing: Confusion returning to the app after sharing.
report.label: bug
report.description: I started off in a reader detail. Tap the share icon and choose a destination app. I choose Simplenote. A link is shared to the target application. You see the application appear. Tap the home button. Tap the WordPress app icon to return to the app. The UI of the app you shared to appears. You can tap the back button instead of the home button to return to the WordPress app's UI but we shouldn't expect this flow from everyone. Nexus 4 / KitKat

report.summary: Reader: Post list comment icon changes color when user presses on a list item
report.label: bug
report.description: Tap on an item in the post list. The item gets a grey overlay or sorts to indicate its being touched. Notice the reblog and like icons remain blue but the comment icon is orange.

report.summary: Reader: Like list stutters when scrolling.
report.label: bug
report.description: Find a post that has a lot of likes. I chose one with 70+. View the detail and tap on the likes to view the list. Scroll the list. Notice its not a very smooth scrolling experience.

report.summary: Reader: Like list looses place when rotating.
report.label: bug
report.description: On a reader detail, tap to view the list of likes. Scroll down the list, then change orientation. You're back at the top of the list.

report.summary: Sidebar doesn't show newly added .com blog as an option.
report.label: bug
report.description: Start with one blog in the app. I was logged in with a wp.com account with four blogs, three of which were hidden. Go to settings. Tap to create a new wp.com blog. You're returned to the settings screen when you're done and you see the newly added blog in the list. Dismiss the settings screen. Check the sidebar. Notice the blog picker is absent and you can't switch to your newly added blog. Nexus 4 / KitKat

report.summary: Reader: Posts I Like shows unliked posts.
report.label: bug
report.description: Go to the reader and set the topic to Posts I Like. Unlike a post. Refresh the list. The post is still there in its unliked state.

report.summary: Editor: End tag can be set before starting tag.
report.label: bug
report.description: In the editor tap to edit the content. Somewhere in the middle of the content, tap one of the formatting options. I chose bold. Notice the opening bold tag is set, and the bold option is highlighted. Move the cursor to a point in the text prior to the opening bold tag. Tap the bold format option again to set the closing tag. We could argue that this is on the user, but if the cursor is moved prior to the start of the format tag it might make sense to reset the button's state.

report.summary: Editor: Link dialog "Next" button on keyboard or form doesn't do anything.
report.label: bug
report.description: I have a vague memory of this issue being opened before but I couldn't find the ticket after a quick search. In the editor, tap the link option on the format bar. In the link dialog, tap the next button on the keyboard. The cursor should move to the next text field but it remains in the first text field. Rotate the app to landscape orientation. The dialog shows a full screen text field with a next button added to the UI. Tap this button. Nothing happens. Nexus 4 / KitKat.

report.summary: Editor: Editor scrolls to bottom after inserting media
report.label: bug
report.description: Edit a post. Make sure it has enough content to scroll. Insert the cursor near the top of the screen. Tap the photo option on the format bar to insert an image at the cursor position. I chose to insert an image from the gallery. Pick an image to return to the editor. Notice that the textfield has scrolled to the bottom of the screen, but the image has been inserted in the correct location. We want to avoid scrolling away from where the image was inserted.

report.summary: Posts: Long press on draft includes comment and share options.
report.label: bug
report.description: In the post list, long press on a draft post. In the intents dialog, you'll see options for sharing and commenting. These seem out of place. If you choose sharing, you'll be met with a connection error. If you choose comment, you'll be able to leave a comment on the draft. How weird is that?

report.summary: Editor: Unable to add imags to an edited post.
report.label: bug
report.description: From the post list, create a new post. Go into options and change the status to draft. Return to the editor, add a title and some text and save. Tap on the newly created draft in the post list and edit it. Position the cursor and try to add an image from a gallery. You'll see the image added in the editor. Tap save. Tap to view the draft post. The image is not there, neither is there any HTML for it. Try again, but this time take a photo instead of choosing an image from your gallery. After taking the photo you're returned to the editor. Notice that everything above the photo thumbnail is missing. Tap save. Tap to view the draft. None of the changes you observed are there.

report.summary: Incorrect Usages of blog.getId() and blog.getBlogId()?
report.label: bug
report.description: I think some poor naming has caused some problems in the app. In the Blog model we have getId() and getBlogId(). The 'id' is the local id of the blog, corresponds to the unique key in the local SQLite blog table. The 'blogId' is the remote blog ID, which is typically just '1' for WordPress.org blogs, and on Multi-site and WordPress.com it is a unique integer that identifies the individual blog across the site instance. The problem I'm seeing is that we are often using getBlogId() as the key for other objects, such as in Media. If a user has multiple self-hosted blogs with a blogId of '1' then they are going to see media items for both blogs when they visit media. I think we need to rename these to be clearer, and do an audit of the app and fix instances where we should use the id instead of the blogId.

report.summary: Creating Draft on Android App sets publish time to current time
report.label: bug
report.description: Creating a draft on Android has a different behavior than on the Web interface. When creating a draft, you leave the Publish: at Immediately and change the status to draft it will save the publish date (as current date/time) when you access the post in the web interface, the publish time will be the time the draft was created. Therefore when you press publish it gets published back in time. This is a different behavior than the web interface where when saving a draft the Publish date stays to "Immediately" and then later on when you hit publish it sets to the current publish date and not the previous draft date.

report.summary: notifications not marked as read in app
report.label: bug
report.description: I have four notifications that are being marked as unread every time I open the app. I checked the API for the unread state -- all were marked as 0. With some more testing I noticed that these notifications are marked as read when the app is opened via the app icon but unread when opened via a push notification.

report.summary: Consistent error while posting through sharing
report.label: bug
report.description: Hello I have a self hosted WordPress blog. I have been using the Android app to post content for years. Since the last update, or so it would seem, I have been experiencing a consistent and annoying bug. If I select an image and try and share it to WordPress via the app, the post always fails with the message sorry an error occurred while accessing this blog. Also, no local draft version of the post is kept, which means that I have to start all over again. If I open the WordPress app directly, and select the image from within the app, it will then always post without issue. This behaviour has been repeated on a Samsung galaxy note 10.1 running Android 4.1.1 and a Samsung galaxy S4 running Android 4.3. Both are running WordPress for Android 2.6. Thank you, Richard

report.summary: Notifications: Follow button follow state not working
report.label: bug
report.description: The '+' and '-' follow button in notifications has stopped loading the current following state for a user. It will show '+' for every blog whether you are following it or not.

report.summary: Posts: Change title of post and update the ViewPostFragment of the opened Post

report.description: When you edit the title of the post and Publish/Save the post, it will load the ViewPostFragment with older details. The ViewPostFragment will only update when you open the post again from the listview

report.summary: Comments: Row highlight issue on Gingerbread
report.label: bug
report.description: On a gingerbread device, tap on a comment row and you'll see the whole list flash with a blue highlight. The selection still works though which is good.

report.summary: RuntimeException in EditPostActivity
report.label: bug
report.description: java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to start activity ComponentInfo{org.wordpress.android/org.wordpress.android.ui.posts.EditPostActivity}: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Wrong state class, expecting View State but received class android.view.View$BaseSavedState instead. This usually happens when two views of different type have the same id in the same hierarchy. This view's id is id/pager. report.summary: Some users are losing posts when attempting upload
report.label: bug
report.description: I've had support threads with two users so far that can't upload posts in 2.6. They can uninstall the app and it will work for a while, but then posts won't upload and error with the blog_not_found error, which I believe happens here: https://github.com/wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Android/blob/develop/src/org/wordpress/android/util/PostUploadService.java#L207 One user gave me an author account on the site and I can't reproduce so far. Both users are attempting to upload images, so I'm wondering if #730 might have helped with this. I'm going to send the 2.6.1 beta to them to see if it fixes the issue.

report.summary: Duplicate Notification Types and Blogs in PreferencesActivity
report.label: bug
report.description: When you load up PreferencesActivity, you'll see duplicate notification type settings, as well as duplicated list of blogs in the notifications settings.

report.summary: Stats: no error when user doesn't have permission
report.label: bug
report.description: If I view the stats for a Jetpack blog that I don't have sufficient permission to view stats for, I'm never told of the problem. Instead, all stats views show zero with no explanation. On the web I'm told, "You do not have sufficient permissions to access this page."

report.summary: Stats: rotation loses selection

report.description: Select "Weeks" under "Visitors and Views," then rotate the device. It'll return to "Days."

report.summary: Stats, first label shifted to the right in bar graphs
report.label: bug

report.summary: "Cannot serialize null" uploading modified post
report.label: bug
report.description: I'm able to duplicate the "cannot serialize null" error several testers have reported. The exception occurs in XMLRPCClient.java when the passed "params" are serialized. As the screenshot below illustrates, the "params" object starts at index 1 which causes a null exception when params[0] is serialized. (Repro'd on Genymotion S2 emulator, Android v2.3.7) If I close the app after the exception occurs then return to the post list, the post is gone.

report.summary: Update 'blogname' when refreshing blog content

report.description: We should update the blog name in RefreshBlogContentTask: Add 'blogname' to the default parameters used in getOptions Store the new value in the db Update the UI

report.summary: Submitting post from media creates (Untitled) local draft
report.label: bug
report.description: I can repro this every time. Go to media, long press an image, then tap the pin icon to add it to a new post Give the post a title then submit it The "Uploading post" status notification shows for a second then disappears The post list now shows an (Untitled) local draft which is completely empty Refresh the post list, and the new post does show up but the (Untitled) one still remains

report.summary: Posts list doesn't refresh after saving local draft of shared post
report.label: bug
report.description: Have the posts list open. Leave the app. Share something to the app. Tap back and save the post as a local draft. You're returned to the posts list, and the draft won't appear until you tap refresh. I think my posts list fragment refactor automatically fixes this because it reloads in onResume(), but creating this issue to make sure we check it.

report.summary: NPE caused by null mimeType in PostUploadService
report.label: bug
report.description: Perusing our crash reports I came across an NPE here which has been encountered 100 times: https://github.com/wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Android/blob/develop/src/org/wordpress/android/util/PostUploadService.java#L506 Not sure if the fix is to set mimeType = "" when it's null, or if there's a default video mime type it should be set to instead.

report.summary: Load posts from wpDB method, clean up Post model
report.label: bug
report.description: I think one of the causes for #862 was that we are passing a localTableBlogId to the Posts model to load an existing post. There was no currentBlog, so the blogId was set to -1 and 'lost' in the database. We should simply pass a local post id to a method in wpDB that will retrieve the post. No need for the 'blogId' or 'isPage' parameters either. We could then remove the constructor in Posts.java that did database work.

report.summary: Comment paging needs to handle the gap between new and cached
report.label: bug
report.description: Comments are loaded 20 at a time. When you scroll to the end of them, the next 20 are loaded. But since comments are cached, there's a chance you could miss some due to the gap between new comments are those cached. Ex: if you previously loaded 20 comments then use the app again after 40 more comments were posted, you'd get the most recent 20 of those comments but 20 of them would never show up.

Aside: I can also delete a post while it's being uploaded.

report.summary: trustAllSslCertificates could open security issues
report.label: bug
report.description: https://github.com/wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Android/blob/develop/src/org/xmlrpc/android/ApiHelper.java#L855 When private static String getResponse(final String url, boolean trustAllSslCertificates, int maxRedirection) is called with trustAllSslCertificates = true, makes Volley and other libs based on HttpsURLConnection trust all ssl certificates. This change is applied to all request already in the Volley queue, and new direct HTTP requests made outside volley. A potentially MITM attack could happen on a site that was not marked as "trusted domain". We should probably use a dedicated HTTP stack, as we did in Media section of the app.

report.summary: Creating a new post category must start the progress bar
report.label: bug
report.description: Tap the "Create a new category" button Fill a category name Tap "Ok" (takes few seconds on slow network - without visual feedback for the user) Category is created and selected + a Toast is shown

report.summary: Stop progress bar when the user changes blog
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to repro: Go to posts and do a PTR Quickly open the drawer and change to another blog The progress bar is still going and you cannot do a PTR in the view. Even worst: if something bad happened during the PTR underlying network calls (say credentials errors) the loading bar is always running, you need to switch to comment to dismiss it. Also check pages and comments screens. Important: PTR on posts calls ApiHelper.RefreshBlogContentTask by passing the current blog as one parameter. RefreshBlogContentTask internally calls ApiHelper.refreshComments(mContext, commentParams); without passing the blog object (It relies on WordPress.getCurrentBlog()). So if you switch blog, the call to refreshComments will be done to the wrong URL (the url of the 2nd blog) with the credentials of the first blog.

report.summary: PostUploadService refreshes the newly creeated post without taking in consideration the blogID
report.label: bug
report.description: PostUploadService calls the method WordPress.postUploaded by only passing the postID. WordPress.postUploaded internally calls the method OnPostUploaded of the current OnPostUploadedListener. Later in PostsListFragment->OnPostUploaded we use the postID and call getCurrentBlog to retrieve the post from the server and update the posts list. If the user switches blog while uploading, he/she will receive an error on the post list.

report.summary: Comment content not displaying
report.label: bug
report.description: On a device running 4.0, I tap on a comment notification and it loads the comment detail view, but then the comment text doesn't ever load. If I back out to notifications and then back to the comment, it displays normally.

report.summary: Comment list, deleted comments still visible in the app
report.label: bug
report.description: Tested on a self hosted and wpcom Go to Comments in the app Visit the web dashboard and move at least 1 comment to trash Refresh the Comment list in the app Deleted comments are still visible Note instead of step "Visit the web dashboard and move at least 1 comment to trash" you can also delete a post with comments from the web dashboard.

report.summary: Notification blank screen when trashing a comment from PN
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to repro: Open the app and go to Stats (or any other screen) Keep the app opened Receive a PN for a new comment Slide down Notification Center and tap on the item The app takes you to the Notification Details screen Tap on trash The comment is trashed, but after a little bit of loading the app shows a blank notification details? screen. If you tap the back button the app takes you on the notifications list

report.summary: Post editor, keyboard not dismissed when adding a picture
report.label: bug
report.description: Create a new post. Add a picture. Delete this picture from the post. Add a picture, this time keyboard isn't dismissed, it stays on top of the Gallery image picker.

report.summary: Check RTL Compatibility when Editing Comments
report.label: bug
report.description: User report: my site is in hebrew and the comments are in hebrew. hebrew is right to left. When I try to edit a comment, the text of the comment is left to right. It should be Rtl. Can you fix it?

report.summary: Media: Search is Broken
report.label: bug
report.description: User reported that search doesn't do anything in Media in 2.7.1. I confirmed on a Nexus 5.

report.summary: Crash when pressing back button from login screen
report.label: bug
report.description: User report, I couldn't reproduce. On a Galaxy Note 2: I've got a null pointer exception. How? Open the WordPress.com login and push back button on the telephone.

report.summary: Comments: Can't edit comment retrieved from REST API
report.label: bug
report.description: I stumbled upon an issue today: From Notifications, tap on a comment notification where the comment is in 'Unapproved' status. Edit the comment, change some text in the comment. Tap upload button. 'An error occurred while editing the comment'. XML-RPC error is that the comment's status was invalid. The code is using 'unapproved' here, when it should be 'hold': WordPress-Android/src/org/wordpress/android/ui/comments/EditCommentActivity.java Line 233 in 80232ed postHash.put("status", mComment.getStatus()); Changing it to CommentStatus.toString(mComment.getStatusEnum()) fixed it for me, but I'll let you investigate @nbradbury ;)

report.summary: See old preview after posting
report.label: bug
report.description: start writing a post. exit out and save draft when prompted. go back to the post and see preview. click edit. add some more text. hit save / publish sent back to preview for a second and see old preview from the earlier save. Panic! sent back to post list and see that the post did actually publish with the new text

report.summary: SNI in xmlrpc, esp. during setup process
report.label: bug
report.description: I have the following setup: fqdn.example.com is my default host (which replies when not using SNI), and everything there requires authorization, since that's where my web admin solution lives. example.com runs my WordPress, but is only reachable via SNI. WordPress-Android – or rather, xmlrpc – doesn't use SNI in the setup phase, which means I always get the "We can't log you in" screen. The logs clearly show xmlrpc choking on the 403, and my webserver log indicates that the client is not using SNI. Can you implement SNI in xmlrpc, please?
