report.summary: AnalyticsTracker needs to take activity re-creation into account
report.label: bug
report.description: In several places, AnalyticsTracker uses an activity's onCreate() to record when the user accessed a feature. This will result in inflated stats since the activity is re-created when the device is rotated.

report.summary: Reader network calls even when not connect to a wpcom account
report.label: bug
report.description: It seems that only happens when: Sign in with wpcom credentials Sign out Sign in with a self hosted site Navigate the app and watch the logs, you should see some network errors prefixed with "WordPress-READER" see #1283

report.summary: WPActionBarActivity calls onBlogChanged() after returning from settings
report.label: bug
report.description: When returning to WPActionBarActivity from settings, onActivityResult() always calls onBlogChanged() regardless of whether the blog has changed. This results in unnecessary work being done, most notably that stats data is updated.

report.summary: Web pages don't appear correctly inside app
report.label: bug
report.description: Pages opened in the WebViewActivity often don't appear correctly compared to how they appear when opened in the Android browser. My guess is that this is due to us using a custom user agent which throws off the page's browser sniffing.

report.summary: Disappearing images in post editor after activity is closed
report.label: bug
report.description: Enable Don't keep activities option in device settings. Open app, tap new post button. Add an image from the device gallery. Observe it is added to the post. Add another image from the device gallery. Observe that the first image is now gone.

report.summary: Gravatars are re-downloaded when it seems like they should be cached.
report.label: bug
report.description: From the notifications, list tap on a notification that has a gravatar loaded. When the detail view loads, the gravatar is loaded again. Could be slight differences in the URL that cause the cache load to fail.

report.label: bug
report.description: See https://cloudup.com/cSurC3c3vuK

report.summary: Pin lock, 10" tablet wrong screen size on first pin enter
report.label: bug
report.description: See https://cloudup.com/cyuBEkDLd7U

report.summary: Featured image missing after editing a post
report.label: bug
report.description: Create a new post, give it a title but no content Insert a picture and set it as the featured image Publish the post Edit it in the app The featured image doesn't appear anywhere in the post editor.

report.summary: WordPress.com sites don't refresh automatically
report.label: bug
report.description: I fired up one of my Android devices that I don't use regularly. Since the last time I used the device, I've moved two sites over to WordPress.com. Those sites didn't show up in the site selector, even after poking around the app for a bit. When I went into Settings to see if the site was hidden, the list showed the new sites. Pop back to the main screen and the sidebar shows the new sites as well.

report.summary: unable to remove spam from comments listing
report.label: bug
report.description: using Wordpress for Android v2.8 on a Galaxy S4. Self-hosted Wordpress In my listing of comments on my site, there are some 20 spam comments, listed as "Pending". However, trying to remove them fails, and I will explain why. I had them listed in the app, but then went to the blog with my browser and removed them in Wordpress instead. Ever since, I cannot remove them from the app. When I try to either mark them spam or trash them, I get "an error occurred while moderating" and the comment is not removed from the listing. The log shows that there is an error 404 on the request.

report.summary: Comment like notification "follow" state inconsistencies
report.label: bug
report.description: Reported by a user: Inconsistent follow state across screens I got a comment like notification I clicked follow on one of the people who liked the comment as well (they were also the author of the post) I clicked through to the comment and then the post The follow button next to the author said “Follow” instead of “Followed” Using WordPress for Android 2.8

report.summary: Opening the app from a comment PN could take the user to a blank notification details screen
report.label: bug
report.description: If the comment push notification doesn't contains the note full data ("note_full_data" key) the app stores in the DB just a placeholder for that note. In most of case this is not an issue, since a call to refreshNotes() is done immediately after, and the note is updated with full details. In some situations the call to refreshNotes() can fail due to bad network signal, or other unknown issues, and the note stored in the DB is then incomplete. When the user taps on the PN entry in notification center, the app is launched, and the method showCommentForNote of CommentDetailFragment is reached. That method tries to get the comment by using the blogId and the commentID that are both not available (since the note object is just a placeholder) resulting in an error and a blank details screen. A REST call with both blogID and commentID set to 0 is done.

report.summary: Show errors message when the Stats update service fails
report.label: bug
report.description: No error message is shown on the screen when the stats update service fails.

report.summary: Changing password results in unresponsive/blank Reader
report.label: bug
report.description: Install the app fresh(I was running develop 9bc4d3d) Sign in to a WordPress.com account. Load the reader at Freshly Pressed. Back button out of the app to close it. Head over to WordPress.com in a desktop browser, change your password. Open the app again, you'll get a sign in prompt. Sign in with the new password. Open menu drawer and open Posts, then open it again and go back to the Reader. This is what I see, PTR doesn't refresh the view:

report.label: bug
report.description: When saving an already uploaded draft, the view doesn't come back to the post list as soon as the save button is pressed but only after the upload ends. Feels weird: https://cloudup.com/c1etFKFpqob

report.summary: After an account creation, user should be logged in
report.label: bug
report.description: Seems it's currently broken on 2.9-dev.

report.summary: Gallery doesn't work well on self-hosted sites
report.label: bug
report.description: Some of the features in "Gallery Settings" are available to WordPress.com sites only. The app doesn't check if the current blog is Self-Hosted or not when creating that screen, resulting in unexpected result on self-hosted blogs. For example if the user select type = Slideshow. Ref: http://android.forums.wordpress.org/topic/slideshow-gallery-seems-not-to-work?replies=1 http://codex.wordpress.org/The_WordPress_Gallery

report.summary: Image disappears from editor
report.label: bug

report.summary: Delayed appearance of reader liking users
report.label: bug
report.description: The popup which displays details about liking users doesn't populate until after it animates in. https://cloudup.com/cf3nn2e8jBS

report.label: bug

report.summary: An issue to Mixpanel stats is blocking stats refreshing on Self-hosted sites
report.label: bug

report.summary: Post Editor: Change save button text to 'Upload' when editing published posts
report.label: bug
report.description: If a user is editing an existing post on the site, and the status is publish, then the save button in the action bar should read 'Update'.

report.summary: Try to update the gradle script to make it easier to work on libraries used by WPAndroid
report.label: bug
report.description: Priority to fix the "caches" issue.

report.summary: Improve UX when adding externally hosted image
report.label: bug
report.description: When you add an image from the Photos app (or any other app that doesn't store the image locally), the image has to be downloaded before being inserted in the editor. Currently we show a toast message that the image is downloading, which isn't so great. It'd be much better to animate in a progress bar view so that the user can view the download progress. It also doesn't appear that there's any messaging if the download fails, which can cause confusion.

report.summary: Gallery disappears after adding to uploaded post
report.label: bug
report.description: Edit an uploaded post Tap the image icon, select 'create gallery'. Save your gallery, you'll see the placeholder in the content area. Update the post, and observe that the gallery is lost.

report.summary: Refreshing stats on app open
report.label: bug
report.description: If the app is opened to the Stats panel, and you try to swipe to refresh, the UI appears to fail to refresh. However, after a few seconds stats update automatically, appearing the the app is performing a background refresh of the stats, but with no indication to the user that this is happening. Once the stats update, swiping to refresh works without issue. This doesn't happen if the app opens to a different panel, or you switch to a different panel and then switch back.

report.summary: Rotating the device when a comment is displayed add a new fragment to the stack
report.label: bug
report.description: Open a comment detail view from the comment list Rotate the device to change orientation Tap back -> you're not on the comment list Tap back again

report.summary: Video not added to editor
report.label: bug
report.description: On a Galaxy S, 480x800 display I recorded a video in landscape and rotated back to portrait before returning to the app. There was a blank space there, just as reported in #1407. Perhaps the video thumbnail is generated somewhere else and also need to be scaled better to fit in either portrait or landscape?

report.summary: Notification: Make sure to load the whole notification content for self-hosted site from PN
report.label: bug
report.description: A user reported an issue where he can't open the notification details screen from the notification center when tapping on the comment notification row. I bet the app doesn't refresh the notification content in background when receiving a PN object with the comment_id absent in the payload. The notification details screen requires both the blog_id, and the comment_id, to retrieve the actual notification data. Ref: http://android.forums.wordpress.org/topic/cant-read-comments-from-notifications-screen

report.summary: SNI prevents me from using the app
report.label: bug
report.description: Since Wordpress Android 2.9 and #1384, I can't use the application with my website. I don't have my own SSL certificate, so I use the shared certificate provided with my mutual hosting. But of course the certificate name doesn't match the website domain name, so the SNI failed and I always get the "We can't log you in" screen (full trace here). With a Web browser, I get a warning about that but I can tell that I'm OK to continue. But currently with the Wordpress app, unless I'm mistaken, I don't see any way to bypass the SNI. So I think you should add either an option to disable it or a warning dialog to bypass it as for a browser.

I spotted this error on June 7th, and admittedly haven't searched Issues to see if it's been raised before, so do with it what you will. Cheers.

report.summary: Script `tools/release-checks.sh` must delete the build/ directory after checks
report.label: bug
report.description: tools/release-checks.sh must be run before each release. if one run it and forgot to run ./gradlew assembleRelease after, an erroneous apk could be published.

report.summary: Reader opens multiple detail views
report.label: bug
report.description: If you quickly tap multiple times on an item in the reader list, multiple detail views will open.

report.summary: Draft post coming from nowhere after post has been published
report.label: bug
report.description: One user first noticed this behaviour of zombie draft posts. I noticed it, only after using the "Share picture with WordPress" feature a lot (but I'm not sure this is related). Publish post "A" via "Share with WordPress" Publish post "B" via "Share with WordPress" Publish post "..." via "Share with WordPress" Notice post "B" is published and a draft "B" is also there

report.summary: Some users lose content they're working on
report.label: bug
report.description: From a user: When sharing multiple photos to a post from the G+ gallery, several posts got stuck in local draft. I had to edit and publish again. Every post except one successfully published on the second attempt. One lost all content, including several images. We also have comments on the Play Store from users who lost their work and can't find a local draft version. Seems only related to local drafts. This is going to be hard to reproduce...

report.summary: Like animation in reader post detail shouldn't fade
report.label: bug
report.description: See https://cloudup.com/cacyjD6m6wF

report.summary: Adding a blog to the app with "Contributor" role does show a wrong error message
report.label: bug
report.description: Adding a blog to the app, in which your user role is "Contributor", will show you a Username/password prompt just after the login. I think the refresh blog task doesn't get the 401 error well, and fire/broadcast a wrong event. In this case username or password wrong.

report.summary: Fix our scripts in the `tools` directory
report.label: bug
report.description: In the https://github.com/wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Android/tree/feature/modularization branch we changed directory structure, so we need to edit scripts in tools/ to work with this new structure.

report.summary: Fix BlockQuote styling in comments detail view
report.label: bug
report.description: We should use WPQuoteSpan for blocks in comments, they have better formatting.

report.summary: Reader blog preview empty title
report.label: bug
report.description: If a feed has an empty title, it should show the feed domain. Right now it shows an empty white space instead.

report.summary: Reader followed blogs uses case insensitive sorting
report.label: bug
report.description: The list of followed blogs incorrectly uses case sensitive sorting by name.

report.label: bug

report.summary: ReaderSubsActivity issues
report.label: bug
report.description: ReaderTagActions.sanitizeTitle() should trim before replacing, to avoid replacing trailing/leading spaces with a dash ReaderSubsActivity.addAsTag() should trim the entry before comparing to followed tags The list of followed blogs appears to sort incorrectly when the blog name is empty (since it shows the domain in this situation)

report.summary: Depends on multi-configuration emailchecker 0.3 build
report.label: bug
report.description: This should solve an issue we have with a few device filtered out of the Play Store (and failing back to 2.5.1) because they don't declare "armeabi" as supported binary.

report.summary: Reader: hiding comment reply isn't intuitive
report.label: bug
report.description: Open reader post detail Tap Reply under a comment Tap back to hide the soft keyboard Tapping back again returns to the post list Fix: if reply text field is showing, back button should hide it rather than return to the list.

report.summary: Posts list onSelect post animation is weird
report.label: bug
report.description: It seems a fade animation is mixed with a slide in animation

report.summary: Unfollow error and follow/following button inconsistencies
report.label: bug
report.description: Unfollow a blog On unfollow failure, taped button resets to "Following" Notice other follow buttons on other posts from the same blog doesn't reset See: https://cloudup.com/ctWNASPEICX Note: surely a server issue, unfollowing a RSS feed fails almost everytime.

report.label: bug

report.summary: Refresh of Stats doesn't work if you switch app
report.label: bug
report.description: Refresh of the statistics does not correctly work if the app was open on the Stats screen and you switch back from another one. Steps to reproduce the issue: Open the app and go to the Stats screen Before the refresh ends switch to another app Go back to WordPress Refresh of stats doesn't work

report.summary: Can't moderate Jetpack site stats in certain scenario
report.label: bug
report.description: Sign in to WordPress.com for a username that is connected to a Jetpack site. Add the self-hosted site to the app. From notifications, try to moderate a comment. You should see an error message. If you swap steps #1 and #2, the issue isn't there.

report.summary: Reader reblog icon stays orange
report.label: bug
report.description: In Reader, click on a post to view full post. Click on reblog. Button turns orange. Change your mind about reblogging and press physical back button. Reblog button is still orange.

report.summary: Comment/like count doesn't change after returning from Reader detail
report.label: bug
report.description: If you comment on a post or like a post from the detail view, the comment/like count doesn't increase when you return to the list view.

report.summary: Reader doesn't update when resumed
report.label: bug
report.description: If the app is paused while the reader list view is showing, if the user returns to the app after a long time it doesn't automatically update (ie: check for new posts).

report.summary: QuickPress is broken
report.label: bug
report.description: Go to widgets, and add QuickPress to your home screen. Select a blog. Observe that the QuickPress shortcut is not added. This is on Android 4.4.3 on a Moto G.

report.summary: Crash when first loading comment
report.label: bug
report.description: 07-29 11:47:10.414 2597-2597/org.wordpress.android E/AndroidRuntime﹕ FATAL EXCEPTION: main java.lang.NullPointerException at org.wordpress.android.ui.comments.CommentsListFragment$UpdateCommentsTask.onPostExecute(CommentsListFragment.java:516) at org.wordpress.android.ui.comments.CommentsListFragment$UpdateCommentsTask.onPostExecute(CommentsListFragment.java:410) at android.os.AsyncTask.finish(AsyncTask.java:631) at android.os.AsyncTask.access$600(AsyncTask.java:177) at android.os.AsyncTask$InternalHandler.handleMessage(AsyncTask.java:644) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:137) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:4745) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:511) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:786) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:553) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)

report.summary: Notifications stuck, won't sync
report.label: bug
report.description: A user's notifications stopped syncing in the 3.0 beta. The only solution was to force quite the app and launch it again, which got them working again. We should make sure the connection is working when the NotificationsActivity starts, or perhaps we just need to make sure the buckets have started.

report.summary: Images in Reader comments aren't tappable
report.label: bug
report.description: Images in comments should display ReaderPhotoViewerActivity when tapped.

report.summary: Crash report 3.0: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: ZoomButtonsController
report.label: bug
report.description: Remove all references to setBuiltInZoomControls

report.summary: Achievement icon too big in notification
report.label: bug

report.summary: Application is killed/restarted causing multiple issues
report.label: bug
report.description: The issue probably comes from a commit between 3.0-beta-3 and 3.0-rc-1

report.summary: Reader: smarter extraction of featured image
report.label: bug
report.description: The code to choose a featured image when one isn't defined is slow and sometimes fails due to the faulty detection of single-quoted attributes.

report.summary: Reader not opening YouTube app for videos?
report.label: bug
report.description: Unconfirmed user report: http://android.forums.wordpress.org/topic/videos-not-working-291

report.summary: Unclosed file resource in StatUtils
report.label: bug
report.description: The file opened here is never closed.

report.summary: Last activity is no longer restored
report.label: bug
report.description: This looks like a recently introduced problem. We have a string constant here which contains the pref key to store the last active activity name, but there's a different hard-coded pref key here which is what the app relies on to return to the last active activity. As a result the last active activity isn't restored when the app is next started. Note: we also use the same hard-coded pref key here

report.summary: Auto-linked url are not editable
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps: Share a link to the WP app (e.g. Chrome -> Share -> WP) The link appears in the Content TextEdit but can't be edited by tapping the "link" icon.

report.summary: Reader: Action buttons not shown when bottom of post detail is reached
report.label: bug
report.description: Open a long reader article, maybe one with comments. Scroll to the bottom. Observe that the action buttons and action bar do not appear. Reproduced on 3.0.2 on a Moto G running 4.4.3

report.summary: AuthenticatedWebViewActivity fails with no current blog
report.label: bug
report.description: Hide all blogs Open notifications Tap a note that shows a list of people (ex: someone followed your blog) Tap a person in the list to open their blog Instead of opening the blog, you see a toast saying "An error occurred when accessing this blog." This is because the AuthenticatedWebViewActivity used to display the page requires a current blog.

report.summary: Reader detail web content doesn't appear during swipe
report.label: bug
report.description: When swiping through posts in ReaderPostPagerActivity, sometimes the content of the post being swiped into view doesn't appear until you raise your finger to end the swipe (even if the swipe is incomplete). Demo video here

report.summary: Empty line in the blog selector when sharing a text/picture to a blog with an empty name
report.label: bug
report.description: We should display the blog url instead of the empty string (like it's done in other places).

report.summary: Bug: comments not appearing in Reader detail
report.label: bug
report.description: This video shows that there's a comment on the post, but tapping through to the detail view doesn't show any comments. https://cloudup.com/czV7UyIkrYA

report.summary: Logout then login gives you an empty notification screen
report.label: bug
report.description: Be logged in or Login. Go to Notifications and check you have some. Logout. Login. Go to Notifications, you'll see an empty screen. The only way to get notification back in sync is to kill and restart the app.

report.summary: App hangs when signing out
report.label: bug
report.description: From an activity, open the menu and tap 'Sign out'. There's a visible lag as the app crunches through some work. Perhaps it needs an AsyncTask?

report.summary: Short comment notifications don't display properly in detail view
report.label: bug
report.description: If a comment is less than one line, it will be wrapped incorrectly in the notification comment detail view.

report.summary: Reader post detail fails to show posts that aren't already downloaded
report.label: bug
report.description: When calling ReaderActivityLauncher.showReaderPostDetail() to show a single post in the Reader, the post never appears if it hasn't already been downloaded due to this. I've tagged this for 3.2 since it needs to be fixed in order for the notification redesign to work.

report.summary: Reader doesn't load FP after upgrade
report.label: bug
report.description: FP remains empty after the reader db is upgraded - have to switch to another tag and then back again for anything to appear. https://cloudup.com/cIBIODzMYqT This was seen while using PR #1799.

report.summary: IllegalStateException in ReaderPostTable.getPostFromCursor()
report.label: bug
report.description: Crash reports show several instances of an IllegalStateException here. Problem may be due to not having default values for the post_id and blog_id fields.

report.summary: Back button doesn't work on MediaGalleryActivity
report.label: bug
report.description: ... when "Don't keep activities" is enabled (When EditPostContentFragment is recreated, MediaGalleryActivity is re-launched).

report.summary: Reader post detail header avatar is low res
report.label: bug
report.description: Assigning to myself, I have a patch ;)

report.summary: Crashlytics seems disabled / misconfigured in 3.2.x
report.label: bug
report.description: No description provided.

report.summary: IllegalStateException in ReaderPostDetail
report.label: bug
report.description: Reader detail may crash when a very large 'text' column is stored. Same cause as #1838, which was fixed by skipping the text column when viewing a list of posts, which won't work in the reader detail view since the text is necessary. Possible solution is to detect the size of the JSON text when parsing the response and limiting how much of it is stored.

report.summary: Empty Posts List in Blog Preview after Subscribing
report.label: bug
report.description: Go to the Reader, tap tag icon and swipe to 'Followed Blogs' tab. Enter in the URL to a blog that you aren't following yet. After the blog has been added, tap it in the list to show the blog preview. Observe that the posts list never shows any posts. After an (in-person!) discussion with @nbradbury, he thinks it might be that the app doesn't know what the siteId is for the site yet which is why no posts are shown.

report.summary: Reader doesn't resize video elements
report.label: bug
report.description: Embedded video elements aren't resized to fit the display width, causing them to extend beyond the viewport.

report.summary: Try to merge AuthenticatedWebViewActivity and DotComAuthenticatedWebViewActivity
report.label: bug
report.description: We should try to merge those two webviews in one. AuthenticatedWebViewActivity is used in a lot of places so we need to be extremely careful with testing. Keeping it for the next week when I will be on a big monitor :)

report.summary: Inserting big images can break the width of certain themes
report.label: bug
report.description: From one of our user: When using the web-based interface, if an image is inserted too large for a theme's width, the largest version possible for the theme is displayed. Something about how the image is inserted using the app makes this value absolute for the image and breaks the width of a few templates I have tested with on .org (twenty-fourteen and interface at least).﻿

report.summary: Empty user names in follow notifications
report.label: bug
report.description: See screenshot below and followed your blog WP Beta: Note: this is a self hosted JP blog.

report.summary: Reader comment likes don't stick
report.label: bug
report.description: Example: https://cloudup.com/cKuRBKMMxzx

report.summary: Liking a post in the reader list may remove its content
report.label: bug
report.description: When the user likes a post in the reader list view, the content may be removed and will not appear in the detail view.

report.summary: Post is blank after an error during the upload
report.label: bug
report.description: From a user: I just tried to upload a post to WordPress using the latest version of the Android app, but instead it has deleted the entire content on the post. The progress bar showed it had uploaded all the images, then at the last second it gave an error saying missing peer certificate or something like that. When I opened it again in the WordPress App, it was blank! Only the post settings (keywords/categories etc) remain. I was able to upload a different post 5 min before and I have uploaded one since as well (5 min after this happened). I checked on the server and the post is there, but it's blank. Only categories are there. Pictures are on the server, but not attached to any post. Not sure how this could happen, may worth to take a closer look at the posting service.

report.summary: Reader featured image isn't shown in blog preview
report.label: bug
report.description: If you look at the Blogs I Follow section, the posts appear with a featured image. If you click through to just that blog in the Reader, the posts don’t have a featured image. The first time you click through to just the blog, the images are there for an instant before they go away. Note: the site shown in the screenshot is claresbeauty.wordpress.com

report.summary: Opening app from a push notification can show a blank/stuck screen
report.label: bug
report.description: Multiple users have reported that when they open the app from a push notification, the app will be blank and never load. 'WordPress' is displayed in the ActionBar with no other content displayed.

report.summary: ReaderImageScanner should account for white space
report.label: bug
report.description: ReaderImageScanner accounts for white space when matching tags but this isn't taken into account when attributes are extracted

report.summary: Notifications reply icon is incorrect
report.label: bug
report.description: Maybe the recent icon updates caused this. The icon should be the reply arrow.

report.summary: Make sure "today" values are shown even when stats are all zero
report.label: bug
report.description: If today numbers are zero, the app shows stats for yesterday and the day before yesterday in the sections below the graph. It should show for example “no top posts and pages” for today and the yesterday's stats.

report.summary: Update the stats icon before 3.4 release

report.description: with https://wordpress.com/i/noticons/example.html#milestone

report.label: bug
report.description: On a dual pane post list: when switching from a blog with a selected post to a blog with no post: Note: This will be fixed when we drop the dual pane screens.

report.summary: Reader detail fails to show images in private posts
report.label: bug
report.description: Not sure when this started happening, but at some point reader detail lost the ability to show images in private posts (they appear as broken images now).

report.summary: Reader comment form has goofy margin
report.label: bug
report.description: Looks like this should span the full width, but there's some blue space to the sides:

report.summary: 'WordPress' displayed as title in post preview
report.label: bug
report.description: Load a post like notification Tap the title at the top Observe 'WordPress' displayed in the title:

report.summary: Awkward bit of scrolling in the nav drawer
report.label: bug
report.description: With the addition of the header, there's now a tiny amount of scroll in the nav drawer. Maybe we can tighten it up a bit to get rid of that scroll so you can clearly see all of the items? https://cloudup.com/cTrPoWDu7_y

report.summary: Reader: Post List RecyclerView should restore its scroll offset on rotate/recreate
report.label: bug
report.description: While converting notifications to use RecyclerView, I noticed that the Reader doesn't preserve the list scroll position when you rotate. I think we can use this property to get the position of visible elements: https://developer.android.com/reference/android/support/v7/widget/LinearLayoutManager.html#findFirstCompletelyVisibleItemPosition()

report.summary: getBestDateTimePattern is not available in API level lower than 18
report.label: bug
report.description: Replace that call for lower Android versions.

report.summary: Moderation progressbar needs rounding
report.label: bug
report.description: Since the switch to round avatars, we need to match up the moderation progress bar overlay to be circular as well:

report.summary: Flicker when switching between drawer activities
report.label: bug
report.description: When switching between drawer activities, there's sometimes some very brief flicker on the incoming activity. Hard to reproduce, but I see it most often when switching between posts and comments.

report.label: bug
report.description: java.lang.NullPointerException at org.wordpress.android.ui.comments.CommentsActivity$2.onActionResult(CommentsActivity.java:273) at org.wordpress.android.ui.comments.CommentActions$11$1.run(CommentActions.java:397) at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:730) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:92) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:137) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5166) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Method.java) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:525) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:745) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:561) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(NativeStart.java)

report.summary: Reader: Adding a comment reply won't appear at correct indent hierarcy
report.label: bug
report.description: If you reply to a comment in the Reader, it will show at the correct indent for a split second, and then reappear with no indent: https://cloudup.com/c3ER9PBYSC0

report.summary: Reader should check attachments for suitable featured image
report.label: bug
report.description: Right now the reader scans IMG tags looking for a suitable featured image when one isn't specified in the post, but it should first check the attachments when the post is initially parsed.

report.summary: Set toolbar title keyline to match material guidelines
report.label: bug
report.description: The toolbar title should be 72dp from the left according to these guidelines: http://www.google.com/design/spec/layout/metrics-keylines.html Also see: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/26455027/android-api-21-toolbar-padding

report.summary: Nothing happens when a follower is tapped
report.label: bug
report.description: Tapping someone in your list of "Recent Followers" should show you that person's blog, but instead it does nothing - video demo.

report.summary: Nav Drawer Layout Issues
report.label: bug
report.description: These appear to be isolated to Android 4.X, I don't see it on Lollipop: Blog spinner doesn't have proper right padding. (Note, I had a similar issue in Simplenote and I fixed it by changing the drawer layout's width to match_parent) Drawer shadow gets cut off at the bottom.

report.summary: Push notification icon looks empty on lollipop
report.label: bug
report.description: The icon that appears when you have more than one PN looks empty on Lollipop due to the lighter background.

report.summary: Reader detail follow color
report.label: bug
report.description: Customer reports that clicking the follow button in Reader detail correctly changed the color of the button text but didn't change the text to "Following." Scrolling down and then back up somehow corrected the text. Same thing happened a couple of times while viewing Freshly Pressed, but unable to repro after leaving FP and coming back to it.

report.summary: Weird status bar color on 10" tablet landscape
report.label: bug
report.description: Probably due to the transparent-status-bar-under-navigation-drawer patch

report.summary: Notification detail list flicker
report.label: bug
report.description: Start the app fresh. Load notifications, tap into a like or follow notification Observe for a few seconds, and you'll see a flicker as all of the list reloads.

report.summary: FAB is out of place on a landscape tablet
report.label: bug
report.description: I believe it should be in the right corner of the detail view in this case. Probably a lot of work because we'd need to do something about the toolbar in the detail view:

report.summary: Users report the hamburger icon is not tapable
report.label: bug
report.description: Happens at least on a LG Optimus G and a Huawei Ascend G510

report.summary: ANR on the Notification screen
report.label: bug
report.description: Simperium/simperium-android#167

report.summary: Users report landing screen is always "Posts" since 3.5
report.label: bug
report.description: The app should reopen the last active activity. I tested a bit and I can't reproduce the problem (last active activity is reoppened).

report.summary: Stats: Viewing post shows 'WordPress' in Reader title
report.label: bug
report.description: When you tap on a post title in Stats, it shows the post in the Reader but it says 'WordPress' in the title. I believe it will use the activity title if it is available, but perhaps it isn't able to get it because there's a Spinner being used in the action bar?

report.summary: Autocorrect stopped working in comment reply field
report.label: bug
report.description: If you reply to a comment in Notifications or the Reader, you won't get any autocorrect suggestions above the keyboard. From a quick poke around in the code, it appears to be related to using a subclass of AutoCompleteTextView

report.summary: Notifications: Fall back to using URL when loading blog preview
report.label: bug
report.description: Some wp.com users don't have a primary site, so the api won't provide a site id. We should fall back to using the Url if it was provided, and open it in the in-app browser.

report.summary: Stats: Should we fall back to using URL when loading blog preview of private blogs, or HTTP protected blogs
report.label: bug
report.description: Some wp.com users have a primary site marked as private, so the Reader API will receive a 403 as response code (ex: https://public-api.wordpress.com/rest/v1/sites/kevinjmorrisuk.wordpress.com ) and the UI shows a simple error message "Unable to show this blog" in a Toast. I don't have much control over the Reader Blog Preview page from Stats, so it's hard for me to do something if an error occurs in the Reader. Should we modify the Blog preview page, and open the blog URL in the in-app browser when something is wrong with the REST API call? I bet we have the same issue on self-hosted blog that are HTTP password protected. /cc @nbradbury @roundhill

report.summary: Stats: Pictures are shown as entry in "Posts and Pages" module but cannot be opened in Reader
report.label: bug
report.description: Pictures are shown as top-level entry in "Posts and Pages" module, but cannot be opened in the Reader when tapping on them. The Reader api returns a 404 error since they are not posts/pages. This should be probably fixed in the backend. A new field that identifies the kind of the item should do the trick. Once we see a picture, we will call the in-app web browser instead of Reader.

report.summary: Edit comment activity background should be white
report.label: bug
report.description: Title has it, it is currently the light blue color.

report.summary: Alignment, line height, and maybe letter spacing is off for the View All link.
report.label: bug
report.description: Alignment, line height, and maybe letter spacing is off for the View All link. See what I mean: https://cloudup.com/cbOSteYVppY

report.summary: “No stats available” message should use the same copy/style as the “No activity this period”
report.label: bug
report.description: “No stats available” message should use the same copy/style as the “No activity this period” and overlay an empty chart with “ghost” bars to indicate that the days are still tappable. Compare to web stats.

report.summary: Crash report 3.6: ClassCastException in StatsCommentsFragment
report.label: bug
report.description: java.lang.ClassCastException: com.android.volley.NoConnectionError cannot be cast to org.wordpress.android.ui.stats.models.CommentFollowersModel at org.wordpress.android.ui.stats.StatsCommentsFragment.updateUI(StatsCommentsFragment.java:87) at org.wordpress.android.ui.stats.StatsAbstractListFragment$3.onReceive(StatsAbstractListFragment.java:412) at android.support.v4.content.LocalBroadcastManager.executePendingBroadcasts(LocalBroadcastManager.java:297) at android.support.v4.content.LocalBroadcastManager.access$000(LocalBroadcastManager.java:46) at android.support.v4.content.LocalBroadcastManager$1.handleMessage(LocalBroadcastManager.java:116) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:176) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5317) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Method.java) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:511) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:1102) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:869) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(NativeStart.java)

report.summary: SwipeRefreshLayout is not displayed in freshly created activities
report.label: bug
report.description: When creating activities which use the SwipeToRefreshHelper, the SwipeRefreshLayout isn't displayed while loading. This appears to be a known issue with the v4 support library (since 21.0.0). It seems that the SwipeRefreshLayout is actually loading and working properly, but it's hidden behind the action bar. Some discussion and possible workarounds here.

report.summary: Previewing a theme permanently sets title
report.label: bug
report.description: If you load a theme, and tap 'Live Preview', the preview is loaded and changes the title to the URL of the site. If you leave the preview, the URL title sticks.

report.summary: Reader shouldn't show WP icon for non-WP sites

report.summary: Reader opens incorrect post
report.label: bug
report.description: After unfollowing a blog from the detail view and returning to the list view, tapping a post opens the wrong detail.

report.summary: Reader empty blog message shows on failure
report.label: bug
report.description: In blog preview, if the request to get the posts for a blog fails the user sees a message saying "this blog is empty." It should instead say that the posts could not be loaded.

report.summary: Blogs with no title show in unexpected spot in show/hide blogs view
report.label: bug
report.description: Add a site to your account that has no title Go to Settings -> Show/hide WordPress.com blogs You'll find the site in the 'h' section of the list (I'm assuming because of the 'http' in the site URL)

report.summary: Show/Hide WordPress.com blogs list shows app icon
report.label: bug
report.description: If a site in the Show/Hide WordPress.com blogs list doesn't have a blavatar, it shows the app icon which looks a bit strange with the new materialized icon. It should use a standard WP logo.

report.summary: 3.7 ReaderPostList NoSuchMethod exception
report.label: bug
report.description: Caused by using API 16 removeOnGlobalLayoutListener() instead of the deprecated removeGlobalOnLayoutListener() here.

report.summary: Notifications: Correct site id retrieval for 'site' range type
report.label: bug
report.description: The app is incorrectly looking for site_id in a site range, it should be pulling id.

report.summary: Layout issues with group items on period change (ie. Referrers)
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce: Go to the Stats menu Scroll down to the Referrers section Expand some of the sites including multiple URLs Scroll back up and tap on the graph to choose a different date Scroll down: some of the previously expanded links still appear over the new data.

report.summary: Can't insert pictures via share intent if in the process of uploading another post
report.label: bug
report.description: This is an edgecase. It should probably be prioritized as such. I start photo-posts by sharing from the gallery to the WordPress app. If I start uploading a post like that, and then immediately start another, no photo will be inserted in the post editor. Steps to reproduce: open photo gallery, share photo to WordPress app, hit publish before the previous post has successfully uploaded, pick another photo in the photo gallery, share to the WordPress app to start a post The 2nd post will be empty. There will be a brief toast that says "Loading...", but no photo is inserted in the editor. Here's a logcat: https://cloudup.com/ccFZ1t8RjMG The obvious workaround is to wait for the first post to upload before starting the next.

report.summary: Reader occasionally shows 'New Posts' after refresh.
report.label: bug
report.description: A few times this weekend I returned to the app in the Reader, and it automatically refreshed the list. But sometimes it wouldn't save my place in the list, instead refreshing the entire list and I was at the top and lost my place. It still showed the 'New Posts ^' button even though I was at the very top of the new posts. I think it's only doing this if the app was killed and is starting up again. Hard one to reproduce.

report.summary: Action bar text looks small in landscape orientation
report.label: bug

report.summary: Reader comment empty message not removed after adding comment
report.label: bug
report.description: If you go to the comments for a post that doesn't have any comments, the message "No comments yet" appears in the middle of the screen. This message needs to be removed if you post a comment.

report.summary: Update XMLRPCClientCustomizableJSONMock and XMLRPCClientCustomizableXMLMock
report.label: bug
report.description: XMLRPCClientInterface interface changed (new getResponse() method), both mocks should be updated accordingly

report.summary: Sometimes tapping a notification leads to blank screen
report.label: bug
report.description: Would be great to get to the bottom of the missing notification, but if it can't be found the previous activity should be loaded.

report.summary: Media: Keyboard remains visible when tapping back button
report.label: bug
report.description: Its possible to dismiss the edit media screen, and even open the menu, without dismissing the keyboard. To reproduce: Open the menu and tap Media Tap an item to view its detail Tap to edit the item Tap into one of the textfields to invoke the keyboard. Tap the back button on the Action bar You've navigated back to the detail view but the keyboard is still visible. Bonus: Keep tapping back til you reach the root activity Tap to open the menu. The keyboard is still present.

report.summary: Offline delete media item doesn't work as expected on API 16
report.label: bug
report.description: Per discussion on #2426, this was only noticed on API 16.

report.summary: Clean the "uploading" state for failed post uploads or app crash
report.label: bug
report.description: In some cases PostUploadService.onDestroy() is not called, and a post could be stuck in "uploading" state. It's tricky but we must find a way to clean this state in some cases on PostsList onCreate.

report.summary: Make sure to correctly track the .com login state in Tracks
report.label: bug
report.description: There is an issue where logged out .com users are incorrectly seen by the Tracks tracker as logged in. Background: We've recently implemented an enhancement in the app where the .com username is retained across logout. We now need to be carefully when checking the .com login state. otherwise we can end up in issues like this one, where the user is not logged to .com, but the .com username is stored in preferences, and the tracks was incorrectly assuming that the user was logger.

report.summary: Report 3.9: "View site" authentication issue
report.label: bug
report.description: Maybe worth a 3.9.1 if the issue happens for all users. Comment from the Play Store: Every time I go to "View Site" it asks me to login first A second one: After the last update keeps asking you to log in each time you start (remember the option is ignored) Another one: Every time I want to "view full site" on my blog I need to put in my password even though I checked the "remember this password" box. This never happened before the update.

report.summary: Graph looks a bit off on low numbers Stats
report.label: bug
report.description: Seems that the graph library grabs the highest number and then uses it as the top line of the graph. It then tries to find the halfway mark by dividing that by two and displaying that line. However if the highest number is odd it still only displays the half way line as a rounded integer which throws off the visual.

report.summary: Reader: status bar glitch after viewing photo
report.label: bug
report.description: When returning to the reader after viewing an image in the full-screen photo viewer, there's sometimes a graphical glitch in the status bar. I'm pretty sure this is an Android bug which has since been fixed, but I recall a similar bug elsewhere that was resolved by changing an activity's background from a @color to an actual @drawable.

report.summary: Cannot mark a comment as SPAM from the notifications screen
report.label: bug
report.description: I was trying to mark a comment as spam from the notifications screen, but wasn't able to do that. Steps to repro: Receive a notification of new comment Go to the Notifications screen and tap on the comment Tap on the Spam icon The app takes you back to the notifications screen, but the comment is still there, and it's not marked as spam. You can tap on the comment again, open the details screen, and check the status of the comment: Still marked as "Pending" or "Approved"; Refreshing notifications doesn't help.

report.summary: Image viewer is really pixellated and ugly
report.label: bug
report.description: Testing on a nexus 7 device with android 5.1, app 4.0-rc-2. This is what the image viewer looks like. I think it's the fact that the images are coerced/skewed to a landscape format.

report.summary: geo location gets cleared on updating the post

report.description: Self hosted blog Steps on the app (Android, Version 3.9.1) Steps to replicate on the App Create a post Geo tag the post Publish - Great, the post is geo tagged (verified on the site) Edit post - edit contents of the post Update/publish, the post geo tag gets cleared (verified on the site) Edit post again Update/publish, the post geo tag appears again (verified on the site) Let me know if you need any more information to replicate

report.summary: Crash report 3.9.1: AssertionError in StatsCommentsFragment
report.label: bug
report.description: I've checked all reports, it an Android 4.2.2 bug only. Probably a platform bug. I tried to repro on a 4.2.2 emulator with en-gb or en-au selected but it didn't crashed. Also it's weird because the crash occurs on a Fragment.getString(STR, number) call only in StatsCommentsFragment, when it's also used other stats fragment (StatsFollowersFragment for example). It's rare (8 users affected), but I suspect it's super annoying (crash loop on app start). java.lang.AssertionError: couldn't initialize LocaleData for locale en-gb at libcore.icu.LocaleData.initLocaleData(LocaleData.java:167) at libcore.icu.LocaleData.get(LocaleData.java:121) at java.util.Formatter.format(Formatter.java:1039) at java.util.Formatter.format(Formatter.java:1009) at java.lang.String.format(String.java:1988) at android.content.res.Resources.getString(Resources.java:445) at android.app.Fragment.getString(Fragment.java:801) at org.wordpress.android.ui.stats.StatsCommentsFragment.updateUI(StatsCommentsFragment.java:92) at org.wordpress.android.ui.stats.StatsAbstractListFragment$3.onReceive(StatsAbstractListFragment.java:456) at android.support.v4.content.LocalBroadcastManager.executePendingBroadcasts(LocalBroadcastManager.java:297) at android.support.v4.content.LocalBroadcastManager.access$000(LocalBroadcastManager.java:46) at android.support.v4.content.LocalBroadcastManager$1.handleMessage(LocalBroadcastManager.java:116) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:107) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:194) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5422) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Method.java) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:525) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:837) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:604) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(NativeStart.java)

report.summary: Stats - Handle Authentication issues for Jetpack sites
report.label: bug
report.description: There are a couple of problems with Jetpack sites. Make sure .com authentication is working fine in the following situations: Blank app, add a Jetpack site, Go to Stats. (The .com login should popup here and credentials should be stored at blog level) App connected with .com account. Add a Jetpack site that is already connected with the same .com account. Go to stats, the app should try to load the stats by using the main .com account App connected with .com account. Add a Jetpack site that is NOT connected with main .com account. Go to stats, the app should try to load the stats by using the main .com account, then the login to .com should popup. Inserting the correct credentials must load stats.

report.summary: Reader should update db when a blog is removed from a list
report.label: bug
report.description: If you remove a blog from a custom list, the posts that were downloaded before are not removed. /cc @nbradbury

report.summary: Replying from comment page doesn't refresh the comments list
report.label: bug
report.description: If you go into My Site -> Comments -> Single Comment and reply to a comment and go back to the Comments page, the new comment is not added to the list. I think we should trigger a refresh when a new comment is added through the app.

report.summary: PostsActivity leaked
report.label: bug
report.description: While trying out LeakCanary I discovered a leak in PostsActivity. I believe the leak is caused by calling WordPress.setOnPostUploadedListener(this)in the list fragment here without ever removing that listener when the fragment is destroyed.

report.summary: EditPostActivity leaked
report.label: bug
report.description: LeakCanary shows EditPostActivity is being leaked. This appears to be caused by HtmlToSpannedConverter using a static reference to the passed context here.

report.summary: WPMainActivity leaked
report.label: bug
report.description: WPMainActivity is leaked due a static notification listener.

report.summary: NotificationsDetailActivity leaked
report.label: bug

report.summary: Back button doesn't quit the app
report.label: bug
report.description: Reproduced on 4.0 and 4.1. On a "root" activity (Reader or Notifications for instance) tap the back button, the current activity restarts. Expected behavior: the app is put in background and the home screen is shown. Problem comes from our WPLaunchActivity which is still in the activity backstack, so when a "root" activity finishes, WPLaunchActivity is created and re-launch the current "root" activity.

report.summary: Reader swipe-to-refresh progress should overlap toolbar
report.label: bug
report.description: As a result of #2694 the swipe-to-refresh progress appears from underneath the tag toolbar, which violates material layering. It should appear above the toolbar instead.

report.summary: Reader tag toolbar overlaps after rotating
report.label: bug
report.description: If you rotate the device while the reader post list is scrolled, the tag toolbar appears at the top and overlaps the topmost post. A similar bug occurs after tapping the "new posts" message.

report.summary: Double animation when launching app
report.label: bug
report.description: Starting the app briefly animates in the launch activity, then animates in the main activity. Demo video here.

report.summary: SSL certificate verification error
report.label: bug
report.description:
When attempting to log in to my self-hosted install, I get an error that I could not be logged in, and the following application log output: WordPress Android version: 4.1 Android device name: Motorola Nexus 6
01 - resetting suggestion tables 02 - Number of old stats deleted : 0 03 - NewAccountAbstractOage.onCreate() 04 - trackLastActivity, activityId: Login Screen 05 - SSLPeerUnverifiedException failed. Erroneous SSL certificate detected. 06 - Exception received from XMLRPC call wp.getUsersBlogs - exception: No peer certificate 07 - StackTrace: javax.net.ssl.SSLPeerUnverifiedException: No peer certificate at com.android.org.conscrypt.SSLNullSession.getPeerCertificates(SSLNullSession.java:104) at org.apache.http.conn.ssl.AbstractVerifier.verify(AbstractVerifier.java:98) at org.apache.http.conn.ssl.SSLSocketFactory.createSocket(SSLSocketFactory.java:393) at org.apache.http.impl.conn.DefaultClientConnectionOperator.openConnection(DefaultClientConnectionOperator.java:170) at org.apache.http.impl.conn.AbstractPoolEntry.open(AbstractPoolEntry.java:169) at org.apache.http.impl.conn.AbstractPooledConnAdapter.open(AbstractPooledConnAdapter.java:124) at org.apache.http.impl.client.DefaultRequestDirector.execute(DefaultRequestDirector.java:365) at org.apache.http.impl.client.AbstractHttpClient.execute(AbstractHttpClient.java:560) at org.apache.http.impl.client.AbstractHttpClient.execute(AbstractHttpClient.java:492) at org.apache.http.impl.client.AbstractHttpClient.execute(AbstractHttpClient.java:470) at org.xmlrpc.android.XMLRPCClient$Caller.callXMLRPC(XMLRPCClient.java:482) at org.xmlrpc.android.XMLRPCClient$Caller.access$000(XMLRPCClient.java:412) at org.xmlrpc.android.XMLRPCClient.call(XMLRPCClient.java:229) at org.xmlrpc.android.XMLRPCClient.call(XMLRPCClient.java:213) at org.wordpress.android.ui.accounts.helpers.FetchBlogListWPOrg$FetchBlogListTask.doInBackground(FetchBlogListWPOrg.java:254) at org.wordpress.android.ui.accounts.helpers.FetchBlogListWPOrg$FetchBlogListTask.doInBackground(FetchBlogListWPOrg.java:225) at android.os.AsyncTask$2.call(AsyncTask.java:292) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:237) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1112) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:587) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:818)
08 - Server response: I know that my SSL certificate is valid, and I have verified that using SSL Labs. This leads me to believe that it's an issue with the implementation of SSL authentication in the app.

report.summary: Reader: problems trying to follow by url
report.label: bug
report.description: When trying to follow a blog by URL in ReaderSubsActivity fails, we simply show a toast saying "Unable to follow this blog." It would be more helpful if we could display friendlier toasts for the most common problems (ie: 301, 401 and 404).

report.summary: Post content can be lost if you publish before editor loads images
report.label: bug
report.description: Add a lot of images (I tested with 15) to a new post. Save the post as a draft. Edit the post again. Quick! Before the images load in the content area, press Publish. The post will be uploaded empty, because the app grabs whatever is in the EditText and uploads it (which is nothing because the content loading task hasn't finished yet) Pretty simple solution would be to just disable the Publish/Save button until the content loading task completes.

report.summary: Can't Choose to Trush Self Signed SSL
report.label: bug
report.description: I've had a few reports and have now tested on a couple of test sites. When you input your credentials it asks if you want to see details, and either accept or not accept the certificate. Details shows a blank screen and choosing Yes to accept just brings back the same message again. This is an example line from the app logs: SSLHandshakeException failed. Erroneous SSL certificate detected.

report.summary: Notification settings are empty
report.label: bug
report.description: Selecting Me > Account Settings > Manage Notifications results in a blank screen. Tapping the back button from there results in a blank Settings screen. Bug does not exist in 4.1 or 4.2.

report.summary: Media grid spinner hacks
report.label: bug
report.description: MediaGridFragment uses a series of hacks to prevent the spinner listener from firing when the selection is made programmatically. and to avoid it firing when ActionMode is enabled. See here and here and likely elsewhere. Hat tip to @fliespl for noticing this problem in #2901.

report.summary: Reader: ReaderTagList.isSameList should compare endpoints
report.label: bug
report.description: The app relies on ReaderTagList.isSameList to determine when followed tags have changed, but this routine doesn't consider changes to the endpoints of existing tags.

report.summary: Disappearing My Sites FAB
report.label: bug

report.summary: Language preference not honored on orientation change
report.label: bug
report.description: Attempted fix in #3122, commit was reversed.

report.summary: [Analytics] Track Jetpack installations
report.label: bug
report.description: We're not tracking Jetpack logins...and it's not easy to do it. We need to wait until blog options are synched, and bump stats if the value of the option jetpack_client_id is changed. (On the XML-RPC layer the only way to know if a blog is Jetpack powered is to read a blog option).

report.summary: After selecting Reply to a comment on an article there is no way to reply directly to the post
report.label: bug
report.description: Found in #3104; After clicking Reply to reply to a comment I notice the input EditText changes to Reply to comment... but I can't figure out how to cancel that and change back to Reply to post... It's probably best to solve this by returning to Reply to post... if the keyboard is dismissed from a Reply to comment... state.

report.summary: Deleted comments still shown in reader
report.label: bug
report.description: Found in #3104; Sometimes comments deleted via the Comments page (accessed from My Site fragment) are still being shown in the reader comments section. I deleted all those Test* comments then went back to add more to the article. All the deleted comments were still there ... I couldn't reproduce it until I replied to a comment.

I see the following trace in Tracks when opening the app by tapping on a Push Notification: stdClass Object ( [events] => Array ( [0] => Array ( [_en] => wpandroid_notifications_accessed [_ul] => daniloercoli [_ts] => 1442852724838 )
[1] => Array ( [_en] => wpandroid_application_opened [_ul] => daniloercoli [_ts] => 1442852725082 )
[2] => Array ( [_en] => wpandroid_notifications_accessed [_ul] => daniloercoli [_ts] => 1442852725136 )
[3] => Array ( [last_visible_screen] => Notifications [_en] => wpandroid_application_closed [time_in_app] => 2 [_ul] => daniloercoli [_ts] => 1442852727784 ) )
.... The first wpandroid_notifications_accessed is even tracked before the application started event.

report.summary: Deferred initialization causes problem with Mixpanel
report.label: bug
report.description:
Loading account details is deferred, and may happen after we start tracking events. Deferred initialization introduced here b3bc0a0 What's happen in details: The commit above does move the loading of the user account on a separate thread. Meanwhile, before the initialization happens, the Analytics libraries could have already tracked some events when the app is in a state where the main .com account is still blank. Libraries tracks the user as a new anon user that is later (few events later in Tracks) aliased with the correct .com user On Tracks we should not have problems (*need to double check this with the team), but in Mixpanel we have problems since the user is tracked as 2 distinct users. Below is a picture that shows the UNIQUEs in Mixpanel for my account. (already logged in WP). A Tracks stack trace that shows what's happening: stdClass Object ( [events] => Array ( [0] => Array ( [_ui] => 7ea374d2fc1a48578865941018b62a3c [_en] => wpandroid_notifications_accessed [_ut] => anon [_ts] => 1442852632039 )
[1] => Array ( [_en] => _aliasUser [anonId] => 7ea374d2fc1a48578865941018b62a3c [_ul] => daniloercoli [_ts] => 1442852632383 )
[2] => Array ( [_en] => wpandroid_application_opened [_ul] => daniloercoli [_ts] => 1442852632489 )
[3] => Array ( [_en] => wpandroid_notifications_accessed [_ul] => daniloercoli [_ts] => 1442852632773 )
[4] => Array ( [last_visible_screen] => Notifications [_en] => wpandroid_application_closed [time_in_app] => 3 [_ul] => daniloercoli [_ts] => 1442852635782 )
)

report.summary: Jetpack + Stats : The login form is not shown under some circumstances
report.label: bug
report.description: Under some circumstances the login form is not triggered by the Stats Service. Basically the service can't check if the blog is a Jetpack or not by using the remoteBlogID. This is due to the fact that there are 2 entries in the DB for each Jetpack blog linked with the main wpcom account. The Stats service were loading the localBlogID by using the remoteID, and can happen, if you first logged to wpcom and then added the Jetpack blog, that the localblogID returned was the wrong one. That's due to the fact we're synching (and hiding) all blogs (wpcom + jetpack) when first logging to wpcom.

report.summary: Reader: Long tag name can overlap buttons
report.label: bug
report.description: Noticed this post in the Reader had a very long tag, and it overlaps the like/comment buttons:

report.summary: Logging out from wpcom doesn't refresh the Sites screen properly
report.label: bug
report.description: My wpcom account has some .org Jetpack blogs linked with it. When I disconnect from wpcom the sites screen doesn't get refreshed. The previously selected .com blog is already there. Even after logout. See the gif below:

report.summary: Login to wpcom doesn't refresh the main tabbed interface
report.label: bug
report.description: I did a couple of logins/logouts and found out that resetFragments doesn't actually recreate new fragments when called. I set a breakpoint in WPMainTabAdapter.getItem and it doesn't get called upon login. Sorry for the long GIF. At the end of the login process you can see that the Sites tab is still empty. Other tabs get populated with a delay (that's because i'm throttling the connection) instead the Sites tab isn't get updated. /cc @nbradbury

report.summary: Notification stacking issue on 4.5.1
report.label: bug
report.description: Sometimes (?) notifications staking doesn't work, and user gets a growing list of notifications. I can't repro, but @daniloercoli was affected by the bug too. From a Play Store comment: Notifications issue. With the latest update the notifications are not aggregated anymore. In a few minutes I had my status bar filled with a ton of notifications; annoying. I wonder if that could come from this patch f8d5108

report.summary: Tapping back while logging into wpcom doesn't stop the underlying connections...
report.label: bug
report.description: ...and left the app in a weird state. Steps to repro: Suppose you're already logged to wpcom in the app. Open the app and go to me ME tab. Tap on "Disconnect", confirm, and wait few secs. Tap on "Connect to WordPress.com", insert the username, the password and tap on "Sign In". Tap back while there is still the loading indicator going. The app takes you back to the ME screen. Wait few secs. Tap on "Connect"...and BOOM! You're already logged to wpcom.

report.summary: Notifications: Allow settings access for wp.com user
report.label: bug
report.description: Notications settings are hidden if there is no push device id. Instead it should just check for a wp.com account, and if there is no device id we can hide the 'app notifications' setting.

report.summary: Reader: Header needs margin on landscape tablet
report.label: bug
report.description: Noticed that the reader header doesn't apply the correct margin when in landscape on a tablet:

report.summary: Comments: Detail view comes back on rotation
report.label: bug
report.description: Nexus 4, OS 5.1.1 To reproduce: Go to the first tab and select Comments. Tap any comment in the list to view its detail. From the detail, tap the back button to return to the list. Rotate your device. You are now back on the detail screen. Tap the back button to return to the list. Rotate your device. Go to step 5.

report.summary: Comments: Broken images visible in comments list.
report.label: bug
report.description: Nexus 4, OS 5.1.1 Title has it. The comment list in the screenshot contains three comments each with an image in the comment content. Notice the broken image glyph in each of the rows.

report.summary: Comments: Images do not show when loaded.
report.label: bug
report.description: Nexus 7, OS 5.1.1 (Saw this on the Nexus 4 also) To reproduce: (there may be other paths) Tap a comment notification for a comment that you have replied to, and your reply includes images. In the notification detail, scroll down and tap the "You replied to this comment." message. You're reply will show up in the list of comments that appears. Wait a bit. Notice the images do not load. Scroll away from the images and back. The images will now appear.

report.summary: Crash: App crashes when rotating while signing out.
report.label: bug
report.description: Nexus 7, OS 5.1.1 To reproduce: Be logged into wpcom. Tap the button to disconnect wpcom. Rotate the device while the spinner is visible. Boom.

report.summary: Two tab clicks required to scroll to top if view gets re-created (eg rotation)
report.label: bug
report.description: Good catch @roundhill.

report.summary: Media uploads sometimes fail with NoHttpResponseException
report.label: bug
report.description: Started getting this bug when uploading posts with images (or individual images, e.g. through adding a gallery or using the new visual editor). The post/image upload will get stuck, and the upload will never complete. Posts with no images upload successfully. Log: Notes: Only happens on mobile devices (the bug doesn't occur when using emulators or when using a device proxied through Charles or Fiddler) - specifically, a Nexus 4, a Nexus 6 and a Nexus 9. Occurs 100% of the time on some days, and on other days it never happens Tested on develop and on the current beta Have only been able to test this on a single Wi-Fi network (in Germany) cc @daniloercoli

report.summary: FAB icon jumps under the snack bar when trashing 2 posts in a row
report.label: bug
report.description: Demo: https://cloudup.com/cx675nqeZtR

report.summary: Media Library: Image disappears from view shortly after upload - 4.6-rc-3
report.label: bug
report.description: When uploading a picture to the media library I see it show up in the view momentarily, and then it disappears. After leaving and going back in it shows up just fine. Here's a screencap recorded off of my emulator (on a self-compiled apk using the latest source from git) connected to a self-hosted site, although I saw the same problem on the latest beta on my OnePlus One connected to WordPress.com. https://cloudup.com/iyGvmEjotjP The difference is that the logfile on the emulator has an exception relating to the media library that isn't present on the real device. Although you'll see in the video that re-opening the Media Library was unresponsive for a moment, so the exception may be related to that. The full logfile can be found here: http://wp-srstancil.rhcloud.com/2015/10/09/wordpress-application-log/

report.summary: Adding a Video to a Post Show Wrong Icon
report.label: bug
report.description: If you add a video to a post, it shows an image icon. I believe it used to have a video icon. Maybe these days we can get a thumbnail preview of the video?

report.summary: Uploading Video Hangs Device
report.label: bug
report.description: On my Galaxy S6, uploading a video appeared to hang my entire device, it wasn't responsive until the video finished uploading... very bad experience.

report.summary: Permissions check needed when sharing media to the WordPress app
report.label: bug
report.description: We've got permissions working when a user attempts to add media from within the app, but when sharing from other apps (Photos, for example) it fails without asking for permission. Reproduce: Android 6.0, disable media permissions Open Photos (or other app with media to share) Share a photo (or multiple) with WordPress, add to Media Library option Failure toast, no prompt to enable permissions

report.summary: Sharing media to the Media Library can result in corrupted images on 32-bit devices
report.label: bug
report.description: Tested from 4.4.2, it's been around since at least then. Sharing images to the media library (from Photos for example) can lead to some of the images getting corrupted. See here.

report.summary: Reader auth fails when opening wpcom sites using the webview
report.label: bug
report.description: This is not working anymore, ReaderAuthActions.updateCookies was removed in #2360 Note: Sometimes it Works™ - that could be a side effect of an old cookie.

report.summary: Swipe To Refresh can be triggered when a view it already refreshing
report.label: bug
report.description: Demo video: https://cloudup.com/c9HlwF1OeX5 Happens on the Reader and Posts list. Probably on other STR screens too. I wonder if that comes from a change in our SwipeToRefreshHelper

report.summary: Missing Characters for Tajik Cyrilic language
report.label: bug
report.description: Note: missing characters appears in the Post List, but probably everywhere else Example of failing characters: Ҳ Ҷ as in ҲИҶРАТ – ОРЗУ ИСО I don't think it comes from the font. I tried this sentence in https://typecast.com/preview/google/Merriweather and everything was correctly displayed. I wonder if that comes from the font renderer. Ref #2460 (vietnamese characters bug)
