report.label: bug
report.description: Cursor created at line 102 does not get closed. libs/utils/WordPressUtils/src/main/java/org/wordpress/android/util/SqlUtils.java:112: error: RESOURCE_LEAK resource acquired to cursor by call to rawQuery(...) at line 102 is not released after line 112 (source | trace)

report.summary: Themes: Current Theme title briefly reads "Current Theme"
report.label: bug
report.description: In the view at the top of the list of themes showing the current theme, for a brief moment the theme title reads "Current Theme". This is quickly changed to the theme's title but a sharp eyed user will catch the change.

report.summary: Could not open notification error
report.label: bug
report.description: Users are reporting that they can’t access notifications. Push Notifications are working fine, but when you try to open the notification in the list all you get is a “Could not open notification” error.

report.summary: Crash report 4.6 - NPE ReaderPostListFragment
report.label: bug
report.description: Fatal Exception: java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to invoke virtual method 'void android.app.Activity.runOnUiThread(java.lang.Runnable)' on a null object reference at org.wordpress.android.ui.reader.ReaderPostListFragment$8.run(ReaderPostListFragment.java:830)

report.summary: Themes: Persistent black spinner in theme search
report.label: bug
report.description: If I pull down to refresh while doing a theme search, I end up with a black spinner that only goes away if I either rotate my device or exit the search completely. To reproduce: Select a site and tap on Themes Tap the search icon Pull down to refresh (a black spinner appears) Type in the search box (the black spinner stays) Tap on a theme to view details, and then dismiss the popup (the black spinner is still there) Seen on a Nexus 7 (first gen) and 9, WPAndroid 4.7-rc-3

report.summary: Widget: Some stats widget content is hidden when a site has a long title
report.label: bug
report.description: When a site has a long title, it goes onto a second line in the stats widget. This pushes down the rest of the widget content, cutting off the stats or even hiding them completely. Here is a screenshot from my Nexus 9, Android 6.0, landscape mode:

report.summary: Comments not showing until app reset
report.label: bug
report.description: Device: Nexus 6P Running the beta, I clicked comments on a post with ~25 comments. All were made within the last 20 minutes. It kept saying that there were no comments though. After closing it from the open apps dialog, and then reopening it, the comments loaded. Sorry I don't have any more info - I realise this may be a bit hard to debug/replicate, but thought I should mention it.

report.summary: "Huge" font size cuts off text
report.label: bug
report.description: When text is set to "Huge" in settings, there is a possibility that the text can get cut off (see Blog Posts and Pages):

report.summary: Reader shows incorrect featured image
report.label: bug
report.description: Reported by @roundhill, sometimes the featured image in the post list is incorrect (it shows the image from another post). This may be happening only with posts that have embeds/videos as featured images (ie: featured videos).

report.summary: Site Settings design issues
report.label: bug
report.description: General The "More" link that opens the detailed Discussion settings is black and in Roboto; it should match the other items in the list. In the following dialogs, there is a border above the button row that isn't needed, as the dialog doesn't scroll: Privacy, Default category, Close after, Sort by, Threading, Paging, Automatically approve. https://cloudup.com/cJZYXXAJCB0 Language In the language dialog, there is an extra translucent border (or shadow?) on top of the one that should be there. Tagline The "Tagline" header is set in Roboto, #212121; it should be Open Sans Semibold, grey_dark. The text field is set in Roboto, #212121; it should be Open Sans Regular, grey_dark. The buttons are set in Roboto, orange_jazzy; they should be using Open Sans Semibold, blue_medium (other dialog buttons elsewhere are correct). If I hit "Cancel" sometimes the dialog goes away, but the keyboard doesn't: Links in comments There are a few issues on this screen, so I've made an annotated copy of the original mockup for comparison. Note that the latest Material Design guidelines don't use borders around the selected item in a picker: https://www.google.com/design/spec/components/pickers.html#pickers-date-pickers ## Related Posts There are a few fonts and colors that are wrong in this section; here's an annotated comparison: ## Hold for moderation "No items" has no padding; it should have the same amount of padding as an item in the list. When adding an item to the hold for moderation/blacklist, the dialog has a few issues, noted here: There are also a few issues in the multi-selection mode:

report.summary: Media Library: Sharing multiple images to media library doesn't upload all images
report.label: bug
report.description: Might be related to #3332. I've noticed that if I select many images (say 5-10) in the Photos app and then share to the WP media library, it will only upload one or two of the images. And usually the second image is corrupted like in #3332. Overall, Media seems really buggy and needs a good rework.

report.summary: When searching themes, rotating the device loses the search
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce: Open the theme picker Search for a theme Rotate your device Result: The top bar is still white (like the search bar) but it is empty and the theme picker now displays all of the theme instead of the search results After searching (searched for "twenty" and results are displaying): After rotating the device (top bar is blank and results are gone): Device: Nexus 9 OS: 6.0 App: 4.8-rc-1

report.summary: Media browser new instance when sharing photos
report.label: bug
report.description: If the media browser is already showing, sharing to WPAndroid from the Photos app adds a new instance of the media browser instead of re-using the existing one.

report.summary: Media browser blank images
report.label: bug
report.description: Quite often while using the media browser, images that I know have already been downloaded (cached) show up blank. This happens in multiple situations, but I can repro it consistently by opening the media browser, tapping an image to view the detail, then returning to the media browser. Demo video

report.summary: Inaccurate error message when user doesn't have permissions to upload media to a site
report.label: bug
report.description: Media Browser. When you don't have permissions to upload media to a site, you only get a "Media upload error" Toast. We should show a specific message (XMLRPC message is: You do not have permission to upload files. [Code: 401]) and hide the "retry" button.

report.summary: 405 error on post upload
report.label: bug
report.description: 46.139.84.148 - - [30/Nov/2015:10:55:50 +0000] "GET /xmlrpc.php HTTP/1.0" 405 42 "-" "wp-android/4.8-rc-1 (Android 5.1.1; en_US; Sony D5803/D5803)" Steps to reproduce: Open the app, write a post. It can include images, but doesn’t have to. I can reproduce the issue whether I include images or not. Click “Save” or “Publish” to push your changes to the site. Reported by @jeherve Could be the host

report.label: bug
report.description: Fatal Exception: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: length=12; index=-1 at java.util.ArrayList.get(ArrayList.java:310) at org.wordpress.android.ui.reader.services.ReaderPostService$10.run(ReaderPostService.java:307)

report.summary: Truncated text in Notification screen
report.label: bug
report.description: On specific combination of screen size / language, filter buttons text can be truncated like here (Galaxy S2, Czech): I don't think there is a simple fix here that won't need a full redesign of this radio buttons. We could at least use android:ellipsize="none" or android:ellipsize="marquee" so the ellipsis character … won't use half of the screen.

report.summary: Analytics - READER_ACCESSED event is fired too often
report.label: bug
report.description: I'm not 100% sure if this is an error, but we may want to revise the way READER_ACCESSED is tracked in the app. In details, the READER_ACCESSED event is tracked every time the Reader Posts List activity is shown on the screen. So if you go from the Article Details Screen back to the Reader Posts List screen READER_ACCESSED is fired. It's then fired twice when a user opens the reader and just read one article. Steps to reproduce the issue: Open the Reader (READER_ACCESSED fired) Tap on a Article (reader_article_opened fired) Go back to the posts list (READER_ACCESSED fired) @astralbodies - IIRC there were discrepancies on Reader Usage on the two platforms? /cc @nbradbury

report.summary: Trashing Post From App Permenantly Deletes It
report.label: bug
report.description: Tested in both current production version and current beta version. When you trash a post from the app it is permanently deleted. It would make more sense if it were sent to the Trash instead so that you have the ability to restore before it is gone for good.

report.summary: Truncated text (numbers) in Stats widget on xperia Z5 Compact
report.label: bug

report.summary: Snackbar onDismissed fires multiple times
report.label: bug
report.description: In places such as this we're assuming onDismissed is called once, but in fact it fires multiple times due to this bug in the design library. This causes multiple calls to the endpoints for trashing a post, comment, or notification.

report.summary: Gravatar disappearing after scroll in Comments
report.label: bug
report.description: Note this is the same user, some gravatars are shown while others default to mystery man, before scroll everything looks OK: https://cloudup.com/c7IB6B3260w

report.summary: Private Blog images sometimes aren't loaded in the post preview
report.label: bug
report.description: Sometimes images from private sites aren't being loaded in the post list preview's WebView (only for locally changed posts).

report.summary: Custom headers are sometimes ignored by the post list preview (and other WebViews)
report.label: bug
report.description: The post list preview is sometimes unable to load images from private sites because the WebView doesn't call its WebViewClient.shouldInterceptRequest() method, which adds the necessary Authorization header (as well as the custom UserAgent). This can happen with non-private sites as well, but in that case only the custom UserAgent is missing. This also affects the new editor's WebView and possibly other WebViews in the app. Happens much more frequently on emulators than real devices, and somewhat more frequently on older devices than new ones. Possibly caused by the WebView processing the request before its WebViewClient has been initialized properly.

report.summary: Use the search to select a hidden site result in app weirdness
report.label: bug
report.description: Open the site picker Select site XYZ Select a hidden site with the search feature on the site picker Tap back Tap the New Post button Notice the ActionBar title is XYZ and not the one previously picked This could produce other errorr. We should probably make selected sites via search visible is they're hidden.

report.summary: WordPress 4.4 post date is incorrect
report.label: bug
report.description: There is a bug in WordPress 4.4 that changed the post_date from local time to gmt time. https://core.trac.wordpress.org/ticket/35053 This results in the post not posting at the correct time. The fix will be in 4.4.1, but 4.4 will always have this issue. We'll need a special case for self-hosted sites on 4.4

report.summary: Site settings default Post Format not saved on the server
report.label: bug
report.description: Looks like the post format is never saved if other settings aren't changed. https://cloudup.com/cDSs9vHodO7 Should we post the changes only when the SettingsFragment is killed?

report.summary: Site Settings: Updating site title isn't reflected in the rest of the app without reselecting the site
report.label: bug
report.description: If you update your site's title and then return to the main menu, you'll still see the old title at the top of the page until you either tap Switch Site and re-select it, or close and re-launch the app. Screencast: https://cloudup.com/c-6J8y6dzmM

report.summary: My Profile: Rotating device loses unsaved changes
report.label: bug
report.description: While editing the fields in the My Profile section in /me, I rotated my device. This closed the window where I was making the changes without saving anything, so my changes were lost. That wouldn't be so terrible for the first/last name or display name, but I had added a big chunk of text to the "About Me" section and it was frustrating to lose it and have to start over. Ideally, I should be able to rotate the device and have the field I was editing stay open so I can continue editing it until I save or cancel the changes. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, beta 5.0-rc-1

report.summary: Theme - Last searched keyword is lost if you open the details of a theme
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to repro: Go to Themes. Tap the search icon and write the search word "dd". There should only be 1 theme in the result page. "Edda" Tap on "Edda" and then tap back when in the details page. The app takes you back to the search page, the search input field is blank, and it starts a new empty search, making all the themes showing in the page after a while. A fix for this issue should be in #3571 See https://github.com/wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Android/pull/3571/files#diff-657f5b9cb48627e41f20d73414d51c63R27

report.summary: Broken test: BlogTest::testGetSetPrivate()
report.label: bug
report.description: The BlogTest::testGetSetPrivate() test is broken as it doesn't take into account the condition of whether the blog is a WPCom one or not (only WPCom blogs can be marked private).

report.summary: Site Settings: Keyboard disappears immediately after opening Site Title or Tagline settings
report.label: bug
report.description: When I tap to open the Site Title or Tagline settings, the keyboard appears briefly and then immediately closes. I still see the cursor at the end of the text field, but I have to tap again on the text field to re-open the keyboard to make changes. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, app beta v. 5.0-rc-1

report.summary: Site Settings: Selecting new blog language changes the names of the languages in the Language list
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce: Select a site and open the Settings Select Language (to choose the blog language) Note that the list of languages displays the name of each language in that language and below displays the name of each language in your language (e.g. English/English, Deutsch/German, Español/Spanish). Select a new language from the list. Result: The second name of each language changes to the name of that language in the language you just selected (so if you select Español/Spanish, the list becomes e.g. English/Inglés, Deutsch/Alemán, Español/Español). The blog language shouldn't affect the UI language, so the list of languages should always respect the device/app UI language and not the selected blog language. Screenshot with English selected as the blog language: Screenshot with Greek selected as the blog language: Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, app beta v. 5.0-rc-1.

report.summary: Themes - Menus - Difficult to Scroll to Add Items
report.label: bug
report.description: When clicking on Themes in the Android app, and then Menus, it’s almost impossible to scroll down to “Add Item” in Menu if there are existing items as it thinks you are just trying to reorder the existing items... We were able to get around this by scrolling on the tiny margin on the side, but it's quite hard! :)

report.summary: Site Settings: Leaving the app after opening the detailed discussion settings crashes the app
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce: Select a site and open Settings Under "Discussion" select "More" Leave the app (e.g. return to the device home screen) Return to the app Result: The message "Unfortunately, WordPress has stopped." appears, and you are returned to your site's My Sites screen. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, app beta v. 5.0-rc-1.

report.summary: Site Settings: Changing discussion threading to "none" causes settings to get out of sync in browser
report.label: bug
report.description: Under Settings > Discussion: More > Threading, setting the threading to "None" correctly disables comment threading on the site but doesn't uncheck the "Enable threaded (nested) comments" setting in the site's settings in a browser. As a result, the browser settings are out of sync and don't correctly control the site's comment threading. Steps to reproduce: In the app, select a site and go to Settings Under Discussion, select More and then Threading In the Threading window, select "None" and then "OK" Check the front of the site and confirm that threading is off. (I used a post with a comment and a threaded reply, and the two comments were not threaded after making this change. Check the site's discussion settings at https://wordpress.com/settings/discussion Result: The browser settings have "Enable threaded (nested) comments up to 2 levels deep" checked. (Note that if you choose a different level of threading in the app settings, the browser settings change accordingly. The only issue is when "None" is selected.) This doesn't only cause a syncing problem. After this, it's no longer possible to enable comment threading in the browser settings by simply unchecking/re-checking the "Enable threaded (nested) comments" setting. (This makes no change on the front of the site.) The only solution is to change the level of threading in the browser settings or re-enable threading from the app settings. Testing on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, app beta v. 5.0-rc-1.

report.summary: Site Settings: Confusing display in discussion settings when "Paging" is toggled off
report.label: bug
report.description: In the discussion settings, the "Paging" setting always display the select number ("# comments per page") even if those settings are toggled off. Steps to reproduce: Select a site and go to Settings Under Discussion, select More Tap on "Paging" and toggle it on, selecting a number of days, and tap "OK." Confirm that under "Paging" it shows the number of days you selected. Tap on "Paging" again and toggle it off, and tap "OK." Under "Paging" it still shows the number of days selected, instead of noting that Paging is disabled. The "Close after" setting is also sometimes affected by this issue. Right after toggling "Close after" off, it will say "Never" under that setting in the discussion settings. However, if you exit the app and come back, it will go back to saying "# days" instead of "Never" (although the setting is still disabled). Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, app beta v. 5.0-rc-1.

report.summary: Site Settings: Some fields allow multi-line entries when they should be single-line fields
report.label: bug
report.description: In the site settings, some fields should only allow single-line entries, but currently the on-screen keyboard allows you to start a new line for a multi-line entry: Site Title (General settings) Tagline (General settings) Hold for Moderation (Discussion settings: Comments) Blacklist (Discussion settings: Comments) This doesn't break anything, but it's confusing that the UI allows multi-line entries in these cases. For site titles and taglines, the multiple lines are collapsed into a single line after saving. Before saving: After saving and reopening the site title setting: For the comment moderation and blacklist, the multiple lines are divided into separate entries once the screen is refreshed (and so they work correctly), but they are shown in a single entry at first which is confusing and hard to modify. Entering multiple lines: After saving the multi-line entry: After refreshing the screen: Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, app beta v. 5.0-rc-1.

report.summary: Sign In: Leaving the self-hosted login screen, it reverts back to WordPress.com login
report.label: bug
report.description: When first opening the app, if you go to the self-hosted login screen, leave the screen (either within the app or by exiting and reopening the app), and the return to the login screen, it will revert back to the WordPress.com login screen. Steps to reproduce: Open the app while logged out Select "Add self-hosted site" Optional: begin to enter your account information Tap on the Help icon (?) in the top right, or exit the app on your device Go back to the login screen Result: You see the WordPress.com login screen instead of the self-hosted login screen you were just on I encountered this in a very normal login flow, where I entered my username and site URL but had to leave the app to get my password. When I reopened the app, I saw the wrong login screen. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, app beta v. 5.0-rc-1.

report.summary: "Blog Posts" row in MySite fragment is not blinking when post is saved as draft
report.label: bug
report.description: According to code, when post, created through MySite fragment's FAB, is saved as draft, the "Blog Posts" row should blink twice. Looks like it's not working because of the bug in RelativeLayout. From official documentation: Note: In platform version 17 and lower, RelativeLayout was affected by a measurement bug that could cause child views to be measured with incorrect MeasureSpec values. (See MeasureSpec.makeMeasureSpec for more details.) This was triggered when a RelativeLayout container was placed in a scrolling container, such as a ScrollView or HorizontalScrollView. If a custom view not equipped to properly measure with the MeasureSpec mode UNSPECIFIED was placed in a RelativeLayout, this would silently work anyway as RelativeLayout would pass a very large AT_MOST MeasureSpec instead.

report.summary: View Admin: In-app browser refreshes view after rotating device
report.label: bug
report.description: When you use the in-app browser to view a site's wp admin dashboard, any time you rotate the device it refreshes and goes back to the main dashboard screen at /wp-admin. This loses your place and loses any unsaved work. Steps to reproduce: Select a site in the app and select "View Admin" In the wp admin dashboard, navigate to another part of the dashboard (e.g. Settings > General) Rotate your device Result: You are returned to the main dashboard screen (instead of staying in the part of the dashboard you had navigated to). Reported in an app review; tested and reproduced on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, app beta v. 5.0-rc-2

report.summary: Site Settings: "Learn More" popup not dismissible from left side
report.label: bug
report.description: When trying to dismiss the popup by touching the area surrounding it, it's possible to do it from the right side, but not from the left side. A screenshot to illustrate: This happens on the Nexus 6

report.summary: Site Settings: Automatically approve setting from known users does not work as expected
report.label: bug
report.description: When I select the 'Known users' comments' at the 'Automatically approve' section like this: It saves the following two settings as on in wp-admin: Comment must be manually approved Comment author must have a previously approved comment I expected only the 'Comment author must have a previously approved comment' checkbox to be checked, though, like this:

report.summary: Site Settings: should not allow user to make changes when offline
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce: Go to site settings while online Turn off internet connectivity See that you can change the site title and it gets saved in the UI, even though there's a toast indicating that the change was not saved: I expected not to be able to click on any of the settings while offline (and for the settings to be greyed out), and for the orange no connection indicator to be shown. If I do click on a setting that's usually enabled, I expect a toast indicating why I'm not able to use it (i.e. no internet connectivity).

report.summary: Site settings: Blacklist/Moderation: should not be able to add newline character in item
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce: Go to Site Settings > Discussion > More > Blacklist or Hold for Moderation Click orange Plus button See that you can enter a new line and it gets saved: Note that the newline character does not get saved in the backend, so it's a UI issue only.

report.summary: Site Settings: Close comments and paging modals should not have duplicate text
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce: Go to Site Settings > Discussion > More > Paging or Site Settings > Discussion > More > Close after See that the modal has duplicate text:

report.summary: Site settings: when changing settings in wp-admin, it should be possible to see changes on app
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps: Open WordPress app (already logged as a user with a site) Go to wp-admin > Settings > General for your site Change the site title and save Go to the Site Settings page for the site on the app, and see that the old site title is displayed instead Try to refresh the page by pulling down, and see that it's not possible You can get the app to display the new title by swiping the WordPress app from the recent apps list and opening it again. Note that this behaviour doesn't happen in MyProfile: when making changes directly on the web, it's possible to see them in the app almost immediately by going to a different page and then returning to My Profile.

report.summary: Comments list not retaining state on orientation change
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps: Open Comments activity from MySites tab. Long press on any comment. Contextual action bar (CAB) appears at top of the screen. Rotate device. Selected comments and CAB are gone. Issue with dialogs on this screen: When CAB is visible try to delete/approve/unapprove some comments, and while progress dialog is displayed, rotate your device - progress dialog will stick, and won't be dismissed, the only way out of this is to kill an app. When "Trash comments" confirmation dialog is visible rotate devices - the dialog will disappear (along with selected comments). I discovered those issues while working on CommentActivity as part of #3551 . Fix is included in upcoming PR (will be submitted after #3663 is merged).

report.summary: Me: HTML entities are not decoded in author name
report.label: bug
report.description: If an author name contains, for example, an ampersand, it is not decoded when displayed: We recently ran into this on Calypso too: Automattic/wp-calypso#2901

report.summary: After granting permissions for media upload, taken back to editor
report.label: bug
report.description: When attempting to upload an image, I was prompted with the new dialog to grant permissions to view media on the device / upload (2 separate permissions). After granting permission to both of them, rather than allowing me to upload an image (expected), it took me back to the editor and I had to start the process again. Would be great if the flow wasn't interrupted after granting permission.

report.summary: Reader Post List: relative time spans are not localized
report.label: bug
report.description: In the Post list and Pages list, dates on the posts/pages are not localized. For example, these screenshots show the dates in English when the app's language is set to German: Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, app beta v. 5.0-rc-2.

report.summary: Reader icon isn't highlighted after tapping the "View Reader" button from notifications
report.label: bug
report.description: When a notifications section is empty, it includes an explanation and a "View Reader" button to open the Reader tab. However, the notifications icon stays highlighted at the top of the app even after it sends you to the Reader. Empty notifications screen: Reader icon is underlined, but notifications icon is still highlighted (white) while Reader icon is greyed out: Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, app beta v. 5.0-rc-2.

report.summary: Stats returns an error when the app language is non-English and the device is rotated
report.label: bug
report.description: When the app language (set in Account Settings) is set to a language other than English, rotating the device while viewing stats returns the error "Stats couldn't be loaded for the required blog." (I couldn't reproduce this issue with the app language set to English.) Stats error from the logs: 02-01 17:48:28.521 5608 5608 E WordPress-STATS: The blog with local_blog_id -1 cannot be loaded from the DB. Screenshot before rotating: After rotating: Tested and confirmed in Spanish, German, and Arabic on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, app beta v. 5.0-rc-2.

report.summary: Snackbars with long text button are pretty ugly
report.label: bug
report.description: There is no way to control the length of translated text, so button text could be much longer than what's expected, here is the Snackbar displayed in French:

report.summary: Site Settings - Learn More stuck loading if app is backgrounded when loading completes
report.label: bug
report.description: Repro: Click Learn More -> Loading view shows Background the app Foreground the app -> Loading view never disappears

report.summary: Theme browser won't load new themes when end of the list is reached.
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps: Open Themes from MySite. Scroll down to the end of the list (might take a while). While additional themes are loading and progress indicator is visible, rotate your device. You are near the end of the list, progress indicator is jittering and the additional themes won't load. And here is the bad part, after doing all abovementioned: Go back to MySite. Again, open Themes. Scroll down to the end of the list. Additional themes won't load. (In same orientation!). Only thing that helps is app reinstall (maybe logout/login will help too). Tested on Nexus 5 and Nexus 7 (2013).

report.summary: Reader post detail blank webview on activity pause/resume
report.label: bug
report.description: Spotted on the Play Store: The Wordpress Reader doesn't work. If you lock your phone, when you unlock it the page is blank. I can reproduce: Open a Reader post detail. Lock your phone (or switch app / activity). Unlock. Webview is blank.

report.summary: Virtual keyboard is not dismissed in site settings
report.label: bug
report.description: PR #3719 introduced a new issue, where the virtual keyboard stays on if the popup dialog is dismissed by tapping outside of it while editing. Tapping Cancel or OK on the dialog does dismiss the keyboard but not if tapped outside of it. /cc @tonyr59h

report.summary: Activity state is not retained when using manually set locale.
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps: Go to Account setting. Set language to something other than devices. Go to any activity (Comments list, for example) or just open a Reader tab. Scroll down. Rotate devices. Scroll position (and any other state activity had) is not retained.

report.summary: Locale changes don't update ActionBar titles until there is a configuration change
report.label: bug
report.description: Good find @khaykov! Sounds like we're going to have to convert the remainder of our ActionBar usages to Toolbar in order to work around a caching issue. See #3740 for more details.

report.summary: Sorted language display strings doesn't respect Locale
report.label: bug
report.description: If you change your device's language to a different locale and go into Site Settings and change your language, the list is not sorted to your locale. So the non-english characters are not sorted correctly (in some cases).

report.summary: App language change to default is not tracked
report.label: bug
report.description: If the user changes the language to non-default and then changes it back to the default language, we don't keep track of it. /cc @daniloercoli

report.summary: Reader tag is not accurate on initial log in
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When logging in and going to the Reader for the first time, the feed should be the one that it shows on the tag dropdown. Actual behavior The tag shows "Automattic" but is actually "Discover" Steps to reproduce the behavior Log in Click on Reader tab Check feed contents and compare to tag Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 6.0.1

report.summary: Preference screens Action Bar font is incorrect
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior All Action Bar titles should have the same font. Actual behavior I noticed while testing #3854 that Activities using R.layout.preferences_actionbar end up with lighter fonts. This layout is being used in the following Activities: BlogPreferencesActivity AccountSettingsActivity AppSettingsActivity Steps to reproduce the behavior I'm only able to reproduce this on an emulator with API 16/17, my Nexus 5X and Genymotion API 22 display it correctly. Visit any of the above Activities and check the Action Bar title font. Tested on Nexus 5X/Genymotion/Genymotion, Android 6.0.1 (API 23)/4.1.1 (API 16)/4.2.2 (API 17)

report.summary: Notifications: Font margins need adjusting
report.label: bug
report.description: The switch back to Roboto has caused some small alignment issues with notifications:

report.summary: Settings missing after login
report.label: bug
report.description: After you login to the app, the Settings link is missing from the My Site page until you restart. See the screenshot below - there should be a "Configuration" section above the "Admin" section which includes Settings:

report.summary: Reader: Empty Likers in Detail View on Certain Posts
report.label: bug
report.description: In the Reader detail view, some posts don't show the likers. You can actually still tap on the area where they should display, and then it loads the likers detail view but it is empty: Other posts display the likers just fine... but here's one that I know for sure doesn't work: https://tekartist.org/2016/03/23/♫-dee-crell-form-2-all-i-am/ Tested on Samsung Galaxy S6, Android 6.0.1 on versions 5.2-rc2

report.summary: Reader missing followed posts
report.label: bug
report.description: From @rachelmcr: A user reported that the Reader in the Android app isn’t updating with new posts from all of the blogs they follow. They see new posts from some blogs (so it does update) but not all blogs. The Reader is working fine for them in a web browser, with all new posts appearing there. The user’s device is an Alcatel One Touch 6010D running Android 4.1.1 with WPAndroid 5.1.1 (in German). I am seeing the same behavior in my Reader on my Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-4 (in English). I am seeing updates from some of the blogs I follow (mostly from RSS feeds I follow, but also one VIP site on wp.com) but other new posts aren’t showing up at all. I do see those new posts in the web Reader and the iOS Reader. When I try refreshing the Android Reader manually, I see [READER] d: requested posts response = UNCHANGED in my application log. I was able to reproduce this with followed sites, but not consistently. Even when new posts are received, sometimes other new posts will be missing from the stream.

report.summary: Can't schedule a saved draft
report.label: bug
report.description: Originally reported in wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Editor-Android#269: It isn't possible to schedule a saved draft. Changing the date does not schedule the post, and changing the date and status publishes the post immediately. Expected behavior It should be possible to open a saved draft in the editor and schedule it to be published at a future date. Actual behavior When you try to schedule a saved draft, it is published immediately instead of being scheduled for the future date you select. Steps to reproduce the behavior Create a new post in the app Open the post settings, change the status to Draft, and tap Save Wait for the post to upload and confirm it is saved as a draft Open the draft in the editor Open the post settings, change the publish date to a future date/time, and tap Update Result: Draft is still saved with current date/time. It isn't scheduled and the future publish date/time is not saved. Open the draft in the editor Open the post settings, change the status to Publish and change the publish date to a future date/time, and tap Schedule Result: The post is published immediately instead of being scheduled for a future date/time Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1 Originally reported by a beta user, tested and reproduced on a Nexus 9, OS 6.0, beta v. 4.8-rc-1. I tested and confirmed this is still an issue using the steps above when publishing from the new visual editor on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, version alpha-4.

report.summary: Stats: broken view in Portrait mode on tablets
report.label: bug
report.description: Noticed this, when taking screenshots: Steps to reproduce the behavior Go to Stats in Portrait Tested on Nexus 10 (Genymotion), Android 5 - wpandroid 5.2 (works OK on phone and tablet 7")

report.summary: Stats: Insights - Latest Post Summary continues showing stats for deleted post
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When the latest post is deleted the Latest Post Summary stat in Insights should update and use the next most recent post. Actual behavior The Latest Post Summary continues to show the deleted post data, even if another post is made or a refresh performed. Logging out and Steps to reproduce the behavior Have at least two posts on your site Publish a new post and verify the Latest Post Summary stat shows the new post title Delete the new post and see that the Latest Post Summary stat shows the deleted post title Publish a new post and see that the Latest Post Summary stat shows the deleted post title Tested on Genymotion, Android API 22

report.summary: Stats: Incorrectly prompted that Jetpack was not installed.
report.label: bug
report.description: My self-hosted test blog has the latest version of the Jetpack (3.9.6) plugin installed, but it is not connected to WordPress.com. When tapping the Stats option in the blog details screen, I see the stats activity appear and try to sync. Eventually it stops syncing and I'm prompted with an error that reads: "Jetpack plugin not found, The Jetpack plugin is required for stats. Do you want to install Jetpack? No / Yes" If I tap yes I'm taken to the Add Plugins page and I see in the list of plugins that Jetpack is already installed.

report.summary: Stats: Possible to dismiss the Jetpack prompt, then interact with the dropdown.
report.label: bug
report.description: While signed into the app with just a self-hosted blog, Go to the blog details screen and tap Stats. When prompted that Jetpack needs to be installed, tap the "Back" soft key, or on the screen to dismiss the prompt. My expectation was this would dismiss the stats view as if I was tapping the prompt's No button, however it just dismisses the prompt. I now have the Activity in a state where I can use the picker to switch between Insights, Days, Weeks, etc. There's no data of course. Since the user was just prompted they shouldn't expect the feature to be functional but this behavior seems pretty weird. Perhaps the dropdown should be disabled at least?

report.summary: Post List: Stats appears broken for self-hosted / non-Jetpack blogs
report.label: bug
report.description: To reproduce: Sign into the app with a self-hosted blog sans Jetpack. Go to the blog list. Notice that there is a Stats button shown in the post cards even though the blog is not connected to JP. Tap the Stats button in one of the post cards. The stats screen loads with an error that "stats couldn't be refreshed at this time" I'd suggest not showing the stats button for published posts on self-hosted/non-Jetpack sites.

report.summary: Media: Unable to use photos from library when camera permission has been denied.
report.label: bug
report.description: To reproduce: From a fresh install open the editor and tap to add media to a post. When prompted to allow access to the camera, tap deny. When prompted to allow access to the library, allow. My expectation is WordPress won't have access to my camera but will still be able to pull media from the phone's gallery, or the blog's media library. Instead I see an error message saying that permission is needed.

report.summary: Comments: Images in a comment in the comment list show up as a small "OBJ" inside a dotted border.
report.label: bug
report.description: I have a few comments that include images. In the comments list the images are replaced with a small dotted square, with "OBJ" inside. It looks a bit odd. Maybe we should filter out image tags from the comment in the list? (Nexus 5x)

report.summary: Site Picker: Add site launches with previous sites info filled in.
report.label: bug
report.description: From a fresh install, sign in with a self hosted blog: On the blog details screen tap "Switch Site" On the Choose site screen, tap the + button to add a new site. Notice the Sign in screen launches with the username and URL are already filled out with the previous site's info.

report.summary: Notification Settings: changing orientation returns you to the main settings screen.
report.label: bug
report.description: To reproduce: Sign in with a wpcom site. On the profile tab, select "Notification Settings" In Notification Settings, tap one of your blogs to edit its settings. On the "Notification Types" screen, Optionally, tap an option to display the edit modal. Rotate your phone to a different orientation. You are now back on the Notification Settings screen. My expectation was to still be on the Notification Types screen and for the edit modal to be visible if I had opened it. (Nexus 5x)

report.summary: Themes: Prompt after choosing theme has misformatted text.
report.label: bug
report.description: Need a space after the name of the theme in the prompt text:

report.summary: Themes: Newly activated theme is not immedately reflected in the list when searching
report.label: bug
report.description: To reproduce: Be signed into a wpcom account. Choose the Themes feature on the blog details screen. In the themes list, tap into the search field and search for "Twenty" to get a list of all the default Twenty... themes. Find the action bar at the bottom of a theme card and tap on the menu icon to open the menu. Choose "Activate". Notice that the action bar has not updated to indicate the theme is active. Rotate your device (Nexus 5x). Notice that the action bar has now updated. Interestingly the bar updates immediately when changed from the normal themes list (not in search mode).

report.summary: Site Picker: Jetpack site missing from the site picker.
report.label: bug
report.description: This might be a bit of an edge case, but check this out: I have a ghost Jetpack site named "aerychtest-appfog". The site no longer exists and I've never bothered clearing it from Jetpack because testing broken things is fun. ;) This site is still returned from the /me/sites REST API endpoint, is visible in the iOS app's list of blgos, and its visible in the Android app if I look under Notification Settings. However, its absent from the site picker. Is the site picker intentionally filtering out sites if Jetpack reports them as broken? If so I'd expect it to be also absent from Notification Settings. Regardless, my expectation was to still see the site in the list. Notification Settings (Present) Site Picker (Absent)

report.summary: Reader: Comment count is not updated after replying
report.label: bug
report.description: To reproduce: Go to the reader and tap to view comments on a post. Note the current number of comments on the post, shown both in the post card and in the comment list header. Use the "Reply" form at the bottom of the screen to add a new comment. Notice that the comment count has not updated in the comment list header. Tap back to return to the post list. Notice that the post card shows the old comment count. Pull to refresh the post list. Now the comment count is updated. My expectation is we'd optimistically increment and refresh the comment count without needing to sync.

report.summary: Reader has problems with emoji
report.label: bug
report.description: Rather than describe it, here are screen shots of the list view and detail view. List view: Detail view:

report.summary: Account Settings: Primary site selection persists when you select a different site
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior I expect to open the "Primary site" setting, select a new primary site, and have the old primary site selection cleared. Actual behavior I open the "Primary site" setting, select a new primary site, and two sites (the old primary site and the new one) are now selected in the list. (However, selecting OK makes the correct change.) Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the app and go to the Me tab Select Account Settings Select Primary site Note that your current primary site is selected, and select a different site. Result: Both sites are now selected in the list of sites. If you tap on your current primary site first, and then select a different site, the radio buttons work as expected. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-6

report.description: To reproduce: Sign in to a self-hosted wpcom account. Sign in to wpcom. Switch to the reader tab. In the tag picker, select a tag you are following that is not one of the default/recommended tags shown to a signed out user. Switch to the profile tab and sign out of wpcom. Switch back to the reader. Notice the tag picker has vanished.

report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior Local draft deleted Actual behavior Toast is shown "No network connection"

report.summary: Reader: Empty list after previewing tag.
report.label: bug
report.description: This is a bit of an edge case I think. Here are the steps I took: Choose the business-technology tag. Find a post titled "The fallacy of overnight success" https://wordpress.com/read/blogs/72626863/posts/30269 The tag displayed on the post card is the-fallacy-of-overnight-success Tap to preview the tag. The preview list appears but is empty. I guess we're excluding the previewed post in the Android app? Makes sense, but an empty list is a bit odd. Fwiw, on the web we show the post and iOS app we show the post.

report.label: bug
report.description: I noticed this trying to follow a particular site. To reproduce: Open the reader Open the reader's settings screen At the bottom of the screen try to follow either: http://arstechnica.com or arstechnica.com. I get an error saying unable to follow this blog I tried again with mashable.com and got the same error. Both can be followed from the web.

report.summary: Themes option not available under My Sites tab after signing in
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior The Themes option should be available when visiting the My Site tab after signing into an account with admin privileges. Actual behavior The Themes option is unavailable until the app is restarted. Steps to reproduce the behavior Sign out Sign in with an account that has admin privileges Go to the My Site tab The Themes option is not visible. Likely due to admin privileges not being verified before creating the My Site tab. See this PR for similar issue with the Settings option. Tested on Genymotion emulator, Android API 17

report.summary: View Admin option not available under My Sites tab when app is restarted
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior The View Admin option should be available when visiting the My Site tab when the app starts and the user account has admin privileges. Actual behavior The View Admin option is unavailable until the app is restarted. Steps to reproduce the behavior Sign in with an account that has admin privileges Go to the My Site tab Force stop the app (or swipe from backstack) Start the app The View Admin option is not visible. Tested on Genymotion emulator, Android API 17

report.summary: Reader: "Preview Post" (eye icon while you're editing a post) shows nothing the first time
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior “preview post” (eye icon) should show the preview for the post you're editing. Actual behavior it's showing nothing the first time, but works ok second time. Steps to reproduce the behavior write a post, enter a title and some content tap on the preview (eye) icon to see the preview the preview screen is blank Tested on Google Nexus 6 image on Genymotion, Android 5.1.0

report.summary: Pin lock screen should not open new keyboard
report.label: bug
report.description: When I open the app when the pin lock is enabled, I can open a new keyboard by clicking in the text box: Expected behavior I expected that the keyboard would not open when clicking the textbox, since the numberpad is already displayed: Tested on the Nexus 6, Android 6.0.1

report.summary: Pin lock screen should show every time app opens
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior The pin lock screen should show up every time I open the screen: Actual behavior Instead, the pin lock screen only shows up when the app is opened for the first time and is not in the recents screen. If it's already in the recents screen list, then the pin lock does not show up. Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the WordPress app If you don't already have a pin code, go to User > App > Turn PIN lock on, and enter a pin Close the app Open the app and notice that you are not asked for your pin code (problem # 1) Close the app and swipe the app away from the recents screen Open the WordPress app again, and see the pin lock Close the app Open it again and see that you are not asked for a pin code (problem # 2) Tested on Nexus 6, Android 6.0.01

report.summary: There should be an error message displayed when entering incorrect pin
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior On the 'When I enter the wrong pin multiple times, I should see an error telling me what's going wrong. Actual behavior When I enter the wrong pin, I don't see an error. Instead, the pin textbox is cleared out and nothing else changes. On the opening screen, the app also 'shakes' Steps to reproduce the behavior There are three places this can happen. Place 1: 'Change PIN' If you don't already have a pin code, go to User > App > Turn PIN lock on, and enter a pin. Go to User > App > App Settings and click on 'Change PIN' See a screen to enter your old pin. Enter an incorrect pin. See that the incorrect pin is not accepted, the pin textbox is cleared, but there is no error message displayed. Place 2: 'Turn PIN lock off' If you don't already have a pin code, go to User > App > Turn PIN lock on, and enter a pin. Go to User > App > App Settings and click on 'Turn PIN lock off' See a screen to enter your old pin. Enter an incorrect pin. See that the incorrect pin is not accepted, the pin textbox is cleared, but there is no error message displayed. Place 3: The initial screen If you don't already have a pin code, go to User > App > Turn PIN lock on, and enter a pin. Then close the app and swipe it off your recents screen. Open the WordPress app and see the 'Enter your PIN' screen Enter the wrong pin See the pin textbox is cleared, and the screen shakes. No error message is displayed. Enter the wrong pin again See the pin textbox is cleared, and the screen shakes. No error message is displayed. Tested on [device], Android [version]

report.summary: Scrolling through Themes Browser sometimes results in stuck loading
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior Scrolling through the Theme browser, the app should continue to load new themes as a user goes to the end of the list. Once the user reaches the end, there is no longer a loading indicator. Actual behavior Sometimes there is a loading indicator that never goes away and themes do not continue to load. Steps to reproduce the behavior Load up Theme Browser Scroll quickly (only happens intermittently) Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 6.0.1

report.summary: Fix App's background state on low memory conditions
report.label: bug
report.description: We're not correctly disabling the ConnectionChangeReceiver listeners, and bumping analytics, when the app goes background while the device is running in low memory conditions. Also the variable mIsInBackground is not set to true. Basically ApplicationLifecycleMonitor.onTrimMemory(final int level) is called with a level that's not the classic TRIM_MEMORY_UI_HIDDEN (level used when the process had been showing a user interface, and is no longer doing so), and then all of our code is not running. In my test case that was called with TRIM_MEMORY_COMPLETE, but we should check all other available constants. Note that onTrimMemory(final int level) could be called anytime if the device is running in low memory conditions. Don't think we can just redo the same thing we're already doing in TRIM_MEMORY_UI_HIDDEN. Tested on [device], Android [version] Nexus 5X, 6.X

report.summary: Smiley text shows broken image in Reader
report.label: bug
report.description: When I add a smiley to a post using the text :), the post shows a broken image in the Reader. Instead, I expected it to show a smiling emoji. Steps to reproduce the behavior Go to any blog that you can read on the reader, and publish a post that includes the text :) View the post in the reader and see a broken image instead of a smiley emoji: Tested on Nexus 6, Android 6.0.1

report.label: bug
report.description: No description provided.

report.summary: Gravatar: App crashes if device is rotated while new Gravatar is loading on me screen
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior After adding a new Gravatar, the user should be able to rotate the device between portrait and landscape. Actual behavior After adding a new Gravatar, if the new Gravatar image is still loading on the Me screen, the app crashes. This is especially noticeable if you were using the app in landscape prior to adding a new Gravatar. The Edit Photo screen forces a portrait view, so the next possible opportunity to rotate back to landscape (to continue using the app that way) is when the new Gravatar is loading on the Me screen. Steps to reproduce the behavior Tap on Gravatar on Me screen Select and edit photo On Edit Photo screen, select OK While new Gravatar is loading, rotate device from portrait to landscape Result: App crashes if the new Gravatar hasn't finished loading on the Me screen. Screenshot This is the point (while the new Gravatar is loading) where the app will crash if you rotate it: Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-8.

report.summary: MeFragment calls refreshAccountDetails() twice
report.label: bug

report.summary: LOGIN_FAILED_TO_GUESS_XMLRPC bump in v5.4.x
report.label: bug
report.description: AnalyticsTracker event LOGIN_FAILED_TO_GUESS_XMLRPC seems to have increased occurrence in v5.4.x of the app. Possibly related: #4195

report.summary: LOGIN_INSERTED_INVALID_URL bump in v5.4.x
report.label: bug
report.description: AnalyticsTracker event LOGIN_INSERTED_INVALID_URL seems to have increased occurrence in v5.4.x of the app. Possibly related: #4194

report.summary: Login: Self-hosted login form not falling back to http
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When you try to log in to a site that doesn't support https, the app should fall back to http when it looks for the site's XMLRPC endpoint. Actual behavior The app only looks for the site's XMLRPC endpoint over https and returns an error if the site doesn't support http. In my testing, the app displayed an "Invalid SSL certificate" error: A user also reported this issue, and the app logs showed that the app only checked the https URLs. It then displayed the error "Check that the site URL entered is valid." (107830-h) Steps to reproduce the behavior Reproduce the error: Open the app and go to log in to a self-hosted site (either on the self-hosted login screen or by adding a new self-hosted site to the app) Enter your username, password, and self-hosted site's domain (e.g. yourgroovydomain.com) for a site that doesn't support https Try to sign in Result: You receive an invalid site URL or SSL error Log in successfully: Open the app and go to log in to a self-hosted site (either on the self-hosted login screen or by adding a new self-hosted site to the app) Enter the same username, password, and self-hosted site URL beginning with http:// (e.g. http://yourgroovydomain.com) for a site that doesn't support https Try to sign in Result: You are logged in successfully Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-13 Reported by users with WPAndroid 5.4.

report.summary: "Use as featured image" is not works every time
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When user upload an image with "Use as featured image", the featured image shall be saved. Actual behavior When user upload an image with "Use as featured image", the featured image is not saved. Steps to reproduce the behavior (1) Upload an image (select a photo from gallery or Capture photo) (2) Tap the image to open a modal window "Image setting" (3) Check "Use as featured image" Tested on [device], Android [version] FTJ152A, Android version 5.1 (I reproduced the behavior also Xpedia, but didn't confirmed the model type and version)

report.summary: Comments: replying to comment does not auto-approve
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior In the Comments section of the app, I send a reply to a pending comment. I expect this to approve the comment and post my reply because that is how it works from notifications and WP Admin. Actual behavior My reply gets 'posted' but the comment I replied to is not automatically approved, so neither appears on my site. Steps to reproduce the behavior Have a comment in moderation. Open the Comments section of the app and find that comment. Reply to that comment. Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 6.0.1 Raised in Helpshift: 111856-h

report.summary: EmailCheckerIntegrationTest uses old version of EmailChecker
report.label: bug
report.description: Our EmailCheckerIntegrationTest needs to be updated to use emailchecker2.

report.summary: Media Library Displays Incorrect Thumbnail in Grid
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected Image thumbnails maintain correct preview of media (i.e. image/audio/video). Observed When flinging to scroll, some image thumbnails show incorrect preview. See video for details. Focus on the Angry Birds image at the bottom of the grid in the video. Reproduced Go to Sites. Tap Media option. Scroll to bottom of grid. Notice Angry Birds image. Fling to middle of grid. Fling to bottom of grid. Notice Angry Birds image. Fling to middle of grid. Fling to bottom of grid. Notice Angry Birds image. Tested LG G4 (LG-H815) on Android 6.0.1 with WordPress 5.4.2 Samsung Galaxy S III (SGH-I747) on Android 4.4.4 with WordPress 5.4.2 Samsung Galaxy S IV (SGH-I337) on Android 5.0.1 with WordPress 5.4.2 Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 (SM-T310) on Android 4.4.2 with WordPress 5.4.2

report.summary: Media Image Too Small for High-Density Screens
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected Show full-width image when viewing item details from Media library. Observed Some images are too small when displayed on high-density screens. See screenshots for details. Reproduced Go to Sites. Tap Media option. Tap image with 700 width by 100 height. Tested LG G4 (LG-H815) on Android 6.0.1 with WordPress 5.4.2 Samsung Galaxy S III (SGH-I747) on Android 4.4.4 with WordPress 5.4.2 Samsung Galaxy S IV (SGH-I337) on Android 5.0.1 with WordPress 5.4.2 Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 (SM-T310) on Android 4.4.2 with WordPress 5.4.2
