report.summary: Apostrophe displayed incorrectly when replying from a notification
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When replying to a comment notification, if you leave the same comment twice, a message pops up that should say "Duplicate comment detected; It looks as through you've already said that!" Actual behavior The message doesn't render the apostrophe correctly, and actually reads as "Duplicate comment detected; It looks as through you#8217;ve already said that! This only happens when replying from the notification. Replying from the Reader displays a more basic "Couldn't post your comment" popup. Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the app and tap the notifications icon Scroll down to a comment notification, and open it Use the 'Reply to [Commenter Name] field to submit a comment Once the comment is submitted, try saying the same thing again to trigger the popup Tested on HTC One M9, Android 6.0

report.summary: Switch Sites search results open the wrong site on URL matches
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When searching in Switch Sites, the results show matches based on site title or URL - tapping the site you want should open that site's options Actual behavior If the site title matches your search string, the correct site opens. If the site URL matches (but the title doesn't) the app will open the wrong site. In that case, if the site you choose from the results is the third in the list, the app opens the third site in the main Switch Sites list, not from your search results Steps to reproduce the behavior In an account with multiple sites, find or create a test site that has a different site title than its URL (Example: 'This Is A Testing Site' as the title and 'reallyobscurebug.wordpress.com' for the URL). Open the app and tap Switch Sites. Note the order of sites listed. Which ones are first, second, third, and so on. Tap the magnifying glass to search and enter a string that matches your test site URL, but not its title. In the above example you would use the first few characters of 'reallyobscurebug.wordpress.com' When your test site appears in the list, notice how far down it is (is it the first, second, third, etc., result). Tap the test site to try opening it. Notice the site that actually opened - it will be the site from the corresponding position in the main Switch Sites list. Tested on HTC One M9, Android 6.0

report.summary: Nothing happens when offline and tapping the SEND button in user Invite screen
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior In the user Invite Screen, tapping "SEND" while typing a username should bring up some form of error message to denote the inability to perform the action while offline Actual behavior Tapping SEND in those conditions only buttonizes the username and then nothing happens. Steps to reproduce the behavior Go into the user Invites screen by visiting MySite > People and tapping the "+" button on the actionbar Put the device to offline mode Start typing a username and before hitting "enter" Tap the "SEND" action The username mutates into a "button" like widget Nothing else happens. Tested on [device], Android [version] Nexus 5X emulator running Android 6.0

report.summary: Floating Action Button Disappears on Moderation Word Screen
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected On the Hold for Moderation screen, adding multiple words does not affect the Add floating action button position or size. Observed As the screen is filled with words, the Add floating action button is minimized and eventually disappears. See the screenshot below. Reproduced Go to Sites tab. Tap Settings option under Configuration section. Tap More option under Discussion section. Tap Hold for Moderation under Comments section. Tap Add floating action button. Enter unique word. Repeat Step 5 and Step 6 until screen is full. Tested LG G4 (LG-H815) on Android 6.0.1 with WordPress 5.5 Samsung Galaxy S IV (SGH-I337) on Android 5.0.1 with WordPress 5.5 Samsung Galaxy S III (SGH-I747) on Android 4.4.4 with WordPress 5.5 Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 (SM-T310) on Android 4.4.2 with WordPress 5.5

report.summary: Crash report 5.5: NPE in SiteSettingsFragment
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected To delete a word from the Hold for Moderation screen, long-press on the list item to activate the action mode and contextual action bar. Observed When the Hold for Moderation word list exceeds the size of the device screen, long-pressing on items near the end of the list causes the app to crash. See the animation and stack trace below. 07-02 18:56:56.150 30629-30629/? E/AndroidRuntime: FATAL EXCEPTION: main Process: org.wordpress.android, PID: 30629 Theme: themes:{} java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to invoke virtual method 'void android.view.View.setBackgroundColor(int)' on a null object reference at org.wordpress.android.ui.prefs.MultiSelectListView.onItemLongClick(MultiSelectListView.java:68) at android.widget.AbsListView.performLongPress(AbsListView.java:3151) at android.widget.AbsListView$CheckForLongPress.run(AbsListView.java:3083) at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:739) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:95) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:148) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5461) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:726) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:616) Reproduced Go to Sites tab. Tap Settings option under Configuration section. Tap More option under Discussion section. Tap Hold for Moderation under Comments section. Scroll to bottom of list. Long-press last item in list. Tested LG G4 (LG-H815) on Android 6.0.1 with WordPress 5.5 Samsung Galaxy S IV (SGH-I337) on Android 5.0.1 with WordPress 5.5 Samsung Galaxy S III (SGH-I747) on Android 4.4.4 with WordPress 5.5 Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 (SM-T310) on Android 4.4.2 with WordPress 5.5

report.summary: Warn the user to clear failed images (or edit the post) on publish from Post List
report.label: bug
report.description: Similar to #3897 but we should show that (kind of) dialog with all publishing ways (from the Post List, from the Editor). Not doing it could cause published post to contain broken media.

report.summary: Error 404 when replying to comments with device language set to Arabic or Farsi (Persian)
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior Users should be able to reply to comments (e.g. from the notifications comment detail view) no matter what device language they use. Actual behavior Comment replies fail when the device language is set to Arabic or Farsi (Persian). Replies work as expected with other languages (tested in Spanish and Hebrew) or with the device language set to English and keyboard language set to Arabic. I get this error when I try to reply to a comment with my device language set to Farsi: 07-04 13:07:06.996 11904-11947/? E/WordPress: [11795] BasicNetwork.performRequest: Unexpected response code 404 for https://public-api.wordpress.com/rest/v1/sites/۷۶۰۲۶۹۶۲/comments/۳۷/replies/new?locale=fa_IR 07-04 13:07:07.010 11904-11904/? E/WordPress-COMMENTS: com.android.volley.ServerError at com.android.volley.toolbox.BasicNetwork.performRequest(BasicNetwork.java:179) at com.android.volley.NetworkDispatcher.run(NetworkDispatcher.java:114) It looks like the issue is that these languages use different numerals, so the site ID and comment ID in the API request are being sent in the wrong numeral system. Steps to reproduce the behavior On a WordPress.com or Jetpack blog, leave a comment (to trigger a notification) In the app, open the comment notification and approve the comment if needed Reply to the comment. Result: Comment is successfully published. In the device settings, switch the language to Arabic or Farsi (Persian) Return to the app and reply to the comment. Result: Comment fails. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-16 Reported by a user in 114004-h using WPAndroid 5.5 (h/t Sandy for the report)

report.summary: Reader: Images with height attribute are displayed with incorrect ratio
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior Images should be resized in the reader according to the image's original width/height ratio. Actual behavior Images with a height attribute (e.g.

report.summary: Reader: Related posts disappear after rotating device
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior The related posts section should always be visible in the post detail view in the reader Actual behavior If you rotate your device after viewing the post detail, the related posts section disappears Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the reader tab Tap on a blog post to open the post detail Scroll to the bottom and confirm that the related posts appear at the bottom Rotate your device. Result: The post reloads (you are taken to the top of the post) and when you scroll down, the related posts section is gone If you rotate again or pull down to reload the post it doesn't bring the related posts back. You have to exit the post detail and open it again to get the related posts back. Screenshots Related posts in the post detail view: After rotating the device and scrolling down to the bottom of the post: Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-16

report.summary: Notification settings: Two of the notification sounds are the same
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior Each of the custom notification sounds should be different. Actual behavior The "Default notification sound" is the same sound as "Tethys." Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the app and go to Notification Settings Select "Notification sound" Tap on "Default notification sound" and "Tethys" — both play the same sound. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-16

report.summary: People: Backspace v. tapping to remove a username/email address from an invitation
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When inviting a new user, after entering a username or email address in the invitation form I expect to be able to backspace or tap the "x" to remove them. (Both methods work in Calypso web for removing an invited user from the invitation form.) Actual behavior I can only tap the "x" to remove the username or email address I entered in the invitation. Although I have a cursor (for entering more in the username/email field) I can't backspace to remove a previous entry in that field: Steps to reproduce the behavior In the app, go to the site dashboard > People Tap the plus icon to invite a new user Enter a username or email address in the "Usernames or Emails" field Tap enter or tap outside the "Usernames or Emails" field to complete the entry (an "x" will appear next to the username/email you entered) Backspace to try to remove that username/email. Result: The cursor can't backspace over that username/email. Tap the "x" to try to remove that username/email. Result: the username/email is removed. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-16

report.summary: People: Validation when inviting an existing member differs for public and private sites
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When I try to invite a user who is already the member of a site, I expect the invite form to do the same validation and display the same error message no matter what site I'm on. Actual behavior The invite form has different behavior depending on whether I'm inviting a user to a public or private site. On a public site: I can enter the username or email for an existing member of the site. When I try to send the invite: The username turns red The message USERNAME: Already a member appears below the username I get the error Invite sent but error(s) ocurred! (Note: There's a typo in that error — it should be occurred with two c's.) On a private site: As soon as I hit enter after entering a username/email or tap outside the "Usernames or Emails" field: The username turns red I see the message There's already a member with username 'USERNAME' If I try to send the invite anyway, I get the error Cannot send: A username or email is invalid Screenshots Public site, before sending the invite: Public site, after sending the invite: Private site, before sending the invite: Private site, after sending the invite: Steps to reproduce the behavior In the app, go to the site dashboard > People for a public site Tap the plus icon to invite a new user Enter the username of an existing member on the site in the "Usernames or Emails" field Tap enter or tap outside the "Usernames or Emails" field to complete the entry (an "x" will appear next to the username you entered) Tap "Send" on the invite Go back to the site dashboard and switch to a private site Tap the plus icon to invite a new user Enter the username of an existing member on the site in the "Usernames or Emails" field Tap enter or tap outside the "Usernames or Emails" field to complete the entry (an "x" will appear next to the username you entered) Tap "Send" on the invite Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-16

report.summary: Reader: Timestamp should be next to Author's name
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior For timestamp to be next to Author's name just like in Calypso: Actual behavior Timestamp is next to the site name/URL: The timestamp refers to the time post was published so it shouldn't be next to the site's name/URL. Steps to reproduce the behavior Tap on a post from Reader Notice how timestamp on full-post view is next to the site name/URL Tested on [device], Android [version] Nexus 5 simulator, Android 6.0 /cc @nbradbury

report.summary: Reader: Follow/Following icons are still using old version
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior For Follow/Following icons to be using the latest version: Here are the SVGs in case you need them: https://cloudup.com/cqULXWspuwT Colors: Follow: grey_dark / #2e4453 Following: alert_green / #4ab866 Actual behavior Follow/Following icons are still using the old version: Steps to reproduce the behavior Visit any site stream on Reader. Tested on [device], Android [version] Nexus 5 simulator, Android 6.0 /cc @nbradbury

report.summary: Reader: Backing out of full-screen video causes post to be empty
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior Backing out of full-screen video from a post in the Reader should show the post again Actual behavior Backing out of full-screen video from a post in the Reader causes the post to become empty Steps to reproduce the behavior View a post in the Reader that has a video embed in it Play and full screen the video Back out of the video Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 6.0.1

report.summary: People: Should not be possible to enter more than 10 usernames/emails in invite form
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When inviting users to join a site, I expect the invite form to limit me to 10 usernames/emails at a time, like in Calypso web: After entering 10 usernames/emails in that web form, the "Usernames or Emails" field won't accept any more entries. Actual behavior I can enter as many usernames/emails as I want in the "Usernames or Emails" field in the invite form. However, after I hit "Send" 10 of the usernames/emails I entered (not necessarily the first 10) disappear from the form, and this message appears: An error occured while trying to send the invite! After that message disappears, this message appears: Invite sent successfully The 10 usernames/emails that disappeared receive an invite, but any remaining usernames/emails in the invite form don't get the invite. It isn't clear from the app messaging what happened and why. Steps to reproduce the behavior Go to the site dashboard > People in the app Tap the plus icon in the top right to invite new users In the "Usernames or Emails" field, enter at least 11 usernames/emails Tap SEND in the top right to send the invite Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-16

report.summary: People: confusing 'Invite sent' toast message
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When an error occurs and the invite is not sent, I expect the error toast message to say that the invite was not sent. Actual behavior Instead, the toast error messages says that the invite was sent in these two cases: the email blocked invite emails from wp.com the username already exists as a user on the site In both of these cases, I got a toast that 'Invites sent but error(s) occured!' However, invites were not in fact sent (and should not be sent) Steps to reproduce the behavior Go to the People area for a site Click the '+' sign Type in an email or username that is a member of the site (do not move cursor away from textbox area) Click 'Send' See this: If you add a user that blocked invites, you'll see this instead: Tested on [device], Android [version] alpha-16, nexus 6, android 6.0.1

report.summary: Media: Media library does not load media for sites with basic HTTP auth
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior I expect to be able to view media in the site's media library (My Site > Media or in the Editor > Add media > Select from media library). Actual behavior If a site has basic HTTP auth, media in the media library doesn't load and a placeholder is displayed instead: (Images added from the media library or uploaded to a new post also display as broken images in the editor.) Steps to reproduce the behavior Add a self-hosted site with basic HTTP auth to the app Visit the My Site tab > Media Result: The media thumbnails don't load. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-16 Reported on Nexus 5, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid 5.5 in 114458-h

report.summary: People Management: Removing username before it's validated leads to crash.
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior Removing username before it's validated is possible. Actual behavior Removing username before it's validated leads to crash. Steps to reproduce the behavior To test this add username and immediately press X to remove it. You might want to try it couple of times, depending on how fast validation is. Crash report: E/AndroidRuntime: FATAL EXCEPTION: main Process: org.wordpress.android, PID: 29275 java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to invoke virtual method 'android.view.View android.view.ViewGroup.findViewById(int)' on a null object reference at org.wordpress.android.ui.people.PeopleInviteFragment.styleButton(PeopleInviteFragment.java:354) at org.wordpress.android.ui.people.PeopleInviteFragment.access$800(PeopleInviteFragment.java:38) at org.wordpress.android.ui.people.PeopleInviteFragment$8.onUsernameValidation(PeopleInviteFragment.java:321) at org.wordpress.android.ui.people.utils.PeopleUtils$11.onResponse(PeopleUtils.java:289) at org.wordpress.android.ui.people.utils.PeopleUtils$11.onResponse(PeopleUtils.java:267) at com.wordpress.rest.RestRequest.deliverResponse(RestRequest.java:76) at com.wordpress.rest.RestRequest.deliverResponse(RestRequest.java:19) at com.android.volley.ExecutorDelivery$ResponseDeliveryRunnable.run(ExecutorDelivery.java:99) at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:739) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:95) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:135) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5221) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:372) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:899) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:694)

report.summary: People Management: Long usernames do not have X mark near them.
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior Long usernames have X mark near them that let's you remove them. Actual behavior Long usernames do not X mark near them. Steps to reproduce the behavior Add the long username to invite text field.

report.summary: WordPress.com options not showing when logged in as 'self-hosted'
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When signing into the app as a 'self-hosted' site, but specifying a WordPress.com username/password and a '.wordpress.com' site url, I should be logged into WordPress.com and everything should behave as though I hadn't selected 'self-hosted' when I signed in. Actual behavior While I can see my WordPress.com sites, the 'Me' screen doesn't have the WordPress.com options, and still shows 'Connect to WordPress.com.` Steps to reproduce the behavior Start from a fresh app install, or sign out of WordPress.com At the sign-in screen, select 'Add self-hosted site' Enter a correct WordPress.com username and password, and set the url to anything.wordpress.com ('anything' can be a real blog owned by that user, or not) Once signed in, go to the 'Me' screen Observe that the 'Me' screen is the one shown when not logged into WordPress.com Tested on Nexus 5X, Android 6.0.1

report.summary: People Management: Text fields at Invite screen are black on api 16 (4.1.1)
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior Text fields look normal. Actual behavior Tested on Galaxy Nexus, Android 4.1.1 using alpha-17

report.summary: People Management: Keyboard for Username text field on Invite screen not showing up in landscape
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When you click on Username text field in landscape soft keyboard pops up. Actual behavior When you click on Username text field in landscape nothing happens. Steps to reproduce the behavior Rotate your device so it would be in landscape mode. Go to Invite screen of People Management. Click on "Usernames or Emails" text field. In addition, if you open the keyboard in portrait mode and rotate the device, keyboard reopens. Tested on Galaxy Nexus (4.1.1), Nexus 4 (4.4.4), Nexus 5 (5.0.0)

report.summary: Notifications settings dialog doesn't show all options when screen is rotated
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior If the dialog is present, then it should keep showing the same option list regardless of screen orientation changes. Actual behavior In portrait mode, open up the notification settings dialog and then change the device orientation to landscape. Some notification options in the list do not fit the screen, (so either the bottom items are not shown or are displayed partially) and the dialog doesn't allow scrolling down. Portrait mode (choosing either "Notifications tab" or "App notifications" in step 4 below). Rotated to landscape mode (choosing either "Notifications tab" or "App notifications" in step 4 below). Tapping on "Email from WordPress.com" as per alternative step 4.1 below: Portrait Landscape (see the options are "cut") . Steps to reproduce the behavior log in to Android WP app, and keep your phone in protrait mode go to the profile tab tap on "Notification Settings" Pick any site and then choose either "Notifications tab" or "App notifications" 4.1 (alternatively, instead of picking a site, tap on "Email from WordPress.com") the dialog is shown rotate your device the dialog shows as described in the Actual behavior section. Tested on Moto X, Android 5.1

report.summary: Scheduled post notification not showing info
report.label: bug
report.description: Originally reported by @mjangda Expected behavior When a post is scheduled, a notification should be triggered with the basic information about the post being published Actual behavior _I received a scheduled post notification just now and it looked like this in the notification drawer. Clicking through, the notification looks fine but lacked a lot of information when viewed in the drawer._ Steps to reproduce the behavior Schedule a post Wait for the schedule to happen, with the app in the background Tested on: Android version seems Lollipop

report.summary: Sharing to Media Library then task-switching crashes app
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Share an image to WordPress and select the Media Library Once the image has uploaded, press the Back button to return to the previous app Attempt to task switch back to WordPress Expected behavior WordPress opens Actual behavior WordPress fails to open and throws an error https://cloudup.com/cQsK0hUQ6sS Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 6.0.1

report.summary: Correctly track creating a new site
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior Creating a new site triggers a "created new blog" event Actual behavior Creating a new site triggers a "created new account" event Steps to reproduce the behavior Create a new a blog from the "add a site" prompt. Tested on Nexus 6P

report.summary: Audio shortcode is not rendered correctly / doesn't play in the Reader
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior I expect audio embedded with the [audio] shortcode to either be embedded in the Reader or to appear as a link that I can tap to listen to the audio file. Actual behavior The audio shortcode is not rendered at all, leaving a blank space in the Reader: Steps to reproduce the behavior Create a new post Embed an audio file in the post with the [audio] shortcode (shortcode details in the Codex) Publish the post View the post in the Reader Result: A blank space appears where the audio embed should be in the post. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-18

report.summary: Can't preview how a draft looks on the site anymore
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior If I have a saved draft in the app, I expect to be able to preview how it will look on my site before I publish it. Actual behavior In version 5.5, drafts could be viewed to see how they will look on the site (and on-site preview). Steps: Open the app and go to the Blog Posts list Find a saved draft (marked "Draft" in the list) Tap the "View" link to view an on-site preview As of version 5.6, though, drafts can only be previewed in the in-app preview, not the on-site preview. Steps: Open the app and go to the Blog Posts list Find a saved draft (marked "Draft" in the list) Tap the "Preview" link to view an in-app preview @0nko could this have been introduced along with the Publish button in #4189, and if so, was it intentional? Unfortunately this prevents users from seeing a "real" preview of how the draft will look on their site. Screenshots On-site preview in version 5.5: In-app preview in version 5.6: Current behavior tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-18 Behavior from 5.5 and 5.6 tested with APKs in an emulator

report.summary: "View Site" is not shown for users that have created a site past Sep 9, 2015.
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior No matter what date the user has created a site, the user should be able to view their own site Actual behavior Only users that have created a site before Sep 9, 2015 can view their own site from "My Sites"

report.summary: Viewer list is in wrong order
report.label: bug
report.description: Viewer list should be ordered as newest first, exactly as it's returned from the API.

report.summary: People: Viewer section isn't immediately added/removed when you change site privacy
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior If you change a site to private, the Viewer section should appear in People Management. Likewise, if you change a site from private to public, the Viewer section should be removed from People Management. Actual behavior The Viewer section is not added/removed from People Management until you close and reopen the app. Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the My Sites tab and select a public site Go to Settings Change the Privacy setting to Private Go back to the My Sites tab and go to People Tap to view the People filter (Team/Followers/Email Followers). Result: The Viewer section does not appear in the app Swipe to close the app completely Reopen the app and go to People Tap to view the People filter (Team/Followers/Email Followers/Viewers). Result: The Viewer section now appears in the app. You can also repeat these steps, changing the Privacy setting back to Public/Hidden, and the Viewer section does not go away until you close and reopen the app. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-18 h/t @designsimply for the original report

report.summary: Plan: not enough room for tabs
report.label: bug
report.description: I just noticed a fourth plan was in today, and we don't have enough room for the 4 tabs on small screen devices: We should probably use scrollable tabs, the experience is not the best, but it can adapt to any screen / number of plans / i18n.

report.summary: Kickstarter oEmbed URLs not embedding in posts published from the app
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior I expected Kickstarter URLs starting with kickstarter.com/projects or kck.st to be embedded in a post, per the oEmbed list here: https://github.com/WordPress/WordPress/blob/master/wp-includes/class-oembed.php#L94 This works as expected when publishing from the web and viewing the post on the web. Actual behavior Kickstarter URLs are displayed as plain links in the published post (in the app and on the web) instead of being embedded. Steps to reproduce the behavior Find a Kickstarter project and copy the link to it (both the full URL and the short kck.st version) In the app, start a new post Paste the links to the Kickstarter project on their own lines in the editor Publish the post Result: The projects are not embedded in the post. Screenshots Kickstarter URLs posted from the web editor and viewed in a browser: The same Kickstarter URLs posted from the Android editor and viewed in a browser: Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-19

report.summary: Import successful notification empty
report.label: bug
report.description: originally reported here: #4402 (comment) Expected behavior When a blog is imported and import finishes, a notification should be triggered with the basic information about the blog that has been imported. Actual behavior _empty notification shown in the notification drawer.

report.summary: PIN input screen can be easily bypassed
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When opening the app with PIN lock on you should only be allowed to see anything once the correct PIN/fingerprint has been used. Actual behavior When I see the PIN/fingerprint screen then hit my phone's back button, the app is then reopened without the PIN/fingerprint screen. This means that anyone can open the app and easily bypass the security check. Steps to reproduce the behavior Switch PIN lock on Exit the app Wait a few seconds and then reopen the app - you should see the PIN/fingerprint screen Press your phone's back button Quickly reopen the app - you should now be in the app without having to go through the PIN/fingerprint security check Tested on Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge, Android 6.0.1, App version alpha-19

report.summary: Running app in multi-window changes padding
report.label: bug
report.description: Running WordPress in multi-window makes the effective width much smaller. It should stay the same width. Normal width: Multi-window width:

report.summary: People: User role from Team shows up next to non-user viewer
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When a user is going through the Team, Followers, Email Followers, and Viewers, the correct user role (or lack of) should show up next to the username. Actual behavior Going from Team > Followers > Viewers in rapid succession results in the user role of someone in Team showing up as the user role next to the Viewer's username. ### Steps to reproduce the behavior Go to Site dashboard > People. Add viewer to site. Start with Team selected, then select Followers (or Email Followers), then Viewers. Result: A user role of a user in Team will show up as the user role of the viewer, despite the viewer not having a user role. You must go from Team > Followers or Email Followers > Viewers to replicate the issue, going from Team > Viewers will result in seeing no user role next to the viewer, which is correct. Tested on Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge Plus, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-20

report.summary: Reader Post List: emoji weirdness in post titles
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior (From Calypso reader) Actual behavior (on a genymotino 6.0)

report.summary: People: Long names overwrite the Role in the user list
report.label: bug
report.description: As seen in this screenshot, a user with an extremely long name (completely made up in this case) will overlay on top of the role definition, so I have to click through to see what role they have. ##### Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 6.0.1

report.summary: Reader: Discover list not loading posts after viewing the Following list
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the Reader -> Discover Click the gear icon Click the back arrow (either the Android back button or the navigation arrow in the app) Repeat several times (in the GIF below it happened on the first try, but usually it takes at least two) Expected behavior To see the Discover list of posts again Actual behavior A note saying "No posts with this tag". Refreshing by pulling down successfully re-loads the list. It happens whether there are tags in the Follow list or not Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 6.0.1

report.summary: Reader: Post header doesn't appear on all posts in the post list
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior I expect the post header to appear on all posts in the Reader except in the Discover list (where the Discover section should have a site header but the posts shouldn't have post headers). Actual behavior In the Reader post list, some posts have a header and others don't. I saw this on multiple lists, including Followed Sites and tag lists. I also noticed that the problem was not consistent — the same site may have some posts with post headers and some without. Also, if I pulled down to refresh the list it didn't have an effect, but if I rotated the device between portrait and landscape the post header appeared on all the posts in the list. However, when I tapped on a post with no post header, I did consistently see a post header on the post detail view. @nbradbury could this be an unintended effect of #4436? Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the app and go to the Reader Select a list other than Discover Scroll through the post list and look for posts with/without post headers Screenshot Posts with and without the post header, with the Food tag: Tested on Nexus 9, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid alpha-20
