report.summary: Followers shouldn't have roles
report.label: bug
report.description: When you change the people filter from users to followers, the role labels remains. https://cloudup.com/ciG8JfropAz

report.summary: PDF links from the Reader show empty WebView
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When tapping a .pdf link in an article while in the Reader, I am expecting the PDF document to open and be readable. Actual behavior Tapping a .pdf link in the Reader opens a WebView showing an empty white screen with a toolbar at the top. Steps to reproduce the behavior Write a post that has a link to a PDF file Open the post in the Reader Tap the PDF link Empty WebView should have come up Tested on [device], Android [version] Samsung Galaxy S4, Android v5.0.1, App version 5.8

report.summary: NUX: Site URL erased from self-hosted login form when app goes to background
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior I often log in to self-hosted sites with these steps: Enter my Username Skip the password field Enter my Site URL Switch to my password manager app Copy my password Switch back to the WordPress app and enter my password in the login form Sign in to the site I expect my username and site URL to stay in the login form when I leave and reopen the app, so I can just paste in my password and continue on. Actual behavior Enter my Username Skip the password field Enter my Site URL Switch to my password manager app Copy my password Switch back to the WordPress app -> My site URL is erased from the login form (the username remains) This also happens if I enter all of my details (username, password, and site URL) and then switch away and back. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.0, WPAndroid alpha-21

report.summary: Reader: Followed Sites view can show tagged posts out of order
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior Followed Sites in the Reader is always expected to appear in order of the publish date on the posts. Actual behavior The changes in #4527 sort posts by the date they were tagged, instead of their publish date. This should only affect tag streams (with a tagged_on date) and not the Followed Sites view. However, if a post exists in both your followed sites and a tag stream, it will appear out of order on the Followed Sites view. Reported by a user in 131783-h

report.summary: Reader: can't follow blog with 302 temporary redirect
report.label: bug
report.description: In the past it was possible to follow a blog that had a 302 redirect, but it appears to fail now. Try to follow ma.tt in the reader and it will fail, citing 302 as the failure status code.

report.summary: Reader: Some iframe embeds can appear mis-styled after stripping inline css.
report.label: bug
report.description: We're stripping the inline css from iframe embeds. This can causes some layout/styling issues for certain iframes, case in point: Mesh. Original report from Joen: Here’s the oembed code for a Mesh:

report.summary: Reader: Wrong post is loaded after orientation change
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce: Go to Liked Posts, Followed Sites or Reader Blog. Open any post. Change device orientation. The post that goes before the one you loaded, appears in post view. (sometimes you need to change the orientation back to original for wrong post to appear). Video to illustrate the problem: https://cloudup.com/cP_UswVjfPf Tested on alpha-23 with Nexus 5x 6.0.0 and Nexus 5 5.0.0

report.summary: Notifications: Comment requiring moderation still provided "Like" option
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior Comments awaiting moderation should have "Reply / Approve" actions Actual behavior I received "Reply / Like" actions Steps to reproduce the behavior I was unable to reproduce this, but I wanted a bug report out there in case others see the problem. This is what I did (on a blog with moderation required only for the first time a user comments on the site): Left a comment on a blog as a new user -- Received the "Reply / Approve" notification, the Approve button worked Left several new comments as that user -- Received the "Reply / Like" notification, both buttons worked Left a comment as another new user -- Received the "Reply / Like" notification, despite the fact that the comment required moderation Here's a screenshot showing the corresponding e-mail notification for context: ##### Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 7.0, alpha-23

report.summary: Notifications: "Like" button shouldn't open the app
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When I click the Like button in a notification I expect to remain in whatever app I'm currently using Actual behavior I'm taken out of my current activity and placed into the WordPress app's notification view. I'd much rather just get a toast message indicating success/failure rather than having the whole app open up and interrupt whatever else I'm doing. This can be especially jarring when I interact with the notification from my Android Wear watch, since then the next time I unlock my phone it's in a different app from where I left it. I'm labelling the issue with [Type] Bug, but if others feel strongly that this is the desired behavior it can be re-labelled an Enhancement and worked on later Steps to reproduce the behavior Receive a notification of a comment, and click Like Tested on Nexus 6P Android 7.0, alpha-23 👍 1

report.summary: Media library status text is hard to read
report.label: bug
report.description: When uploading something via the Media section in the Android app, the “uploading”, “queued”, and “retry” text (on failed uploads) is a bit hard to read. The tap target for “retry” seems very small (and it’s not obvious that it is tappable since it looks the same as the other states). per @mjangda

report.summary: Notifications: Comment PNs missing action icons
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior In #4537 the actions on the push notifications are evenly spaced, with icons next to each action (e.g. a checkmark for Approve, a star for Like): Actual behavior I see both actions left-aligned with no icon: Is that the expected formatting for the push notification on Android 7.0? If it's possible, it would be nice to at least space out the actions more to avoid accidentally tapping the wrong one. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.0, WPAndroid alpha-23

report.summary: Site Picker: Can't pick re-hidden site while searching
report.label: bug
report.description: This is a bit weird, and definitely an edge case, but here we go: Start with several of your blogs hidden from the site picker and having your default site selected and its site detail visible. Tap Switch Site Tap Search to view all your sites, including those that are hidden. Tap one of the hidden sites. The site should be selected and unhidden when you tap it. Tap switch site to return to the site list. Select the default site again. Go back to the site list. Hide again the site you previously tapped. Still on the site list, tap Search. Tap the site you just hid to try to select it. Notice that nothing happens when you tap the site now. Seems like you should.

report.summary: Editor: Issue with backspace with bluetooth keyboard
report.label: bug
report.description: Originally reported by @rachelmcr A user reported an issue in the Android app v. 5.6, using a Galaxy Tab S2 (SM-T815) with Android 6.0.1 and a bluetooth keyboard. When they are leaving comments on other blogs or replying to comments on their own blog, and they hit the backspace key, it goes back two spaces instead of just one. This is a consistent problem but doesn’t happen with the same keyboard elsewhere in the app (e.g. the editor) or in other apps. Needs confirmation.

report.summary: Edited Post Changes Date to 1999
report.label: bug
report.description: Originally reported by Chrissie P WordPress – 5.6.1 SM-P601 android – 4.4.2 Persian Video clip of issue (very helpful) – http://sendvid.com/lhr8mdg4 Persian writing keyboard. User creates a post and it falls under the correct date when published. The user edits the post, and the post goes to the bottom of the posting list. On the web, the posts show in the correct order. Follow up by @rachelmcr On the web, the date was actually changed on the page, as well. Here’s the page from the user’s screencast: https://lokht.wordpress.com/%D8%AA%D9%86%D9%87%D8%A7%DB%8C%DB%8C-%D9%88-%D8%A8%DB%8C-%D8%A2%D8%BA%D9%88%D8%B4%DB%8C-%D8%B3%D9%85-%D8%A7%D8%B3%D8%AA-%D9%86%D8%B3%D8%AE%D9%87-1-0/ The publish date on that page is now January 1, 1970. I can reproduce this when I switch my device language to Persian and edit a page on a test site, but I haven’t yet tracked down why that’s happening. [...] Just a quick note that I tested this in Arabic and found that if I change the device language to Arabic it causes this issue, but if I only change the interface language in the app settings to Arabic (with English as the device language) there’s no problem. I’m pretty sure there’s a problem with the date being sent in the wrong numerals

report.summary: Editor: Empty draft after opening editor
report.label: bug
report.description: @rachelmcr reports: A user reported that they were working on a draft (with lots of text and photos) for a number of days. They then opened it in the editor to keep working on it and discovered that the draft was empty. I checked the logs that came in with the issue, and I noticed that there is a connection error near the beginning of the log: 08 - java.net.UnknownHostException: Unable to resolve host "public-api.wordpress.com": No address associated with hostname Could that connection error have caused the content loss in the editor? And if so, can we prevent that from happening? I have seen some reports of similar issues in app reviews and when it happens with a local draft we can’t recover the content, so it’s a pretty serious issue. Opening this issue to track possible/related occurrences

report.summary: Posting: Local changes warning misleading
report.label: bug
report.description: Member report shared by Chrissie P When I make local changes on the Android app I get a message that “this post has local changes which haven’t been published” with the option to “Publish” or “Revert”. “Publish” is misleading here. The post in question is a draft. I don’t want it published yet. I suggest this be escalated as bug. But as it happens, nothing happens. When I hit the “Publish” button I get a brief spinning circle with no message to indicate if the action has succeeded it failed. However when I switch back to the Posts screen the post is marked as having “local changes”. We loop round several times accepting the offer to “Publish” but although the spinning wheel takes longer to go away each time, the changes still remain local. The same thing happens if I use the “revert” button. I still get the report that there are “local changes. Screencast at http://ChBQNAP.myqnapcloud.com:8080/share.cgi?ssid=0OAnMJd

report.summary: Reader: Can't share posts to some services
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior I expect that when I view a single post in the Reader, I can tap the share icon to share it to any service that appears there. Actual behavior If I try to share the post to certain services (such as Pinterest) I get the error "Please use a valid Web address." (A similar error has been reported for users with WhatsApp, although I haven't confirmed that error yet.) I am guessing this is because the post's URL is prefixed by the post title, instead of being the URL on its own. If I share the post from the Blog Posts list, instead of the Reader, I can share it without any error. Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the Reader in the app Open the post detail for a post Tap the Share icon in the top right Select a sharing service such as Pinterest Result: You see the error "Please use a valid Web address." Alternate steps that work: Open the My Sites tab in the app Open the Blog Posts section Tap "View" under a blog post Tap the Share icon in the top right Select a sharing service such as Pinterest Result: The post is shared as expected. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.0, WPAndroid alpha-23 Reported on WPAndroid 6.0.1 in 135352-h

report.summary: Reader: stretched images in full post refresh
report.label: bug
report.description: The featured images added in #4626 are stretched vertically, whereas they should be cropped to fit the size of the ImageView. Note: wait for #4626 to be merged before tackling this, then make sure to branch from reader-full-post-refresh-master.

report.summary: Notifications: "Like" should not be an option for comments on Jetpack sites
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior Jetpack does not currently support Comment Likes, so it doesn't make sense for "Like" to be an action on comment notifications for Jetpack sites. Actual behavior In comment notifications (in the notifications tab and push notifications) there is an option to "Like" a comment on a Jetpack site. Push notification: Notifications tab: In contrast, the Comments section for the same Jetpack site does not have the "Like" option: Steps to reproduce the behavior On a Jetpack site, make sure the site is set to approve incoming comments From another account, make a comment on the site to trigger a notification Check the notification and confirm it shows the "Like" action Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.0, WPAndroid alpha-23 Reported by a beta tester here

report.summary: Notification is dismissed when device is rotated
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When I have the WordPress app on the foreground and I receive a push notification, the notification icon should stay there even if I rotate the device. Actual behavior When I have the WordPress app on the foreground and I receive a push notification, I notice the notification icon appears in the system bar. If I rotate the device, the notification icon for the WordPress app is now gone. Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the app and leave it in the foreground make something happen in the outside that triggers a push notification (for example, have some other user comment on a blog post you're an admin of) observe the notification icon appear rotate the device observe the notification icon disappear Tested on [Nexus 5], Android [6.1]

report.summary: "Uncategorized" post category blocked for adding
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior "Uncategorized" category should be allowed to be added even when other categories are already added. Actual behavior "Uncategorized" category is blocked from adding when other categories have already been added. Steps to reproduce the behavior Go to the editor to edit a post Tap the "gear" action to edit the post settings If "uncategorized" is already added, remove it Tap the "+" icon in the categories section to add some categories If "Uncategorized" is the only one shown in the list, tap the "+" action and create an additional one Tap the "Uncategorized" list item to select it Nothing changes. List item remains unchecked. Tested on [device], Android [version] Nexus 5X, Android v7.0, WPAndroid vAlpha-24

report.summary: Notifications: if the app is stopped, no notifications are displayed
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior I should be receiving notifications from WP if I have the app installed, no matter what the running state for the app itself is. Actual behavior after stopping the app, no notifications are received / processed / shown to the user. They start appearing after I first launch the app again. if you power off your device and turn it back on, but never launch WordPress manually, you never get any notifs. Steps to reproduce the behavior CASE A) (notifications are received) Log in to the Android WordPress app Have someone like/comment on a blog post of yours See the notification arrive at your device CASE B) (notifications are not received) Turn your phone off and then back on, but do not launch the WordPress App. Alternatively, you can also go to Apps-> WordPress and then hit FORCE STOP. Have someone like/comment on a blog post of yours See the notification NEVER arrive at your device. Tested on [Nexus 5], Android [6.1]

report.summary: Editor: Uploading multiple images/videos does not finish
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior All files get uploaded. Actual behavior The uploading starts and then grinds to a halt at various levels of progress. Steps to reproduce the behavior Create New Post Insert multiple large photos or videos via Add Media > Select using multi-picker Pictures begin to upload to post Some are successful (varies how many) while others get “stuck” with a non-moving progress bar Tested on OnePlus One, Android 6.0.1, WP alpha-24 Original report: https://mobilerequests.wordpress.com/2016/07/01/android-trouble-uploading-multiple-images

report.summary: Capital letters in account email causing Gravatar validation error
report.label: bug

report.summary: Notifications: handle actions on PIN lock feature
report.label: bug
report.description: Follow up from comment here #4673 (comment) If a PIN lock is in place, quick actions should first check for that and then show a Toast indicating why the action can't proceed.

report.summary: Reader: Posts with no Gravatar are showing somebody else's icon
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior To see the blank 'mystery man' icon when the user has no gravatar or site icon Actual behavior I'm seeing a different user's face...in this case it happens to be the user who posted the last post I had open (and Liked), but I can't say for sure that's why it got picked up. At this point I can't seem to do anything to get it to change. Android: Web: Steps to reproduce the behavior View a post in the Reader from a user with no gravatar or site icon Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.1 (beta), alpha-25

report.summary: Me: small typo on the "Open source licenses" page
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce: Go to the Profile > "App Settings" > "Open source licenses" page. Scroll down to the "Notices for library: photoview" section. Result: It appears there's an extra slash where there shouldn't be one.

report.summary: Reader: legacy sharing links open an image when clicked
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce: Using WPAndroid 6.1-rc-1, open a post with legacy sharing links in the feed, such as https://wordpress.com/read/feeds/5649174/posts/1202645527 Scroll to the bottom of the post Click on any of the sharing links Result: legacy sharing links like this look unprofessional and do not work if you tap on them. Those images should not ever appear in the Reader. Clicking the share icon and then "Copy to clipboard" resulted in this text: Being organized about computer security - http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/unclutterer/~3/0cQBz0bpX9A/ The same images do not appear when viewing the same post in the Reader on the web. Seen at https://wordpress.com/read/feeds/5649174/posts/1202645527 using Safari 10.0 on Mac OS X 10.11.6

report.summary: Posting: images appear as html in local drafts
report.label: bug
report.description: After closing and reopening a local draft, images appear as html and I expecting that they would still appear as images. Steps to reproduce: Start a new post using WPAndroid 6.1-rc-1 Add a title Add an image to the body of the post Tap back until you see the list of posts Notice the new post is labeled "Local draft" Tap on the new post that was just created Result: The image appears as html, but I expected it to show up as an image. New post screen on WPAndroid 6.1-rc-1 on a Samsung Galaxy Tab4 (SM-T330NU) Android 5.1.1

report.summary: Missing notification icon and noticon
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior The notifications list should show the same icon and noticon as WordPress.com (in this case, a Jetpack icon and an "i" noticon.) See top notification as it looks on WordPress.com: Actual behavior On the Android app, the notification shows default grey icons for the notification (see top notification in screen shot.) Steps to reproduce the behavior View a notification with icon https://s.wp.com/wp-content/mu-plugins/jetpack/i/logotype-jetpack.svg and noticon "info". Tested on [device], Android [version] Device: Droid Turbo Android: 5.1 App: alpha-25

report.summary: Notifications: wearable doesn't show Like/Approve (only Reply)
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When receiving a comment notification, 2 actions are typically shown: Reply Like (or) Approve Actual behavior Only Reply is being shown. Steps to reproduce the behavior Have someone comment on a post of yours, and wait for hte notification appear on your handset and wearable. The notification on the handset should have REPLY and LIKE / APPROVE (these latter depend on your blog settings for comments). The notif on the wearable has only REPLY and the default wearable actions (block app). Tested on [Nexus 5], Android [6.0.1] cc @hoverduck

report.summary: Notifications: comment reply text persists to new comments (field should be empty)
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior After commenting on a post from Notifications, then opening up a new comment, the comment reply field should be empty. Actual behavior The previous comment I made persists in all comment fields, even other posts or blogs. Steps to reproduce the behavior Open Android app Click Notifications menu item Click on a comment on on of your posts Type a reply and click SEND action Comment is added Now, navigate to another comment, and see your reply text from step 4 is pre-filled in the form — instead of an empty form field Screenshots #### Tested on [device], Android [version] Nexus 6P, Android version 7.0, WordPress Android app version alpha-25 Reference: https://make.wordpress.org/mobile/2016/10/27/call-for-testing-wordpress-for-android-6-1/

report.summary: Notifications: 2fa should only act on "Approve" if device screen is unlocked
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When a 2fa notification is received, quick actions APPROVE and IGNORE are offered. If your screen is locked, APPROVE should tell you you can't approve while the screen is locked. Actual behavior When you tap APPROVE, the approval is sent to wp.com even if the screen is locked. Steps to reproduce the behavior enable 2FA on your website log in to your app, then lock your phone's screen once logged in log in to your website on a desktop browser the 2FA auth push is received, with quick actions available and actionable. Tap "Approve" to log in to your site you get to log in even when the device screen is locked. Tested on Nexus 5, Android 6.0.1

report.summary: Pressing backspace on hardware keyboard removes two characters at Reader Comment text field
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior Pressing backspace on hardware keyboard only removes one character in Reader Comment text field. Actual behavior Pressing backspace on hardware keyboard removes two characters in Reader Comment text field. Steps to reproduce the behavior Go to reader. Tap on the comments counter in any post. At the bottom of the screen tap on "Reply to post.." Input some text. Pres backspace. Confirm that the two characters are removed instead of one.

report.summary: Reader: Blavatars missing from posts in Reader posts list
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior I expect the same blavatar to appear on the post card (top left) in the Reader posts list and on the single post view. Actual behavior I see a blavatar and author avatar on the single post view, but no blavatar on the same post in the post list. Looking through my Followed Sites list in the Reader, it looks like most blavatars are not showing there. (I do see them for an RSS feed I follow and en.blog.wordpress.com.) cc @nbradbury Screenshots Reader post list: Single post view: Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.0, WPAndroid alpha-26

report.summary: Killing app while editor is open leaves an (Untitled) draft
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Open a new post Kill the app from the overview screen Open the app back up and navigate to the Blog Posts page Observe the (Untitled) local draft Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.1 (seen above in 4.4.2 emulator)

report.summary: Leaving the editor removes Featured Image from post
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the editor for a new post, setting the title and body Open post settings and set a featured image. Back out of the editor Navigate to the Blog Posts list and edit the post Open post settings and confirm the featured image is still set Publish the post Note that your post no longer has a featured image Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.1 (shown above on an Android 4.4 emulator)

report.summary: HTTP Auth dialog is shown when we should show a specific error message.
report.label: bug
report.description: In feature/fluxc-integration, when the xmlrpc endpoints return a 403 ( on listMethods), we show a HTTP Auth dialog to the user when we should show a "Access to your XMLRPC endpoint is forbidden, you should check your http server config or contact your host". We should also redirect the user to the right FAQ page on that screen.

report.summary: Editor: Setting media width >2000px silently fails
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Add an image to a post Edit the image Set the width to anything greater than 2000px and save Expected behavior To either be able to set the width to an arbitrary value, or be warned that >2000px is not allowed Actual behavior The field is silently set back to 2000px with no errors or indications of a problem Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.1, wp alpha-27

report.summary: Notifications: double processing of quick actions
report.label: bug
report.description: Likes/approve/inline reply is executed twice.

report.summary: Magic Link: Some emails linked to WordPress.com accounts aren't recognized
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior I expect that if I enter an email address linked to a WordPress.com account in the login form, I will proceed through the magic link login flow. Actual behavior Some email addresses are not recognized as being linked to a WordPress.com account, so after entering the email address I am taken to the self-hosted login form. Tapping "Log in to WordPress.com" takes me back to the previous login form (username/email only), but I still can't force a WordPress.com login — when I try to go to the next screen I am taken again to the self-hosted login form. I noticed that this seemed to consistently happen with Gmail addresses using + addressing, e.g. example+wordpress@gmail.com. Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the app (logged out) on the WordPress.com login screen Enter a Gmail address with + addressing linked to a WordPress.com account Tap the "Next" button Result: The form takes you to the self-hosted login form, even though the email is linked to a WordPress.com account. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.0, WPAndroid alpha-28

report.summary: Magic Link: "Check your email" screen not center-aligned
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior I expect the screens in the magic link login flow to be center-aligned. Actual behavior The "Check your email" screen is not centered — it's slightly off-center to the left. Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the app (logged out) on the login screen Enter an email address linked to a WordPress.com account and tap Next Tap "Send link" (to send the magic link) Result: You end up on a "Check your email" screen where the text and button are off-center. Screenshots Correctly centered: Off-center: Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.0, WPAndroid alpha-28

report.summary: Opening a link to comment on a post (/#respond) does not put focus on the reply box
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When I open a link to comment a post, e.g. from a WordPress.com subscription email, I expect the comment view for that post to open in the Reader with the focus on the reply box. The URL format for this link is this: https://*.wordpress.com/{year}/{month}/{day]/{post-slug}/#respond Actual behavior The comment view for that post opens in the Reader, but the focus isn't on the reply box. I have to tap on the reply box to start commenting. Steps to reproduce the behavior Subscribe to a WordPress.com site (with a *.wordpress.com URL) Open an email subscription notification in your email app on your device At the bottom of the email, tap the "Comment" button If prompted, select to open the link in the WordPress Reader Result: The comments view for that post opens in the Reader, but the focus is not on the reply box. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.0, WPAndroid alpha-28

report.summary: Reader comments: handle backend returning same page of comments
report.label: bug
report.description: I'm not sure yet, but it looks like the Android reader suffers from the same thing described in this iOS PR.

report.summary: Notifications: Liked comment sometimes is not reflected in the detail view
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When you tap like on a comment, the comment is liked and when you return to the notifications list and come back in, the liked status should be reflected. Actual behavior The liked status is missed sometimes. Steps to reproduce the behavior go to notifications tab choose a comment tap on it like the comment go back to the list tap on the same comment see the 'like' option is greyed, as if it hasn't been liked. Tested on [Nexus 5], Android [6.0.1]

report.summary: Push notification sound is played twice
report.label: bug
report.description: Noticed that the push notification received sound is played twice.

report.summary: PIN Lock breaks "Open with Reader" flow
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Set a PIN lock on the WP app Click a link to a post, and select "Open with WordPress.com Reader" if prompted Input PIN Expected behavior The post opens in Reader What actually happens The post appears extremely briefly before the PIN lock screen opens. After inputting the PIN we're then left on whatever screen was last open in the app. Note that this works fine if you open the link first in an app's internal browser, then click "Open in Chrome" before being redirected to the Reader. Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.1, WP alpha-28

report.summary: Samsung Multiwindow support not working
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior The WPAndroid app should be available / eligible for Samsung multiwindow support (please to not be confused with Android 7 native multiwindow support). Actual behavior The application is not listed as eligible anymore, as reported on some Samsung devices. Steps to reproduce the behavior WP is no longer available as an app that you can access in the split screen menu when using other apps Tested on Samsung Note 5, Android 6.0.1

report.summary: Upload error notifications can't be expanded
report.label: bug

report.summary: Post list loader: no progress is shown
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When the loading operation in the Posts list for a given site is in progress, some indicator should be shown. Actual behavior Sometimes it takes a bit to load, but no progress is shown. This specially happens when I load a self hosted site first time (after having added it to my site list). Steps to reproduce the behavior add a self hosted site to WPAndroid go to BLog posts options Wait for it to load, and observe there is no progress indicator that the app is doing anything Tested on [Nexus 5], Android [6.0.1]

report.summary: Site chooser: no progress shown when loading
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When the loading operation in the site chooser list is in progress, some indicator should be shown. Actual behavior Sometimes it takes a bit to load, but no progress is shown. Steps to reproduce the behavior be an admin for lots of sites, like me :) got to switch site for first time Wait for it to load, and observe there is no progress indicator that the app is doing anything Tested on [Nexus 5], Android [6.0.1]

report.summary: Reader Crossposts Recycled Out of Order
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected Reader crossposts remain in the order which they are originally displayed. Observed Reader crossposts are replaced when returning to their original position quickly. It might due to a logic error in the RecyclerView.ViewHolder view assignments. Reproduced Go to Reader tab. Select site with multiple crossposts. Scroll down past multiple crossposts. Fling back up to first few crossposts. Notice the original crossposts have changed. Tested Google Pixel on Android 7.1 with WordPress 6.1

report.summary: Remove the Plans menu item if the user is not an Admin of the site
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior Plans Item should not be in the left menu if the logged user is an author or a contributor. Check what we should do for editors. I guess only the admin should have access to Plans menu item. Steps to reproduce the behavior Add yourself to a .com/Jepack blog with a user level of Author. Start the app, change site, and check the Plans menu item. It is there.

report.summary: Live site view breaks for published posts when site uses plain permalinks
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior I expect to be able to view a blog post (published or draft) by tapping the "View" link in the post list. Actual behavior This behavior does not work as expected if a site uses plain permalinks (e.g. ?p=123) instead of another permalink structure. (All other permalink structures I tried worked as expected.) When I tap "View" for a draft post, the live site preview loads expected. However, when I tap "View" for a published post, I get a blank screen and the error "Links are disabled on the preview screen: Steps to reproduce the behavior On a self-hosted WordPress site, go to Settings > Permalinks in the WP Admin dashboard. Select "Plain" for the permalink structure. In the WordPress app, add that site (or select it from the site picker if it already exists). Open the Blog Posts and make sure the list of posts is synced. Find or create a draft post and select "View" — result: you can preview the post as expected. Find or create a published post and select "View" — result: you get a blank screen with the error noted above. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.0, WPAndroid alpha-30

report.summary: Quote with Ordered List in Comment Displays as Bullet List
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected A quote containing an ordered list is shown as it is in a browser (i.e. as a quote with an ordered list). Observed A bullet list with a quote is shown when viewing a comment with a quote containing an ordered list in the app. The comment contents are shown below.

report.summary: Me: Gravatar error when account has no Gravatar image set
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior I expect to be able to use an account without a Gravatar if I choose not to upload one. Actual behavior Using an account with no Gravatar, every time I launch the app (after closing it, not just putting it in the background) I get the error message "Error reloading your Gravatar." After uploading a Gravatar, the Gravatar appears on the Me screen and the error stops appearing. Steps to reproduce the behavior Create a new account in the app, or log in to an account with no Gravatar On the Me screen, the error "Error reloading your Gravatar" appears Swipe the app closed Relaunch the app, and the error reappears Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.0, WPAndroid alpha-30 Reported in 147872-h

report.summary: Notification timestamp resets after device is locked
report.label: bug
report.description: Report: "As of the last day or so, I’ve noticed the timestamp in the “pull down” resets whenever I unlock my device. It says now upon unlock and counts up until the device locks again, then starts over. I’m on a Google Pixel, latest software. WordPress 6.3-rc-1." I can reproduce this consistently. Note the "1m" timestamp in this notification: When I return to the lock screen, that same notification has a "now" timestamp. And the "now" timestamp persists after unlocking.

report.summary: 'Open in Reader' bypasses PIN lock for links to comments
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Set a PIN lock in the WP app Click a link to the comments of a post (i.e https://gh908testing9.wordpress.com/2016/11/28/new-post-without-pin/#comments) Select "Open with WordPress Reader" if prompted Expected behavior To be prompted for my PIN before being able to view the comments Actual behavior The PIN lock screen appears briefly, but is then overlaid by the comments screen. Related: #4847 Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.1, WP alpha-30

report.summary: Notifications: Unable to swipe between in-app notifs after opening from system notification
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Spawn a WP.com notification, such as by leaving a comment on your site as another user Open the Android notification, which should launch the app to the WP notification Try to swipe to older notifications Expected behavior To have the same swiping behavior as when opening the notification from inside the app Actual behavior Nothing happens. Backing out of the notification and re-opening it restores the swiping ability Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.1, WP alpha-30

report.summary: Notifications: Opening WP notif from Android system notification doesn't appear as Read
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Spawn a WP.com notification, such as by leaving a comment on your site as another user Open the Android notification, which should launch the app to the WP notification Back out to the notifications list Expected behavior To have the notification marked as read Actual behavior The notification still appears unread. It's a display issue only, looking at the notification on another device it appears read (or if you refresh the in-app notifications list) Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.1, WP alpha-30 👍 1

report.summary: Notifications are not rebuilt anymore when debugger is detached
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior Always handle quick actions show/hide when WPPin enabled (they should not be shown on the lock screen, and be shown again when the device is unlocked) Actual behavior When debugger is detached (wondering if this might happen in other, real world situations), notifications are not being re-built anymore, so setting a WPPin and locking/unlocking the device doesn't make any difference - notifications remain with or without quick actions, depending on the state things were when the debugger was detached. Things start working again when a new notification is received (thus triggering the initialization of a new NotificationHelper) Steps to reproduce the behavior I think this only happens to me... But managed to reproduce by setting up a debugging session then unplugging the USB cable when on a breakpoint. Tested on [Nexus 5], Android [6.0.1]

report.summary: Notifications: avatar is not shown when notification is rebuilt
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When setting WPPin enabled, locking/unlocking the device re-builds notifications to hide/show quick actions. The avatar and icon for the notification should remain unchanged. Actual behavior When setting WPPin enabled, locking/unlocking the device re-builds notifications to hide/show quick actions. In this, the avatar is sometimes lost and replaced by the W logo placeholder. Steps to reproduce the behavior Having WPPin enabled, receive a notification from a user that has an avatar configured. Observe the avatar is shown in the notification in the system's dashboard lock the screen and unlock observe the avatar is not shown in the notification anymore Tested on [Nexus 5], Android [6.0.1]

report.summary: Poor formatting on site Notification Settings pages
report.label: bug
report.description: Navigate to Me -> Notification Settings, then choose a site. Notice that there's no margin between the top of the display and the first menu item ("Notifications tab"). It makes me feel like I'm scrolled part-way down already, and I keep wanting to scroll up to see what I'm missing. Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.1, WP alpha-30

report.summary: Notifications: pending drafts with no title show weird message
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When a post with no title is collected by the pending drafts feature (#4399), we should show You drafted “(Untitled)” but never published it. Actual behavior Steps to reproduce the behavior Draft a local untitled post on Android, then wait for 3 days (or change the corresponding static values for this in NotificationsPendingDraftsService.java), you'll see this notification come up. Tested on [device], Android [version]

report.summary: Pin lock screen appears after requesting Android M permissions
report.label: bug
report.description: This is an edge case and only happens once as you give the app permissions, but: Expected behavior When you install the app for the first time and start using features that require permissions from the system, since Android 6.0 system dialogs are presented to interact with the user so they can allow access to the required system features (for example, attempting to include some media while editing a post). Once the user allows this, the flow should continue in the app seamlessly, regardless of the user having PIN lock enabled or not. Actual behavior When PIN lock is enabled, and you have not allowed permissions for the first time to access media and record audio/video, tapping the “add image” icon in a draft post being edited asks for the permissions and then presents the PIN lock screen (which looks awkward) Steps to reproduce the behavior install the app for first time log in to it enable PIN lock start a new draft post tap on the include image icon give the app the necessary permissions by accepting the system dialogs that appear there the PIN lock screen is shown. Tested on [Nexus 5], Android [6.0.1]

report.summary: FluxC integration: Site picker sometimes doesn't work
report.label: bug
report.description: I'm sometimes unable to switch sites using the site picker in the fluxc-integration branch. There is no error, but I'm returned to the site fragment with the same site active as before. The only way to change sites is to remove the current site (or sign out of WP.com). I've so far only been able to reproduce this on an emulator (API 23). This will happen every time I use the site picker until the app is reinstalled (and most recently, the issue persists even after multiple clean installs). After some testing, I'm seeing that getSiteFragment() is returning null here, so the result of the SitePickerActivity seems to be discarded, and that's the reason the site doesn't changed.

report.summary: Notifications: duplicate Like note
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior Notes shouldn't be duplicate. Actual behavior When liking and unliking shows 2 equal Notes on the Notifications tab. Steps to reproduce the behavior I can repro by liking a post on the web, viewing the note on Android, then unliking and liking the same post again. Tested on [Nexus 5], Android [6.0.1]

report.summary: App Settings: Interface Language setting does not persist after closing app completely
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior I expect the language setting under Me > App Settings > Interface Language to persist until I change the setting (or perhaps until I log out). Actual behavior When the app goes to the background, the language setting persists. However, if I swipe to close the app completely, when I reopen the app the interface language is reset to my device language. Steps to reproduce the behavior Go to Me > App Settings > Interface Language Select a language other than your device language Tap OK Completely close the app Reopen the app Result: The interface language is now your device language, instead of the language you selected as the app's interface language. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-30 Reported in 150629-h on Samsung Galaxy A7, Android 6.0.1, WPAndroid 6.2

report.summary: Customizer: "Select Files" button doesn't work
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior I expect all the visible UI elements in the customizer to work as they do in a web browser. Actual behavior I can't upload images using the customizer's "Select Files" button. Two places this appears: Site Logo > Select logo > Upload Files Header image > Add new image > Upload Files The button doesn't do anything when I tap on it, so I have to exit the customizer, upload the image to the Media section, and then re-open the customizer to use it. If the button won't work within the app, it'd be best if we could hide that Upload Files tab to avoid creating the expectation that files can be uploaded there. Steps to reproduce the behavior In the app, open a site's Themes section Tap "Customize" to open the site's customizer Open the Site Logo section Tap the "Select logo" button Go to the Upload Files tab Tap the "Select Files" button to try to upload a file Result: Nothing happens, so you can't upload a file there. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-31 Originally reported in an app review.

report.summary: Pending Draft Notifications not working when no pending drafts at launch
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior Pending drafts notifications should be triggered if you have drafts sitting there for more than 3 days. (read #4835 for a detailed spec) Actual behavior Pending drafts notifications not ever triggered if first time you launch the app you have no drafts in your blog posts list. Steps to reproduce the behavior open blog post list make sure you delete all the drafts you have if any force stop the app launch the app again and go to blog posts write a draft change the device date to something beyond 3 days in the future get back to the app it should show the pending drafts notification, but it doesn't. Note: if you had a draft post already there, and forced stop the app then started it back again (with the date set to 3 days ahead), it would work Tested on [Nexus 5], Android [6.0.1], and emulator on 7.1.1

report.summary: Post images disappear after scroll in Posts view
report.label: bug
report.description: Behavior When viewing a list of published Posts, the posts' images will disappear if you perform the following: Scroll down Scroll back up Some posts now do not show images Before scrolling down: After scrolling down and then scrolling back up: Tested on [device], Android [version] Google Pixel, Android 7.1.1, WordPress Android Alpha-31

report.summary: Login: WordPress.com styles appear on logged-in "add self-hosted site" login screen
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior I expect to see the self-hosted login screen added in #4851 whenever I add a self-hosted site to the app. Actual behavior If I am already logged in to the app, and I add another self-hosted site, the self-hosted login screen has the WordPress.com styles on it (including "WordPress.com" below the logo): Steps to reproduce the behavior Log in to a WordPress.com account in the app, or add a self-hosted site. After logging in, go to the site picker Tap the + icon and select "Add self-hosted site" Result: The self-hosted login screen has WordPress.com styles instead of self-hosted styles. cc @hypest Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-31

report.summary: Jetpack: Stats prompt leads to error if Jetpack is installed but deactivated
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior If Jetpack is installed on my site but deactivated, and I visit the Stats section for that site, I expect to see a message about installing/activating Jetpack. Actual behavior When I visit the Stats section, I see a message that Jetpack is installed but not connected to WordPress.com. When I tap "Yes" to connect Jetpack, I get the error "Sorry, you are not allowed to access this page" (because Jetpack is installed but not activated): If I activate the Jetpack plugin, it works as expected — I am taken to the Jetpack section of my site's dashboard where I can connect Jetpack to WordPress.com: Steps to reproduce the behavior On a self-hosted site, install the Jetpack plugin but do not activate it. In the app, log in to that self-hosted site. Open the Stats section. When the prompt appears, tap "Yes" to connect Jetpack to WordPress.com. Result: Error message. In your site's dashboard, activate the Jetpack plugin. Open the Stats section again. When the prompt appears, tap "Yes" again to connect Jetpack to WordPress.com. Result: You are taken to your site's dashboard to connect Jetpack. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-31

report.summary: Remove Smart Lock for self-hosted
report.label: bug
report.description: When Smart Lock auto-fills a username/password and the user hasn't modified any textfields, if the user clicks "add a self-hosted site", we should clear out the WordPress.com username/password. Repro steps: Open the app and have Smart Lock auto-fill the username/password Tap "Add a self-hosted site" The app goes to the self-hosted login with the wp.com username/password still filled in.

report.summary: Schedule Post calendar formatting problems when switching screen orientation
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior To be able to see the full calendar for scheduling a post regardless of screen orientation Actual behavior The calendar appears cut off in two different ways depending on where you start: A) With the device starting in portrait orientation open the post options page and select the PUBLISH option to open the calendar. Now rotate the device to landscape orientation and observe that the calendar is cutoff halfway down. B) With the device starting in landscape orientation open the post options page and select the PUBLISH option to open the calendar. Notice that the bottom row of the calendar is cutoff. Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.1, WP alpha-31 (Originally reported on mi redmi 3s prime and Andorid OS is 6.0.1)

report.summary: Notifications: Multiple pending draft notification links to Notifications display instead of Post List
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Create several local draft posts Push your device date 3+ days into the future Open the WordPress app Click the notification or its edit button Expected behavior To be directed to the Posts List Actual behavior The WP app opens to the notifications pane Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.1, WP alpha-31

report.summary: Cannot log in to WordPress.com with a password
report.label: bug
report.description: If you enter an email and get sent to the magic link request view, pressing the "Enter your password instead" doesn't allow you to enter your password.

report.summary: Magic links "Send Link" doesn't work with 2fa
report.label: bug
report.description: Logout of the app Sign into wp.com using your email address Tap "Next" Tap "Send Link" Tap "Launch your email app" Open the sign in email and tap "Sign in to WordPress.com" You'll be directed to the page below, which instructs that you'll receive a push notification in the WordPress app - which of course you never receive, since you're not signed in.

report.summary: Featured image are showing in low resolution
report.label: bug
report.description: Hey there, When I watch my feed in WordPress for Android, it appears aliased. As my screen is in FullHD (1920x1080), my image in 4K with a low weight (less than 50 ko) and my internet connection is 4G, it should: Expected behavior Appear in a great quality without any aliasing. Actual behavior Appear in a bad quality with aliasing. http://image.noelshack.com/fichiers/2017/02/1483963241-screenshot-20161226-115812.png Steps to reproduce the behavior Create an article on your WordPress website, Upload a featured image to this article, Search for your article on WordPress App. Tested on LG Nexus 5, Android 6.0.1

report.summary: Reader Stream Refresh: gallery from post 1 duplicated in post 2 card
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When browsing my Followed Sites in Android app, I'd expect each card to only display the text and image from that blog post. Actual behavior I noticed a post from Andrew Spittle's blog included a gallery preview (4-thumb up) from Maureen's blog post. Steps to reproduce the behavior I'm not sure how to reproduce... maybe with: Follow both those blogs in Reader. View the Reader stream to see if the gallery is duplicated in the other post's card. Tested on [device], Android [version] Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.1, WordPress for Android version alpha-32

report.summary: [Analytics] Jetpack user not tracked correctly
report.label: bug
report.description: While reviewing the site migration, I've found that the method WordPressDB.hasAnyJetpackBlogs() never worked. It assumes the field api_blogid defaults to 0, which is incorrect. This never worked and will be fixed when FluxC is merged.

report.summary: Reader: Single post screen could be empty when device is rotated landscape
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior The post details screen not to be empty. Actual behavior When I rotate the device from portrait to landscape, the post details screen sometime is blank in landscape orientation. Note: Rotate --> Rotate many times. Steps to reproduce the behavior Open post details screen Rotate back and forth the device to landscape (repeat this some times if you can't reproduce the issue immediately) At certain point the device shows an empty post on landscape orientation Best to reproduce on a post with multiple pictures, or long post Tested on Nexus 5X, Android 7.1

report.summary: Reader: attached image not in a gallery is used as a featured image
report.label: bug
report.description: See this iOS issue for details.

report.summary: Crossposts Do Not Follow Links and Hide Post Content
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected Tapping a crosspost goes to the linked site. Observed Tapping a crosspost hides the post contents. See the screenshots below for example. screenshot removed Reproduced Go to Reader tab. Tap a post with a crosspost link. Notice the post content (see Before above). Tap the crosspost link. Notice the post content disappears (see After above). Tested Google Pixel on Android 7.1.1 with WordPress 6.5

report.summary: Notification Remains Unread After Opening From System Notification
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected Notifications are marked as read when returning to the Notification tab after opening a system notification. Observed Notifications remain unread when returning to the Notification tab after opening a system notification until the tab is refreshed manually or the notification is opened from the Notification tab. Reproduced Refresh Open a system notification from the WordPress app. Tap the back arrow or back button. Notice the notification is still unread (i.e. light blue background). Swipe down to refresh the Notifications tab. Notice the notification is now read (i.e. white background). Reread Open a system notification from the WordPress app. Tap the back arrow or back button. Notice the notification is still unread (i.e. light blue background). Tap the notification from the list. Tap the back arrow or back button. Notice the notification is now read (i.e. white background). Tested Google Pixel on Android 7.1.1 with WordPress 6.5

report.summary: Comment Like Status is Reverted When Device is Rotated
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected Rotating the device retains comment like status. Observed Rotating the device reverts comment like status. The like/unlike is saved on the backend, but the interface does not reflect the correct state. Reproduced Go to Notifications tab. Tap a comment notification. Notice the state of the Like/Liked button. Rotate the device. Notice the state of the Like/Liked button is unchanged. Tap the Like/Liked button. Notice the state of the Like/Liked button is changed. Rotate the device. Notice the state of the Like/Liked button reverts to the original state. Tested Google Pixel on Android 7.1.1 with WordPress 6.5

report.summary: Jetpack auth login screen mode bypassed when switching to password login
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior The login screen mode should still stay in "Jetpack auth" mode when dropping out of magic-link login mode back to password mode. Actual behavior The login screen is presented as normal login, losing the "To view your stats, log in to the WordPress.com account you used to connect Jetpack." message and offering self-hosted login and account creation on the spot. Steps to reproduce the behavior With no WPCOM account connected and only a Jetpack selfhosted site added to the app Tap on the "Stats" item on the site screen. The app asks to login to the WPCOM account connected to Jetpack Enter the email address and tap "Next" Tap on "Enter your password instead" to switch back to password login mode Boom. Login screen is no longer Jetpack auth configured Tested on [device], Android [version] Nexus 5X, Android v7.1.1

report.summary: Reader: Error unfollowing a site that has been deleted
report.label: bug
report.description: To reproduce: Create a new wpcom blog. Follow the blog In your Reader's following stream, confirm that posts from the blog appear. Delete the wpcom blog. Go to the Reader's Manage Sites screen and try to unfollow the delete blog. You'll see an error message stating that API requests have been disabled for that site, and the site is not removed from your following list. I tried to reproduce this in the web reader and was able to successfully unfollow the site. This suggests we need to update which endpoints the app calls to unfollow a site. @nbradbury cc @aerych as this is present in the iOS reader as well. wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#6457

report.summary: Refresh Graphic Shows Non-WordPress Color
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected Refresh graphics show WordPress colors like blue_wordpress, blue_medium, blue_light, or orange_jazzy. Observed Refresh graphics show black or holo_blue_dark. Reproduced Black Go to Notification tab. Swipe down notifications list. Notice refresh color is black. Blue Go to Sites tab. Tap Blog Posts option. Swipe down blog posts list. Notice refresh color is holo_blue_dark. Tested Google Pixel on Android 7.1.1 with WordPress 6.5

report.summary: Reader: Site Details for the same site can be opened repeatedly
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior If you are viewing the Site Details screen for a site, any links to that site's Site Details should be disabled so you can't reopen the same screen twice in a row. Actual behavior If you are viewing the Site Details screen for a site, you can tap on the site title at the top of one of the blog posts in the post list to re-open the same Site Details screen. Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the Reader in the app. Tap the title of a site to open the Site Details screen. At the top of any of the posts in the post list, tap the Gravatar/author/site title again. Result: The same Site Details screen re-opens. You can do this repeatedly, and when you close the screen you'll see that each time you opened a new view that needs to be closed. Reported in 158887-h. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-34

report.summary: FluxC integration: Sign Up - Some error from the server should not be displayed
report.label: bug

report.summary: Media - No Permissions to Upload Media
report.label: bug
report.description: If the user doesn't have permissions to upload media on the blog, there is no clear error message in the editor. Just the "Retry" option. It allows you to try and retry, but doesn’t show no permissions until you press and hold on the failed image.

report.summary: FluxC: Editing post for local changes don't update the post detail
report.label: bug
report.description: Go into a post detail and start editing it Make some changes, but don't update the post (so keep the changes local) Go back to post detail page and notice that the changes are not there and the previous version is shown

report.summary: FluxC: Reverting changes don't update post detail page
report.label: bug
report.description: Edit a post and go back without updating the remote (keep the changes local only) Go back to post list, because the detail page won't update right now #5136 Go into the detail page and revert the changes Notice that the page is not updated

report.label: bug
report.description: I think we're missing a call to the delete action here.

report.summary: FluxC: most recent sites grouping is not working
report.label: bug
report.description: Most recent sites are not updated In the example below I had "pony396" selected before opening the picker, so I should see it in the top of the list:

report.summary: Editor: Contributors should not see the option to publish posts
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior If my role on a site is Contributor, I shouldn't see an option to Publish in the editor. Instead of Publish, the primary action I see should be "Submit for Review." Actual behavior When I use the app as a Contributor, and write a post, I see a big Publish button. If I click on it, the editor closes like normal. But if I navigate to my Posts list, I see that it's only been saved locally; it's not actually uploaded to my site at all. After a minute, I'll get a bad error message. Steps to reproduce the behavior Add a contributor to a site Login to the app as that user Open the editor Write a post and click Publish. Current flow:

report.summary: Aztec: Editor scrolls to top when content changes
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior Aztec editor retains the scrolling position even when loading images. Actual behavior Aztec editor scrolls to the top. Steps to reproduce the behavior Open a post in Aztec with a few images (that have not been loaded previously, thus showing a placeholder image), scroll down while they are loading. Tested on Xperia X Compact, Android 7.0

report.summary: Aztec: (Non-Aztec) posts are modified by just opening them
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior Old, non-Aztec posts stay unchanged. Actual behavior Unknown changes are made to the post. Just looking at an old post flags it as containing "Local changes". Steps to reproduce the behavior Open a post that has not been created with Aztec, don't change anything and go back. Toast will say "Changes saved" and post is flagged as "Local changes". Tested on Xperia X Compact, Android 7.0

report.summary: Aztec: Constant app crashes when using non-stock keyboards
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior To be able to use any keyboard I want Actual behavior The app crashes when using anything other than Gboard. Tested with Google Voice Typing, Swype, Hacker Keyboard, and LastPass Steps to reproduce the behavior Start a post Type a word in the post body or title and press enter or space Crash At first it seemed like it was only crashing on pressing Enter (not space or selecting the autocomplete suggestion), but when I went to record this video it was crashing on everything. https://cloudup.com/chE-z_MDz2V Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.1, WP alpha-35

report.summary: Featured image appears blank on local drafts in posts list
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior I expect the featured image for a post to appear above that post in the posts list. Actual behavior If the post is a local draft, a blank space appears above the post in the posts list, but the featured image itself does not appear (even if the image was selected from the site's media library). Screenshots Post as a local draft: Post after saving it to the server as a draft: Steps to reproduce the behavior Create a new post in the app. Open the post options. Set a featured image (selecting an image from the media library). Go back to exit the editor. Note the blank space above the post in the posts list. Open the post in the editor again. Publish the post or change its status to Draft and save it. Note the featured image appears above the post in the posts list. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-35 (using visual editor)

report.summary: FluxC: Duplicate Jetpack site
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Login with a .com account which has a Jetpack site connected to it Go into site picker and make sure the Jetpack site shows up Add your Jetpack site as a self-hosted site with the + button We should show a "Duplicate site" error in this case, since it's already added as a Jetpack site and using REST API, however a second site shows up. The site objects for these 2 sites are different, as expected.

report.summary: Stopping a media upload doesn't remove the media from the post
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior If I tap to stop an image from uploading, I expect the image to be removed from the post. Actual behavior If I tap to stop the upload while an image is uploading (in Aztec), the image stops uploading, but it stays in the post. The image retains the "uploading" status (so I can keep tapping it and selecting "stop upload" over and over). It looks fine in the editor because the image is being displayed from my device but it's broken on the site. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-35

report.summary: MediaGridFragment: cursors never closed
report.label: bug
report.description: We never close the cursors used in the MediaGridFragment here

report.summary: Media Browser: uploading/queued/failed uploads should not be tappable
report.label: bug
report.description: In the media broswer: user can tap the title on an uploading / queued or failed upload, this opens the Media detail view to edit meta data which is broken since the media is not on the server yet.

report.summary: Media Grid: status texts are not localized
report.label: bug
report.description: Found this while reviewing a PR. We should switch over the state and get the string from the app context.

report.summary: FluxC: Trashing comment doesn't show it in Trashed for a while
report.label: bug
report.description: I don't know if this is an integration issue or a FluxC one, but I thought it's better to open it here. When I trash a comment and switch to "Trashed" filter, the comment doesn't show up there. It does an auto-fetch due to changing the filters, but it doesn't show up after the fetch either. Most likely that's because the comment trash request is not yet completed, or it's a caching issue. I'd expect for us to change the status of a comment to "Trashed" when this happens, at least after the trashing request is completed and throw an event, so the list is updated.

report.summary: Both the title and content fields do not auto-capitalize the first letter
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected When inputing text into the editor, I expect the first letter to be capitalized. Observed The text isn't capitalized Reproduced Open the editor Type a word in both the Title and Content field Tested Nexus 6P on 7.1.2 with alpha-35 Note Copied from wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Aztec-Android#266.

report.summary: Changes to image settings aren't saved
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected I expect to be able to tap on an image to edit its image settings, and have those changes reflected in the post. Observed I can tap on an image to open its settings, but any changes I make there are lost. Reproduced Create a new post. Add an image. Tap the image to open the image settings. Make a change to the image (e.g. add a caption, change the alignment). Tap "Save" to save the changes. Check the HTML and note that the changes don't appear there. Tap again to open the image settings and note that the changes don't appear there. Tested Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-35 Moto G (3rd Gen), Android 6.0, WPAndroid alpha-36 Note Copied from wordpress-mobile/WordPress-Aztec-Android#263.

report.summary: Country Flags Missing in Apps Stats
report.label: bug
report.description: The Australian and Serbian flags don't show up in the app stats. This might eventually be fixed by using flag emojis, instead of images, as mentioned in #5206. But that issue's priority is low, so I'm creating this one, as well. WordPress – 6.6 HUAWEI RIO-L02 android – 5.1 English

report.summary: Do not send GCM tokens for logged-out users or self-hosted ones
report.label: bug
report.description: It seems that we're always sending the GCM token to our backend. Logged out, and self-hosted users should not send the GCM token to our backend. Seen in alpha-36 and FluxC integration branch. This should be fixed in develop.

report.summary: FluxC: Sitepicker, back from "show/hide sites" doesn't reset the view
report.label: bug
report.description: Hidden sites stay in the list, see https://cldup.com/uI3GXFyyfOu/Vt2jYT.m4v

report.summary: Stats are using UTC time
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior Stats should use the blog's timezone setting. Actual behavior It's using UTC time (not even device's time). I bet the blog's timezone setting returned from the blog object is incorrectly set to UTC. Tested on: alpha-37 on a 3gen Moto G (Android 6.0), alpha-38, Nexus 6 with stock 7.1 alpha-37 or -38, Nexus 5x, Android 7.1.1 (stock)

report.summary: Posts: Unauthenticated webview when viewing a post from the posts list
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior I expect to get an authenticated webview when I select "View" on a published or draft post in the posts list. Actual behavior The webview is not authenticated, so viewing a published post bumps the stats and viewing a draft leads to a 404 error. h/t Davor for reporting this issue in the alpha version. cc @maxme — possibly due to FluxC changes? Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the Blog Posts section for a site. Find a draft (marked "Draft" - not a local draft) in the posts list. Tap "View" on the post's card. Result: 404 error. Find a published post in the posts list. Tap "View" on the post's card. Result: The post loads but with a logged-out view, so the view is counted in the site's stats. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-38

report.summary: Under certain circumstances, "Migration Error: No network" can show up after app update
report.label: bug
report.description: From a beta tester: After updating the android WordPress app to the 7.0-rc1 release on a Nexus 5X device (unfortunately I don’t remember the previous version id), I started viewing the following error “Migration process failed: try launching the app when you have a network connection.” every time I unlocked the screen, even with a working 4g/wifi connection. I initially thought this was an android issue and I even restarted the phone but it didn’t make a difference. After failing to find issues related to the error message above, I started looking at what Apps were last updated until I got a positive match on the WordPress-Android source code. Opening the WP app fixed the issue. I guess it’d be good to only show the modal when the WP app is active? Otherwise it’s not obvious from what app the message error is coming from. We might have 2 issues: Why do we show this Toast if the network is available? Shoud we move migration to WPLaunchActivity? (Can we do it?)

report.summary: Emoji support in Post List
report.label: bug

report.summary: Media - cannot upload videos - 7.0-rc3
report.label: bug
report.description: It seems that I cannot upload any video on 7.0-rc3. cc @aforcier

report.summary: Media Library - The "state" of items seems to be inconsistent
report.label: bug
report.description: I was testing uploading in the Media Library and found out a couple of issues that I think are all related each other. So i'm opening this single issue, but feel free to decouple, if they're different issues. Issue 1 (Video here: https://cloudup.com/cbfyyY7d-4l ) Not sure how, but I found myself with 2 items in the "Uploading" state in the library. Only one should be in the uploading state, and the other one should be in the "Queued" state. Adding a new item to the queue switches the status of the 3 new items to "Queued" and the spinning is running on the top of the text. Issue 2 (Video here: https://cloudup.com/cCKVhkgeRl7 ) Starting from an incoherent state where all the 3 items are in the "Queued" state. PTR and the state issue seems to be fixed. Again, not sure why there is the spinner running in the Queued state though. Single click on the queue files does nothing, or it's hard to tap on the correct area to open the details screen. Long clicked, selected an item in the Queued state, and selected Delete. All the 3 items disappeared from the screen. When I did PTR the one in the uploading state reappeared on the library. Issue 3 (Video here: https://cloudup.com/chaZh-1rFwl ) Long click are enabled on the items in "Uploading" state. It should not be enabled I think. Only the single tap to stop the uploading should be available. (Open to suggestions on this). cc @nbradbury

report.summary: Non-draft posts get saved online on back-press
report.label: bug

This can create undesired behavior for scheduled posts, for example, which should not be automatically modified online. report.summary: Jetpack-connected site - username wiped in login screen if 2FA activated
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When in a 2FA activated account, and trying to log in to a jetpack-connected site and switching to the Authenticator app to get the 2FA code, username should be kept if already entered. Actual behavior When I switch from the WPAndroid app to the Authenticator app to get the code, then back to the WPAndroid app, the username field is emptied, and thus the login button is greyed, and I spent 5-6 seconds trying to figure why I couldn't log in until I realised the username field is getting wiped Steps to reproduce the behavior make sure you activate 2FA on your wordpress.com account Login to the wp android app by adding a jetpack connected site when the wp.com credentials are requested, and the field for entering the verification code is shown, switch to another app (i.e. to the Authenticator app to get the new code) switch back to WPAndroid to see the username field is wiped out. Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.1]

report.summary: Post with multiple images shows only placeholders
report.label: bug
report.description: Reproducing Start a new post Add 5+ images to it Wait for the upload to finish Switch to HTML mode Switch back to visual Notice the images are not loaded, just placeholders

report.summary: The post title has wrong font
report.label: bug
report.description: The font of the title is different than the post content's.

report.summary: Empty post is auto-saved when user leaves editor
report.label: bug
report.description: The new draft auto-save feature, combined with this bug causes empty posts to be auto-saved when user leaves the editor with a back button.

report.summary: Text copy/pasted from content to title includes "aztec_cursor"
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Type some text in the post content area Copy a word Paste it in the title area Notice the title starts with "aztec_cursor"

report.summary: Media in local device media store aren't added to editor
report.label: bug
report.description: It looks like a change here has caused the appendMediaFile() call to be skipped for media already in the local media store (URL starts with content://media), which means those media aren't added to the editor (but are uploaded to the site anyway). Steps to reproduce the behavior When launching the native media picker, select media from a source that will provide a content://media URL (local media store). One example is the Gallery app in older stock Android. For example, in a 5.0.0 Genymotion emulator: Any media added from the 'Gallery' source should upload, but won't be added to the editor.
