report.summary: Editor: with Aztec enabled, can't add a link with visual editor
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior Copy a URL on my phone's clipboard, open a post, edit it, and highlight a word. Then click an editor toolbar icon for "Add Link" — which opens a dialog to paste in the URL, creating a hyperlink. Here's what it looks like with the Visual editor enabled. Actual behavior There's no link or button for adding a link when I enable the Aztec editor. Tested on [device], Android [version] Nexus 6P, WordPress for Android alpha-48.

report.summary: Use Aztec v0.5.0-alpha.5 in 7.2
report.label: bug
report.description: This change is in the latest alpha but not in the release/7.2 branch, and it's needed to fix a crash when inserting media in Aztec (among other fixes).

report.summary: Fix with_images/with_videos property tracking
report.label: bug
report.description: It looks like we haven't been setting the with_images and with_videos properties of the editor_post_published event for posts with media for any editor other than legacy. Those properties are set to true here if an uploading post has media, but that routine is only triggered for local media - which never exist at the post upload stage for the (hybrid) visual editor or for Aztec (media are already uploaded and converted to remote URLs before a post can be uploaded using those editors). cc @daniloercoli

report.summary: Changes in HTML mode not saved
report.label: bug
report.description: Reproducing Type something in the visual mode Switch to HTML mode Change the text Tap back to exit the editor (without switching to the visual mode) Open the post again Notice the changes made in HTML mode are lost

report.summary: OkHttp "Unexpected end of stream" uploading image
report.label: bug
report.description: Customer reports an "unexpected end of stream" error when uploading images. This issue in Square's repo may help with the fix.

report.summary: SignInActivity can be pushed twice to the stack
report.label: bug
report.description: On sign out, it can be pushed once here and a second time there when we remove the sites. This creates weird behavior when the user sign out and then sign in or create a new account.

report.summary: New media picker: Rotating in WP media library exits the picker
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Launch the new picker Select the W to open the WP media library Rotate the device Picker exits and returns to editor, and "An error occurred when accessing this blog" toast is displayed Tested on Pixel, Android 7.1.2

report.summary: Notifications: Loses place in notifications after leaving/returning to the app
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior I expect that if I am swiping through my notifications, leave the app, and then return to the app, I will return to the same notification where I left off. Actual behavior If I am swiping through my notifications, leave the app, and then return to the app, I see the notification where I left off for a moment and then the screen refreshes. The refresh takes me back to the first notification I viewed. h/t @catehstn for spotting this issue. Steps to reproduce the behavior Open your notifications. Tap to open a notification detail. Swipe through several notifications. Leave the app. Return to the app and wait a few seconds. Result: The screen refreshes and the first notification detail appears. (You can also see this refresh occur if you only opened one notification, but in that case nothing will change since you haven't swiped away from it.) Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-49.

report.summary: Use unmapped URL where an authenticated WP.com WebView is needed
report.label: bug
report.description: The SiteModel.getUnmappedUrl() method can be used to get around the server-side issue that causes custom WordPress.com domains to load unauthenticated in the WebView. Probably anything using WPWebViewActivity.openUrlByUsingGlobalWPCOMCredentials() can be updated to use the unmapped URL if available (maybe we can refactor the method itself). See #5715 for a usage example and #5326 for some background.

report.summary: Media Detail Screen: small pictures are not centered in the view
report.label: bug
report.description: They jump to the center of the screen as soon as you tap them. https://cloudup.com/cEfj3nu1vpX

report.summary: Media Detail Screen: landscape pictures are cropped and not scrollable horizontally
report.label: bug
report.description: See https://cloudup.com/c1MZNPgNaik I guess this can be fixed along with #5739 - just wanted to report both issues.

report.summary: 7.2: Missing title and part of the content - New post in the (old) visual editor
report.label: bug
report.description: It seems there are "content loss" issues in the old visual editor, writing a new post or modifying an existing one. New post Title is missing and part of the body is also missing: https://cloudup.com/c5m5vFU83Sg Edit post Can't add new content to the body: https://cloudup.com/cH7FQt1IrzM (Sorry for the long video, in which I repeat the same action 3 or 4 times). Tested on Android 5.X

report.summary: Jetpack users logging in via their self hosted credentials get asked to sign in again
report.label: bug
report.description: Some self-hosted users with Android 7.1 are reporting that they are unable to use their sites in the app. They describe the issue like this: They add their self-hosted site to the app. The login is successful. They close the app. They reopen the app and are presented with the login screen again. When they try to log in again, they get a duplicate site error (“that site already exists in the app”). I can reproduce the issue if I log in to my Jetpack-connected site as a regular self-hosted site, without logging in to WordPress.com. (Non-Jetpack self-hosted sites work as expected, based on my testing.) Another case: the user is logged in to a different WordPress.com account in the app (not the account linked to the Jetpack site), and they are having the same problem.

report.summary: Self hosted site removal not removing completely
report.label: bug
report.description: As reported by @designsimply - might be related to #5755 Expected behavior Removing a self hosted site should never show it again. Actual behavior Removing a self hosted site, logging out and back in shows the site again. Steps to reproduce the behavior I was able to remove a self-hosted site, but if I log out and log back in then the site is there again. Steps to reproduce: Log in to an account with a self-hosted site. Tap the W icon. Long-press on a self-hosted site. Tap “Yes” when prompted with “Remove this site from the app?” Confirm that the site was removed. Log out. Log back in. Look for the site that was previously removed. Result: after removing a self-hosted site and logging out and back in again, I can still see the site listed in the site picker. Tested on [device], Android [version]

report.summary: New photo picker doesn't show images uploaded to WP Media Library from Google Drive
report.label: bug
report.description: Originally reported by @designsimply Expected behavior Uploading an image to the media library should also show in the image picker within the editor. Actual behavior Images uploaded from google drive to the media library do not show up in the image picker within the editor. Steps to reproduce the behavior Go to Media > + > Select a photo from gallery. Tap the hamburger icon at top left and select a Google Drive account with an image in it. Select an image to upload. Verify the image was uploaded to the media library. Start a new post. Tap into the content area. Tap the add media icon. Look for the image that was just added. Result: the image uploaded to Media from Google Drive wasn’t available in the photo picker in the Editor. Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2] cc @nbradbury

report.summary: Settings: Empty "Advanced" section appears for self-hosted sites
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior I don't expect to see an "Advanced" section in the settings for self-hosted (non-Jetpack) sites, since there's nothing to show there. Actual behavior The section "Advanced" appears in settings with nothing underneath it. Screenshot Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-50

report.description: Expected behavior The promo dialog should look good Actual behavior The promo dialog takes all the screen on pre-lollipop, and is too dark for latest OS versions. report.summary: Site Details: Configuration section and Settings option missing for self-hosted site connected to Jetpack
report.label: bug
report.description: To reproduce: Scenario 1 Be signed out of the app. Use the self-hosted login form to add a self-hosted site that is connected to Jetpack. When the Site Details screen appears notice that the Configuration section and Settings option are both present. Wait a moment and rotate your device. Notice that these options have now vanished. Scenario 2 Go to your blog's wp-admin and disconnect Jetpack. Return to the app and let the updated site data sync (tap back to the site picker and then back to site details). Wait a moment and rotate the device. Notice that the Configuration section and Settings option have returned. Scenario 3 Remove the site from the app (as you can do that now). Log in again repeating the steps in Scenario 1. Notice that the Configuration section and Settings option are always present. Scenario 4 Go back to your wp-admin and reconnect Jetpack Repeat the steps in Scenario 2 Notice that the Configuration section and Settings options vanish.

report.summary: Removing the last self-hosted site doesn't show the sign-in screen
report.label: bug
report.description: I was logged in with a .com site and I had a self-hosted site added, I logged out of .com and removed my self-hosted site expecting to get the sign-in screen which didn't happen.

report.summary: 'Ghost' sites appear when logging out while fetching sites
report.label: bug
report.description: It's possible to time a sign out from WordPress.com while sites are being fetched. This can cause the fetched sites to be saved to the database right after they were cleared from the logout. The sites will appear in the site list, and can be selected. Any network requests (opening the post list, for example) to those sites will fail, as there's no token present anymore. The only way to remove the sites is to sign back in as a different account (or clear app data). The fix is mostly FluxC-side (wordpress-mobile/WordPress-FluxC-Android#433), but it looks like it will also require a few changes in WPAndroid (we'll need to have the account fetched before we call FETCH_SITES). Steps to reproduce the behavior Sign in to a self-hosted site and a WordPress.com account (the self-hosted site isn't necessary for the bug to occur, but it's the only way to observe the bug from the UI) When 15 minutes have passed since the last site fetch, resume the app from the background Resume the app and immediately sign out of WordPress.com With enough sites, or on a slow enough connection, you should end up seeing some of your WordPress.com sites still in the site list

report.summary: Not able to login to self hosted site account
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When the "Login" button is clicked after providing credentials (i.e. mail id, password and site address), app shall proceed to login as the self hosted site is already added in the app. Actual behavior Instead of logging in to the self hosted account, the app tries to add the self hosted site to the app and returns an error message "This site already exist in the app, you can't add it" When the site already exist in the app, it shall login on supplying valid credentials. Steps to reproduce the behavior Start Wordpress app. (Self hosted site account already added to the app during previous invocation of the app) Enter email ID and click "Next" Enter password and click "Log in" Wait for login to succeed Wordpress app flashes error message "This site already exist in the app, you can't add it" and fails to login to self hosted site Tested on [device], Android [version] OnePlus One.

report.summary: View Scrolls to Cursor When Uploading Image Below Scroll Position
report.label: bug
report.description: Note This is a companion to the identically-named library issue (wordpress-mobile/AztecEditor-Android#342). Since the changes are required in the app rather than the library, an issue must be created in this repository. This cannot be completely tested until the image loading changes in the library (wordpress-mobile/AztecEditor-Android#340) are released. Expected View remains at scrolled position when uploading images. Observed View scrolls to the cursor position when uploading images below scroll position, but remains at scrolled position when uploading images above. See the animation below for example. Reproduced Place cursor near bottom of view. Tap Media format button. Choose image to insert. Scroll to top of view. Notice view is scrolled to cursor. Place cursor near top of view. Tap Media format button. Choose image to insert. Scroll to bottom of view. Notice view does not scroll to cursor. Tested Google Pixel on Android 7.1.2 with WordPress alpha-57

report.summary: Image thumbnails for uploads aren't generated in Aztec
report.label: bug
report.description: Inserting a local image (at least from some content sources) in Aztec fails to generate a thumbnail, displaying a placeholder and an error toast: The upload proceeds normally, and closing+re-opening the post (or switching to HTML mode and back) after the upload completes will show the image correctly. It looks like this call is returning a null bitmap. This is due to MediaUtils.getRealPathFromURI returning a null path. This looks to have been introduced in #5857 (ImageUtils and MediaUtils were refactored). cc @daniloercoli Steps to reproduce the behavior In Aztec, add an image Tested on Pixel, Android 7.1.2, alpha-58

report.summary: Legacy editor - can't post with media
report.label: bug
report.description: Legacy editor - upload fails when media are available in post content. It seems that processPostMedia fails here. Basically MediaStore.getPostMediaWithPath(mPost.getId(), imageUri) does return null.

report.summary: Cancelled media uploads from editor remain in Media Library
report.label: bug
report.description: When canceling a media upload from the editor (Aztec or visual), it's correctly removed the post and the network request is cancelled, but the media item continues to show up in the media library. There's no obvious way to remove it (it can be done by long-pressing until a trash icon appears in the action bar) - but it shouldn't appear in the first place.

report.summary: Don't force landscape orientation when viewing videos in Media Library
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior To be able to choose the orientation of my device Actual behavior When opening a video in the Media Library the device orientation is forced to landscape. This is especially awkward if the video was recorded in portrait, where the video playback itself is forced to the far left of the screen. Steps to reproduce the behavior Navigate to Site -> Media Open a video Tested on Nexus 6P, Android O (beta build OPP2.170420.019), wp-android alpha-58

report.summary: Unable to sign in to 2FA accounts under some circumstances
report.label: bug
report.description: After signing out of WordPress.com, signing back into a 2FA account leaves you stuck in an endless sign in loop. After inserting your username and password, instead of the 2FA code prompt showing up you get this: The same thing happens if the wrong credentials are entered - the error messages are displayed briefly and then you're sent back to a screen with just the username field. It looks like the problem might be that WPMainActivity also receives the OnAuthenticationChanged event with error (NEEDS_2FA, or another sign-in error), which ends up launching a new SignInActivity with the 'Log in again to continue' message. (On a clean install, or if the app is stopped after sign out, WPMainActivity is not yet running, so this bug doesn't happen.) Steps to reproduce the behavior Sign into a WordPress.com account (2fa or not does not matter) Sign out of WordPress.com 3a. Attempt to sign into a WordPress.com account with 2fa (using username + password) 3b. Alternatively, enter an invalid username/password and attempt to sign in Reported by @elibud. Tested on Pixel, Android 7.1.2, WordPress 7.4

report.summary: Two instances of SitePickerActivity when removing a site
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior After removing a site via the Site Picker I should either return to the picker or the main activity. Actual behavior When the site is removed another Site Picker activity slides in on top of the existing one. Both instances must be closed to return to the main activity. Steps to reproduce the behavior Add a self-hosted site Long press on it in the site picker and remove it Tested on Genymotion, Android 4.1.1 (API 16)

report.summary: Default selected website after logging in
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior After I log in I expect my default site to be selected. Actual behavior The site displayed initially is my sandbox (self hosted + Jetpacked linked to my account), which I almost never use, I have no idea why. Steps to reproduce the behavior Log in to your account and then check to which site you are redirected. If it works correctly for you, ping me and we can troubleshoot together.

report.summary: Can't insert images to the legacy editor
report.label: bug
report.description: After the recent changes to the media selection, it looks like when you add an image to a post in legacy editor, it just shows a placeholder image. We got some reports about this through Helpshift.

report.summary: Can't complete the process to add a self hosted site
report.label: bug
report.description: After adding a self hosted site I get a screen with a list of my added site and a done button. The done button does nothing. Demo video: https://cloudup.com/cqojTNnCj0q Note: If I kill the app and restart it, my self hosted site is accessible from the picker.

report.summary: Wrong image URL
report.label: bug
report.description: Adding an image and then exiting the editor during the upload saves the local storage path as URL, which is incorrect.

report.summary: Share to WordPress Dialog can load with no default
report.label: bug
report.description: Under some circumstances, it's possible for the revamped share dialog to load with no pre-selected option: It looks like the cause is that we're using the resource ID stored in preferences to remember the user's choice, but resource IDs can change between different builds. Steps to reproduce the behavior Install a clean beta or release build of the app (I used 7.5 release) Share a photo to the app Notice "New post" is pre-selected Complete the share, adding the photo to either a new post or the media library Without uninstalling or clearing data, install an alpha build with a higher version (I used alpha-59) Share a photo to the app Notice no option is selected, and quickly tapping Share shows a toast 'Unrecognized action requested, ignoring' cc @tonyr59h

report.summary: Post list doesn't remove featured image when returning from the editor
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When I unset a featured image and delete it from the post I expect the post list to remove the featured image thumbnail when I return to it. Actual behavior Unsetting the featured image Steps to reproduce the behavior Create a post with an image and set the featured image to that image Publish/Save/Update the post to return to the post list -> Post list item correctly shows image Edit the post, removing the image from the body and unsetting the featured image Update the post -> Post list item still shows featured image Note: If the list is refreshed or the user exits and returns to the list it will correctly display no featured image. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.0, alpha-59

report.summary: Losing connectivity while post is uploading leaves it in uploading state forever
report.label: bug
report.description: Coming from #5880 (comment) Expected behavior Exiting the editor while media in it is uploading, then losing connectivity should not leave the post in "uploading" mode forever. Actual behavior Turning airplane mode ON after exiting the Editor leaves the post list with the new post with the spinning wheel forever, see video here https://cloudup.com/ct3G73l8-Hd Steps to reproduce the behavior Create or edit a post, and add media While media are uploading, exit the Editor The post should be in 'Uploading' state in the post list Turn airplane mode ON wait a bit and turn it back on You won't be able to re-open the post, as it stays in "uploading" mode ever since having exited the editor Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.2.1]

report.summary: Pages section loads Posts instead of Pages
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When accessing the Pages section, Pages should be shown. Actual behavior When accessing the Pages section, Posts are shown instead. Steps to reproduce the behavior Tap My Site. Tap Pages. The message Fetching posts will be displayed. Then the list of Blog Posts will appear instead of Pages. Tested on SM-G935P, Android 7.0

report.summary: Share to WordPress can break after app upgrade
report.label: bug
report.description: Once a user has shared to the WordPress app before, updating to the latest version breaks it. I believe this is because we should clear the existing stored pref wp-settings-share-last-used-image-addto once on app update, to clear away any saved value using a resource id instead of an int constant. (ref #6025) Steps to reproduce the behavior Install a clean alpha-59 Share a photo to the app, and complete the action Install alpha-60 Share a photo to the app again Notice that a selection is made, but pressing the 'Share' button shows a toast 'Unrecognized action requested, ignoring' Tested on Pixel, Android 7.1.2 cc @tonyr59h

report.summary: Saving an empty draft shows error
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior You should be able to start a draft, change the status from "Publish" to "Draft" and hit Save. Actual behavior Saving an empty draft where the only change made was to change the status to draft. A message saying “Can’t publish an empty post” is shown, regardless of whether the publish date is Now or in the future. It does get saved as a “Local Draft”, though. When I add a tag it saves just fine. Steps to reproduce the behavior Start a new draft Tap on the settings wheel on the upper-right corner of the screen change the Status from Publish to Draft Tap on SAVE (upper right corner of the screen) the toast Can’t publish an empty post is shown Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2]

report.summary: Not able to edit an image in a post - Visual Editor
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior Tapping on a image on the Visual Editor should allow to edit the image settings (name, etc). Actual behavior If you insert an image from the native photo picker, tap Edit, and nothing happens. Steps to reproduce the behavior Start drafting a new post Add an image by tapping on the media icon Once the image finishes uploading, tap on it. The "Edit" overlay is shown Tap on "Edit" and nothing happens. Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.2.1]

report.summary: In-app language settings not sticking for some languages
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior Have the app interface displayed in the chosen in-app language setting. Actual behavior The chosen language settings sticks for some languages, but not others. Issues encountered for these languages: Hebrew, Chinese (zh-hk, zh-cn, or zh-tw). Steps to reproduce the behavior Device language setting: English (US) 1- App Settings > Interface Language, choose a language like Hebrew, Chinese (zh-hk, zh-cn, or zh-tw), the dashboard then shows in the chosen language. 2- Close the app 3- Open it again, the dashboard has reverted to English (US) Tested on [device], Android [version] Samsung S7 Edge, Android 7.0

report.summary: Not able to edit an image in a post - Aztec
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior Tapping on a image on the Aztec Editor should allow to edit the image settings (name, etc). Actual behavior If you insert an image from the native photo picker, tap Edit, and nothing happens. Steps to reproduce the behavior Start drafting a new post Add an image by tapping on the media icon Once the image finishes uploading, tap on it. Nothing happens. Tested on [ Samsung Galaxy S7 Edge Duos], Android [7.0], 7.6-rc-2 Please note this is a sister issue with #6049, but observed in Aztec. Also note I haven't been able to reproduce this on the following handsets: Google Pixel, Android 7.1.1 emulator: Samsung Galaxy S3, Android 4.2.2

report.summary: .org: New Posts are always posted Pending Review
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When I create a new post and submit it, it should be submitted as "Published". Also, when I modify a post status to "Published" this should be reflected. Actual behavior New posts and modified post statuses are published as "Pending Review". The only way to get a post into the "Published" state is to use the "Publish" function on the posts listing screen after tapping on "More". Steps to reproduce the behavior Create a new post, add a headline and use the "Submit" button in the header (note that on WordPress.com and Jetpack blogs this is a "Publish" button). Tested on Xperia X Compact, Android 7.0, WordPress alpha-60 This is on a WordPress 4.8 install without Jetpack.

report.summary: Users unable to log in (site already exists error)
report.label: bug
report.description:
User opens the app User has a pure self hosted site in the app http://prologoepilogoaccion.com/xmlrpc.php, but username or password is incorrect (I guess he changed his password on his site) (see line 19 of the logs: Nombre de usuario o contraseña incorrecta.) FluxC returns AUTHENTICATE_ERROR The app shows an “incorrect password” dialog (ie. self hosted sign in screen). (line 21) User fills the sign in screen and tap “sign in”. (line 44) FluxC tries to add the “new” site, but it’s already in there so return a DUPLICATE_SITE (line 61) The temporary solution to clear local data of the app (or uninstall/reinstall). report.summary: Upload notification says "Post Published" for drafts
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When you start a draft and start uploading media, leaving it in the background, and the process finishes (media is finished uploading and post is finished being updated) the notification should read "Post updated" Actual behavior We’re using Post published in the success notification, even when the post actually is just a draft NOTE: only applicable to feature/async-media branch Steps to reproduce the behavior start a new draft include one or 2 pictures in it exit the editor as the pictures are being uploaded asyncrhonously when the process ends, the Post published notification is shown. Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2]

report.summary: Visual editor toolbar icons appear squashed
report.label: bug
report.description: For certain screen sizes, the last icon in the visual editor toolbar can appear squashed: This is due to the sizing changes here, which were intended for Aztec but also affect the visual editor as the dimensions and resources are shared. The visual editor has several layouts for different screen sizes, which rely on the total width of the toolbar icons, and the increase to 48dp threw those off. The simplest fix is to add the old icons back with different naming, use those in the visual editor, and delete them when Aztec replaces the visual editor. Tested on Samsung Galaxy S3, Android 4.2.2

report.summary: Media upload: connectivity loss leaves upload in inconsistent state
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior Part 1: If you start uploading an image in a Post, and you lose connectivity (for instance, by turning airplane mode ON), the upload should be marked FAILED so the user can retry uploading at a later time when connectivity is regained. Part 2: Then also the user should be allowed to start any other uploads on that same or any other posts. Actual behavior Part 1: The upload gets stuck there after losing connectivity, when the actual upload should FAIL (happens for both Aztec and Visual editors, I believe this is a FluxC thing to take care of, but should be investigated deeply) Part 2: if you try and upload one image, then turn airplane mode ON, exit, turn airplane mode off, start another different new draft, attempt to insert a new image -> the image shows a small progress on the screen but never really uploads anything and doesn’t notify the user about it, the logs show this: 06-26 15:05:07.556 30900-30900/org.wordpress.android.beta I/WordPress-MEDIA: Ignoring request to uploadNextInQueue, only one media item can be uploaded at a time. There’s no way to recover from this unless stopping / restarting the app. Steps to reproduce the behavior Part 1: start an upload, let it progress a bit, turn airplane mode ON Observe it gets stuck there Part 2: After completing steps 1-4: 5. start a new draft 6. try inserting an image using the media picker 7. watch it have an initial progress and get stuck there forever. Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2]

report.summary: Jetpack: Some Site Settings should be hidden on Jetpack Sites
report.label: bug
report.description: For instance the "Language" setting doesn't exist on Jetpack sites (see Calypso site settings).

report.summary: Media: race condition when uploading 2 posts with media
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce use branch feature/async-media make 2 posts, include media in each, exiting the editor while it is still uploading media. once the first post finishes with ERROR (make the POST upload fail), and the PostUploadService wants to get the next one to upload, it’s still gotten pending media uploading, so the PostUploadService exits, and this second post is never actually even attempted to be sent. Also, the notification remains in the "Uploading media…" state.

report.summary: Media async: adjust cancelled uploads when coming back to Aztec
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior If an upload is in progress and you exit the editor (Aztec), then the media upload fails, then get back into the editor, the image should be shown/marked as available for retry (i.e. marked failed) Actual behavior The image is shown as being still in upload progress, which is incorrect. Steps to reproduce the behavior on branch feature/async-media open a new draft include an image to upload while it's uploading, exit the editor make the image upload fail (i.e. turn airplane mode on) get back to the editor see the image is shown as "still uploading" Proposed solutions We considered 2 options: either the AztecEditorFragment is in charge of this, and when it opens up again, we should check if there’s any canceled images and mark them properly, or when the MediaUploadService service is done with something and ends in error, we can do the same as we were doing for the success case: go ahead and call a static method in AztecEditorFragment that properly replaces the class properties for error ones The PR tackling this, if not otherwise noted, should go with option number 2 Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2]

report.summary: Media: improve upload notification messages
report.label: bug
report.description: Originally coming from this comment by @aforcier The notification when the upload completes has the wrong message in some cases. We don't get 'Draft uploaded' messages when a post is saved as a remote draft. I think this is because we shouldn't run this check if the post is a DRAFT, as mIsFirstTimePublish == false always for remote drafts. We're not flagging first time publishing (and thus also not tracking analytics) at all when uploading from the post list - we should do a check here and use PostUploadService.addPostToUploadAndTrackAnalytics() instead where applicable

report.summary: Wrong gravatar is shown in Notifications Likes screen
report.label: bug
report.description: We got a report that when the Notifications Likes screen is initially loaded a gravatar was shown for 2 subsequent users (first and second in a list of 3) and browsing around a bit fixed the issue.

report.summary: Login - tapping back on "Add Self-hosted site" screen clears fields and dismisses screen
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior In the login screen (first screen of the app): entering email, then tapping Add self-hosted site, then tapping back shouldn't dismiss the screen completely and then also clear the email field, but rather bring the previous state of the screen back. Actual behavior When tapping the back button while on the "Add self-hosted site" screen, the app is dismissed, and bringing it up from the recent apps list shows the fields are all cleared up. Steps to reproduce the behavior start the app start typing your email accidentally tap on “Add self-hosted site”, when what you really wanted to do is tap “NEXT” tap back the app is just plainly dismissed, and when you look for it with the recent apps button and bring it up to the foreground again, the email field is cleared now (you have to enter it again). Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2]

report.summary: SignIn: On email check network error, wrong screen is shown
report.label: bug
report.description: In case of a network error during the IsAvailableEmail action, we show the "A magic link email has been sent" screen while the email can be wrong. In the handleEmailAvailabilityEvent() method, we should check if the event.isError(), and only if it's not we can call the mListener.onMagicLinkRequestSuccess().

report.summary: Async media: PUBLISH does not work after entering post twice while uploading media
report.label: bug
report.description: first reported by @aforcier 🙇 Expected behavior Tapping PUBLISH in the Editor should make sure that the post gets published after all related media uploads finish, including the Post upload, no matter if you exit the editor or keep doing something else (async). Actual behavior If you tap on PUBLISH in the editor while media is being uploaded, and do nothing else, it works. If you otherwise hit PUBLISH but then get back into editing that post while still some media upload is in progress, then tap BACK (either navigation bar arrow or Android back button), the Post finishes uploading as a draft instead. Steps to reproduce the behavior start a new post add media (several items as we need to keep media uploads going to perform the test) hit publish while media uploading, open post in the editor again exit editor using back button repeat steps 4 and 5 once more (for all of this, media has still got to be uploading) post is saved as a local draft instead of saved as a remote draft. Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.2.1]

report.summary: Opening/closing the editor produces Post to be updated
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior Editing a Post and leaving it unchanged should just leave it as it was. Actual behavior We trigger ‘local changes’ when just opening and closing the editor Steps to reproduce the behavior enter a post that has images in it just exit the editor without modifying anything the post is sent online Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2]

report.summary: Adding a Jetpack blog to reader
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps: open the android app. go to reader section, click settings, and navigate to followed sites. introduce nosolosoftware.com in the text field at the bottom and click the follow button. The expected behavior is that the subscription was successful, but I've got a "this blog could not be found" error instead (I have a video I could share, but GitHub doesn't support videos yet). The same steps for a WordPress.com blog worked. Adding the same Jetpack blog from Calypso worked as well. Android version: alpha-64.

report.summary: Aztec video upload: thumbnails lost when leaving editor
report.label: bug
report.description: comes from #6358 (comment) Expected behavior Starting a video upload should show a thumbnail of it representing the object, no matter whether we leave the editor and come back, it should still be there. Actual behavior When I start a video upload either from the storage or from the Camera, it shows the thumbnail OK Exiting the editor and coming back again doesn’t show the preview thumbnail as it was shown when I first included the video in the Post. Instead it shows the aztec image placeholder with the retry/failed overlay, or the play video overlay if it succeeded. The same happens if I let the video upload completely without leaving the editor, then coming back to the editor shows no video thumbnail. Steps to reproduce the behavior CASE A: start a new draft in Aztec include a video wait until it finishes uploading exit the editor open the post again see the Aztec placeholder with the video play overlay instead of a thumbnail with the video play overlay. CASE B: start a new draft in Aztec include a video while it's uploading, exit the editor open the post again see the Aztec placeholder with the retry/failed overlay instead of a thumbnail with the retry/failed overlay. Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2]

report.summary: Post list: video uploads show [video] or [wpvideo] tags
report.label: bug
report.description: comes from #6358 (comment) Expected behavior Post list items should not show technical tags - either just display visual content in a visual way (i.e. thumbnails) or text content. Actual behavior The Post list shows the [video] tag when the post is finished uploading in Aztec as of #6358, or the [wpvideo] tag in the Visual Editor. Also if there are no images in the post but a video is in there, it seems to me the post item resizes itself as if it were to hold a featured image, but it shows a blank space instead Steps to reproduce the behavior CASE A: Aztec start a new draft include a video once the video uploads, or even before it finishes, go back to the Posts list. it shows the [video] tag: if the Post has a successfully uploaded video, the full tag is displayed in the post list CASE B: Visual Editor start a new draft include a video once the video uploads, or even before it finishes, go back to the Posts list. it shows the [wpvideo] tag: Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2]

report.summary: Reader: certain posts with an image don't show the image
report.label: bug
report.description: Similar to wordpress-mobile/WordPress-iOS#7613 but for Android app. Expected behavior When viewing Reader I'd expect to see a photo in the post preview card when the post in question contains an image. Actual behavior Just the title shows, no image. This seems to be related to posts made with the native app Aztec editor only — posts published with visual editor, or Calypso web editor appear as expected. Steps to reproduce the behavior Reader, look at a site like lance.blog or photo.cate.blog View the posts list for a post you've published with an image, via Aztec editors. You'll see some posts missing an image. Tested on Nexus 6P, Android app alpha-66 Possibly related to this Calypso Reader issue: Automattic/wp-calypso#12609

report.summary: At the end of the login flow, "Continue" button is not working when "Don't keep activities" is enabled
report.label: bug
report.description: At the end of the login flow, button "Continue" is not working when "Don't keep activities" is enabled. See demo video.

report.summary: New login flow: notification service not started in certain cases
report.label: bug
report.description: There is a missing call to NotificationsUpdateService.startService in the following method: LoginUsernamePasswordFragment.onSiteChanged. I had a quick look at other flows, and I think this is the only missing one.

report.summary: Smart Lock covering New Editor Promo Dialog
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When logging in and shown the New Editor promo dialog, I should be able to dismiss one popup and then continue reading the other one that was left behind. Actual behavior Tapping on the grey area of the screen dismisses both popups, so I can't really read the New Editor promo dialog. Steps to reproduce the behavior tried logging in to the app (I have 2FA enabled). so entered email, hit continue, then entered password when given the option to use magic links, then the 2fa field appeared, entered the code, and it was logged in. the “try the new editor” promo dialog came up the smart lock popup came up right afterwards tapping on the grey area of the screen made BOTH go away, so I couldn’t read the promo dialog Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2]

report.summary: Login Rework: empty sites list in epilogue when magiclink login
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When logging in via magic link, the epilogue sites list should have the sites available on the wpcom account that just logged in. Actual behavior The epilogue sites list is empty. This is a regression caused by #6354 (comment) Steps to reproduce the behavior Clear the app data and login to your wpcom via magic link. At the end of the process, the epilogue screen will have no sites listed.

report.summary: Login Rework: first tap on Log In fails if Play Services are missing
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior on an emulator without Play Services installed, clear the app data and launch the app tap on "LOG IN". Nothing happens. tap on "LOG IN" again app goes to the email input screen. Tested on [device], Android [version] API 16 Emulator

report.summary: Login Rework: can't paste 2FA code from Authenticor app into Verification code input field
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior I expected to copy and paste text into the form field. Actual behavior I cannot seem to long-tap or otherwise pull up the paste function. Steps to reproduce the behavior Use a WP.com user account with 2FA turned on. Log out of the app. Log in. When prompted for the Authenticator verification code, try to copy and paste it into the field. Tested on [device], Android [version] Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.2, WordPress for Android app alpha-68

report.summary: Login Rework: overlapping elements in tablet landscape
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior The login prologue animations and promotional texts should be arranged side-by-side with a healthy amount of margin between them when running the app on a tablet holding it in landscape mode Actual behavior The promo text is overlapped by the animated imagery. See screenshot: Steps to reproduce the behavior With the app date cleared, run the app on a tablet and hold it in landscape mode Tested on [device], Android [version] Samsung Tab S2, Android v6.0.1

report.summary: Login Rework: re-instate the auto-paste of the 2FA code
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When a 2FA code is in the clipboard, the should pick it up and auto-fill the 2FA input field with it like it did before the Login Rework changes. Actual behavior The app doesn't auto-fill the 2FA input field. Steps to reproduce the behavior Try to log in to a wpcom account that is protected with 2FA On the 2FA input screen, switch to your Authenticator app and copy a 2FA code Return to the wpandroid app 💥 the 2FA code is not auto-pasted

report.summary: Async media: inconsistent uploading items after crash
report.label: bug
report.description: Originally reported by @daniloercoli 🙇 Expected behavior When a crash or unexpected stop happens (turn then phone off, for example) while a Post with media is being uploaded, then coming back to the Post should show the interrupted items marked as failed and able to be retried. Actual behavior These items don't show any specific mark and when tapped the "Stop uploading?" popup is displayed. Steps to reproduce the behavior start a new draft include some media items while these are uploading, stop the app (go to settings-> apps -> WordPress -> force stop) open the app again open the draft observe all media items do not show any "retry" mark. tap on any failed item and observe the "Stop uploading?" popup appears. Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2]

report.summary: Async media: upload not cancelled when media deleted in Aztec
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When you're uploading a media item (video or image) in the Editor, and you delete it, the upload should be cancelled. Actual behavior The upload continues and there's no way for you to cancel it. Steps to reproduce the behavior start a new draft on Aztec insert media item delete the item observe the "uploading media" notification is still going on, and if you exit the editor the posts list will show the progress bar as well Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [7.1.2]

report.summary: Login: magic link screen is not scrollable
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior On very small screens, the magic link screen should be scrollable as to be able to click the "I'll enter the password" link that should be at the bottom Actual behavior There's no way out, leaving the user with the only option to send the magic link, unless you rotate the screen (which looks and behaves alright). Steps to reproduce the behavior Use a very tiny screen, for instance a 240x320 emulator install the app try to login entering your wp.com username see the magic link screen appear and you can't do anything else. Tested on [LG Optimus L3 II], Android [4.1.1]

report.summary: [Multisite] Error to send new post since WP 7.9 / 7.9.1 / 8.0
report.label: bug
report.description: Tested on [device], Android [version] Android 7 and 6 Wordpress Android 7.9, 7.9.1 , 8.0 => NOK Wordpress 7.8 ==>> OK ! Error when post new article My conf : Multisite + htaccess auth

report.summary: Site Address login flow uses wrong reset password link
report.label: bug
report.description: In the flow designed for self-hosted sites, tapping the "Lost your password?" link incorrectly opens the Lost Password page on WordPress.com. Instead, it should open wp-login.php?action=lostpassword on the site address that was entered in the previous step (as it does in the new login flow on WPiOS). Steps to reproduce the behavior In the new login flow: tap "Log in to your site by entering your site address instead" enter a self-hosted site URL tap "Lost your password?" Tested on alpha-69

report.summary: Async Media: Wrong featured image appears on posts list during upload
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior If I leave the editor while uploading media, I expect to see no featured image or a featured image from that post in the posts list. Actual behavior I see a featured image from the previous post while the media is uploading. Once the media finishes uploading, the correct image appears. During upload (note the image on the top post is not in that post at all; it's from the post below it in the list): After upload finishes: Steps to reproduce the behavior Create a post with an image in it. Save/publish that post and go back to the posts list. Start a second post and add different images to it. While the media is uploading, exit the editor to go back to the posts list. Result: The image from the first post appears on the second post until the upload finishes. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-71

report.summary: Media: Lag when selecting multiple images in media picker
report.label: bug
report.description: I experience significant lag when I select multiple images in the media picker. I timed it, and after selected 15 images and tapping the checkmark, the app froze for 15 seconds before adding the images to the post content. The lag increases relative to the number of images selected, and occurs regardless of the editor (happens in both hybrid and Aztec editors). Steps to reproduce the behavior Start a new post. Tap the Add Media button. Long tap to select multiple images. Tap the checkmark to add the selected images to the post. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-71

report.summary: Async Media: Video not uploaded correctly after exiting Aztec editor
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior I expect that with async media uploads, when I exit the editor, the video will continue uploading in the post. Actual behavior In Aztec, if I exit the editor while uploading a video, the video is not uploaded correctly: The draft is uploaded with a reference to a local video file on the device. When I reopen the editor and tap on the video, it tells me the file is still uploading but the progress bar doesn't move and it never finishes the upload. I confirmed that the same video file uploads correctly if I remain in the editor during the upload; it's only a problem if I exit the editor before the upload finishes. Steps to reproduce the behavior Enable the Aztec editor. Start a new post. Add a video to the post. Before the video finishes uploading, exit the editor. Note that there is no message about "Uploading Media" on the post in the post list, and the draft is saved/uploaded to the server. Open the editor again. Tapping on the video or trying to switch to HTML mode indicates that the video is still uploading, but there is no sign that the upload is happening. In a browser, open the post and view it in HTML mode. Note that a reference to a local video on the device is included in the [video] shortcode. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-72

report.summary: Async Media: Error in page list calls it a "post" instead of a "page"
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior I expect that errors with pages will refer to a "page." Actual behavior If there is an error uploading media to a page, the error on the page list refers to it as a post: We were unable to upload this post's media. Please edit the post to try again. However, the system notification correctly refers to it as a page: Steps to reproduce the behavior Create a new page. Add media to the page. Exit the editor while the media is still uploading. Disconnect from the internet (e.g. go into airplane mode) and check the error on that page in the page list. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-72

report.summary: WPMediaUtils.getOptimizedMedia() is not guarded by AppPrefs.isImageOptimize()
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When the "Optimize Images" app setting is OFF the app should not resize images before adding to a post. Actual behavior App resizes images (to 3000px, 85% quality) even when the "Optimize Images" setting is OFF. Steps to reproduce the behavior Clean install the app Navigate to "Me > App Settings" and notice that the "Optimize Images" setting is turned off Using the debugger, insert a breakpoint in WPMediaUtils.getOptimizedMedia() Go create a new post and insert a local image. Notice the breakpoint being hit and the code continuing to resize the photo. Tested on [device], Android [version] Nexus 5X, Android v7.1.2

report.summary: HTML entities displayed on different screens
report.label: bug
report.description: I'll fix this on the FluxC side, but I'm keeping track of some screens here so we can test the PR is actually working.

report.summary: Aztec: Swiping over newly added image opens image settings
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior I expect that after I add an image to a post, I can tap to open the image settings. If I don't tap on the image, I can swipe over the image to move up/down in the editor. Actual behavior Immediately after adding an image, if I swipe to move up or down in the editor it opens the image settings instead. This happens no matter how quickly I swipe over the image. If I add an image and then tap somewhere else in the editor to place the cursor there, I can then swipe up and down normally without opening the image settings for the image I just added. This only happens in Aztec. If I add an image to the hybrid editor I can swipe in the editor without any issue. Steps to reproduce the behavior Enable the Aztec (Beta) editor in the app. Start a new post. Add one or more images to the post. Swipe up or down over the image you just added. Result: The image settings open. Tap somewhere else in the editor and then swipe. Result: The editor scrolls as expected. Screencast of the issue: https://cloudup.com/cLCZUHrR5p7 Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-75

report.summary: The image placeholders are missing
report.label: bug
report.description: Aztec editor is missing image placeholders when opening a post with unloaded images.

report.summary: Media Library - Overlays are missing when deleting items
report.label: bug
report.description: Deleting items from WP Media Library doesn't show the deleting overlay over them. There is basically no UI feedback on the taken and in progress action. See the video here: https://cloudup.com/cvVRVRt9h39 cc @nbradbury

report.summary: Reader: Right edge of post cut off in portrait view
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior I expect the full width of posts in the Reader to be visible in both portrait and landscape views. Actual behavior I can view the full width of posts in landscape view, but the post is wider than the visible area in portrait view so the right edge gets cut off: Steps to reproduce the behavior Open the Reader. Tap to open a post detail view. Rotate between portrait and landscape. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-75

report.summary: Login - "Logging in" progress dialog is never dismissed if you left the app during login
report.label: bug
report.description: If you switch to another app when the app is actually logging you to your site ( "Logging in" progress dialog is on the screen) there is no way to dismiss the progress dialog, and you are stuck on that screen. Doesn't matter how long you wait. Fix is to close the app and restart it from scratch. Once restarted the app, you are already logged to WP with the credentials given on the step above. I bet there is a receiver that is un-registered on backgrounding the app. To reproduce Clean app-> insert email -> choose insert password -> tap login -> progress dialog is on the screen. Left the app. Going back to WP and the progress dialog is always there.

report.summary: Unable to edit a draft post (changes fail to save)
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce the behavior Create a new post (whether via the web or the app) Save the post as a draft (do not publish) Navigate to the Posts list Open the draft post and make changes Tap Update Tap Update again, because nothing appeared to happen (separate bug? There's a crazy-long delay here before the UI responds to the button click) Expected behavior For the draft to be updated Actual behavior The card in the Posts List shows the new content briefly, but it disappears after the upload is "complete". The changes are lost, and never seen again on the device or on the web. Here's a video of it in action...but fair warning, it takes ~1 minute after making the updates before anything starts to happen, and then another ~1.5 minutes before the updated text disappears. Every piece of this takes a really long time, despite a healthy internet connection (tested at 8Mbps upload, 30Mbps down) https://cloudup.com/cKaxRoL-JTD The problem was seen using all three editors (Legacy / Visual / Beta). I ran through the test probably a dozen times, and was only able to successfully edit the draft once. I can't figure out what was different about that one attempt, but wanted to mention it. Tested on Nexus 6P, Android 8.0.0, wp alpha-79

report.summary: Aztec help icon misalignment
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior Aztec help icon should be horizontally aligned to the right and share the same vertical baseline as the Title hint Actual behavior The icon is misaligned Steps to reproduce the behavior start a new draft observe the misalignment Tested on [Nexus 9], Android [version]

report.summary: Editor: "add show more tag" button should be disabled
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior In the Editor, all buttons in the toolbar should be disabled when adding a picture using the media picker Actual behavior The "add show more" button is enabled Steps to reproduce the behavior start a new draft tap on the body area in the editor tap on the "add media" icon to launch the media picker observe the toolbar has the "add show more" button enabled Tested on [Nexus 9], Android [version]

report.summary: Async uploads: Posts are enqueued every time the user leaves the editor
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior If a Post is already enqueued to be uploaded, it should be uploaded once Actual behavior A copy of the Post is enqueued to be uploaded each time you enter and exit the editor. Steps to reproduce the behavior start a draft write something and include some media to make the effects visible exit the editor; the Post is enqueued to be uploaded when media is finished uploading enter the editor again, modify the text, and exit again a new copy of the Post is enqueued, but if the media is still uploading, we'll have 2 copies enqueued for the same Post (when only the latest one is all we need to upload) Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [8.0]

report.summary: Async media: Post list showing both progress and an error
report.label: bug
report.description: First reported by @nbradbury in this comment #6763 (comment) the post list was (correctly) showing that a post's media failed to upload yet the upload progress remained visible

report.summary: Site picker layout is broken in RTL
report.label: bug
report.description: Site picker layout is broken in RTL, the icons appear but not the text. Site menu is also half broken.

report.summary: Posts list: Retry option should be shown in the first button group
report.label: bug
report.description: First reported by @nbradbury in #6789 (comment) Expected behavior In branch issue/6407-retry-failed-post-from-post-list (to be merged in issue/6389-upload-service-notification) we are adding a Retry button in the Posts list for failed uploading Posts. This should be always shown along with the error label (it makes sense to show and error and offering an action to solve it). Actual behavior On small screens, the Retry button is only shown in the second row (which is hidden and is only shown after tapping the More button), while the error label is shown right away, thus generating a lack of intuitivity. It should be shown along with the error label. Steps to reproduce the behavior run the app on a small screen go to the Posts list start a new draft and write something, include a media item go back to the Posts list turn airplane mode ON to trigger the error see the error is shown in the Posts list, but no Retry button is shown unless you tap on More. Tested on [Samsung S3], Android [4.1.1]

report.summary: Async media: force stop leaves inconsistent state
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior If the app is stopped while an upload is happening, it should recover gracefully next time it's opened. Actual behavior A post that was uploading in the middle of the app being stopped shows as "normal" in the Posts list, but entering the editor shows the cancelled media. Steps to reproduce the behavior start a draft with multiple media force stop the app start the app again see the post is not marked failed edit it see all media is marked failed exit the editor see the post list still doesn’t show the Post as failed Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [8.0]

report.summary: Async media retry: Post list item not showing right label / first button row
report.label: bug
report.description: Originally reported in #6795 (comment) Expected behavior Tapping on Retry on a failed Post list item should reset its label and first button row to the normal/uploading state Actual behavior The progress bar is shown but both the label and the Retry button are still shown. Steps to reproduce the behavior Steps to reproduce: start a new draft include some media items exit the editor turn airplane mode ON see the error appear tap on Retry on the failed Post list item observe the uploading re-starts (notifications appear, etc.) and the progress bar appears and starts getting updates, but both the status label and button rows stay the same (i.e. in the "error/retry" state) Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [8.0]

report.summary: Async + Aztec: editing a Post with media produced in the Visual editor shows strange behavior
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior Opening a Post with media written in the Visual editor should show the same way on Aztec Actual behavior Found these weird question marks that respond to touch and offer a dialog with some HTML in them? Steps to reproduce the behavior set visual editor start draft and include some media items exit the editor turn airplane mode ON set editor to Beta turn airplane mode OFF go to posts list tap on RETRY see the uploads start edit the post see the question marks tap on them Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [8.0]

report.summary: Async media: count should decrement on item deletion while editing
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior When editing on Aztec with media being uploaded, deleting an image that is being uploaded should decrement the count in the foreground progress notification accordingly Actual behavior No changes to the totals are seen in the foreground notification (also not sure whether the upload is cancelled) Steps to reproduce the behavior start a new draft insert 4 media items exit the editor, verify the progress notifications says 4 items are being uploaded open the editor, position the cursor to the right of an image being uploaded hit backspace observe the foreground notification did not count one less item as it should have, and the progress bar jumps to almost at 100% Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [8.0]

report.summary: Async media crash when cancelling notifications
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior The app shouldn't crash :) Actual behavior When adding some media to a draft, then exiting the editor, quickly tapping trash on such Post and quickly after exiting the Posts list screen, the PostActivity instance could get killed before the snackbar callback for post deletion gets run, thus offering no valid Context for the methods called in there. The user reported empty content, even though the publication ends without any errors. Tested on wp-android 8.4.1 , SM-G386T1 running Android 4.4.2

report.summary: Signup: Password field misaligned with icons overlapping text
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior I expect all of the signup fields to be aligned with an icon on the left and the text field to the right of the icon. Actual behavior The password text field is too far left, with the icons (padlock and eye) overlapping the text. Screenshot Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-86

report.summary: Editor: Aztec (beta) editor isn't correctly enabled after login
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior I expect that if I have "Beta" set as the editor type in the app, Aztec will be enabled. Actual behavior Even if I have previously selected the "Beta" editor type, and the app settings shows "Beta" as the selected editor type, the hybrid editor appears after logging in to an account. Steps to reproduce the behavior To start, make sure that "Beta" is selected as the editor type (in Me > App Settings) and Aztec is showing up when you open the editor. Log out of the app. Log in to the app using the same account. Open Me > App Settings and confirm that "Beta" is still selected. Start a new post. Result: The hybrid editor is loaded. To enable the Aztec editor at this point: Go back to Me > App Settings. Select a different editor type (e.g. "Visual"). Select the "Beta" editor type again. Start a new post and confirm Aztec is now enabled. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-86 and in WPAndroid develop in an emulator

report.summary: Aztec: placeholder not sized correctly when failed downloading
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected Uploading a video should always keep the thumbnail and thumbnail placeholder the same size. Observed When uploading a video, the placeholder sometimes doesn’t appear and shows a blank space instead on slow a connection Reproduced start a draft post insert a video from the media library, see the thumbnail is shown alright exit the post edit the post again see the camera image for “loading” placeholder is shown (it should be showing the thumbnail), and the “play” icon is shown on top of it (covering the camera loading image) once the placeholder is "done" downloading, but it FAILS to do so, a blank space “white placeholder” takes up a lot of the screen. see the thumbnail is not shown but rather a blank space appears, with a white “play” icon in the center rotate the screen, see the big placeholder space is taken by a blank space and this looks broken Tested [Google Pixel] on [Android 8.0] with [alpha-97]

report.summary: Aztec Media Placeholders - Make sure thumbnails are resized accordingly to the editor viewport size
report.label: bug
report.description: We should make sure that Media added to Aztec are properly resized to fit the editor viewport size. Also, we should make sure the same size is used during the uploading process, and failures. See #6942 At the moment picture have different sizes when uploaded from the device, or opened a pre-existing post. Note 1: When the device is rotated we should resize them as well. Note 2: Make sure to not upsample pictures.

report.summary: Editor: Changes lost when the only change is adding media from the media library
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior I expect any changes to a post to be saved when I exit the editor or tap the "Update" button in the editor. Actual behavior If the only changes to a saved post are adding media from the media library, the changes are not saved. Steps to reproduce the behavior Start a new post. Add some content to the post. Save the draft. Open the post in the editor again. Add media (video or photo) from the media library. Tap the back arrow. Note that autosave does not happen. Open the post in the editor again. Note that the media has disappeared. Add media (video or photo) from the media library again. Tap the "Update" button. Open the post in the editor again. Note that the media has disappeared again. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1

report.summary: Aztec: new lines are lost in Calypso mode
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected New lines should be kept at all times Observed New lines are gone after a failed media item is processed by AztecTextParser when a media item is finished uploading Steps to reproduce the behavior start a new draft write some text entering “ENTER” on purpose, like: “something” “another thing” “bla bla” “bla bla” “bla bla” “bla bla” insert some media items exit the editor while media items are uploading either wait until uploads finish, or if inpatient make the uploads fail, maybe by turning airplane mode ON see the post show the error in the post list now open the Post see all new lines are gone Tested on [Google Nexus 6], Android [5.1.0 API 22]

report.summary: Editor: Media picker allows adding videos to galleries
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior I expect that when I multi-select in the media picker from my site's Media Library, and one or more selections are videos, the selections will be added as individual photos/videos to the post. (This is the Calypso behavior.) Actual behavior When I multi-select in the media picker from my site's Media Library, I am always offered the option to create a gallery. All of the videos are added to the gallery shortcode, but they don't appear in the published gallery (or in Calypso when editing the post on the web). The same behavior occurs in both Aztec and the hybrid editor. Steps to reproduce the behavior Start a new post. Select the Add Media button. Select the Media Library as the media source. Select multiple media items, including at least one video. Confirm your selection. Note that the "Add multiple photos" dialog appears, with the options to "Add individually" or "Add as gallery." Select "Add as gallery." Note that the gallery shortcode includes the video(s) you selected. Save or publish the post and view it. Note that only the images appear in the gallery. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-87

report.summary: Aztec: Highlighting for list toolbar button is toggled without selecting a list style
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior I expect the list toolbar button to be highlighted only if you select a list style. Actual behavior The highlighting for the list toolbar button is toggled when you first tap on it, and stays highlighted even if you don't select a list style. The highlighting only toggles off when you start typing. Steps to reproduce the behavior Start a new post in Aztec. Tap the list toolbar button. Note that the button is highlighted. Without selecting a list style, tap another toolbar button or tap into the editor. Note that the button is still highlighted. Start typing. Note that now the toolbar highlighting is toggled off. This can also cause the highlighting for the list toolbar button to be toggled off even when a list style is selected: Start a new post in Aztec. Tap the list toolbar button. Note that the button is highlighted. Without selecting a list style, tap into the editor. Note that the button is still highlighted. Tap the list toolbar button again. Note that the button highlighting is toggled off. Select a list style. Start typing. Note that the toolbar highlighting is still toggled off, even though the list style is applied to the text. Tested on Nexus 9, Android 7.1.1, WPAndroid alpha-87

report.summary: Aztec / media: deleting an image triggers an error notification (it shouldn't)
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior Deleting an image in the Aztec Editor should be allowed and the progress notification either decremented or dismissed if only 1 image being uploaded. Actual behavior When an image that is being uploaded is deleted (using backspace) in the Editor, an error notification reading "1 file not uploaded" is shown, when it shouldn't be shown because it was actively deleted by the uer. Steps to reproduce the behavior Start a draft with a video, while its being uploaded, delete it from aztec by positioning the cursor on the right of the image and hit BACKSPACE. See the error notification says “1 file not uploaded”. It shouldn’t show an error, as it was deleted by the user. Tested on [Google Pixel], Android [8.0]

report.summary: Plugins: Unable to delete plugin, leads to bad active status
report.label: bug
report.description: Expected behavior To be able to delete a plugin Actual behavior The plugin deactivated, but failed to remove: Steps to reproduce the behavior I created a new site on Pressable and connected it via Jetpack I loaded the site in the app and navigated to Plugins I opened Akismet and attempted to Remove it The plugin was deactivated, but threw the above error on delete. Subsequent attempts to delete all throw the same error. Now the plugin says deactivated in the app and wp-admin agrees. I tried re-activating it from the app, and now the app thinks it's active but wp-admin says it's not. The application logs don't show anything relevant. Tested on Pixel 2 XL, Android 8.1, wp-android alpha-90
